Seethe Sage and Bay leaues ana one ounce in iii. pintes of Ale, with iii. ounces of sugar, and one spoonefull of pepper to a pint, and streine and drinke it before the fitte against the Feuer. Sleepe to cause, apply powder of Bay berries to thy head. Gout, boneshaw and swellings, seethe the leaues of Bayes and Iuie with oyle Oliue, and take out the leaues, anoint with the oyle. Powder of Bayes, Tormentill Myrrhe, ana like much eaten fasting, purgeth the head, voideth all humors rawe meates, and suffereth no corruption in the body nor stomake. If a man drinke it and brooke it not, he shall die: but if he brooke it, he shall liue. Ache in the backe, kidneis, or limmes, drinke powder of nine Bayes morning and euening. For one that is stricken with the Fayrie, spread oyle de Bay on a linnen cloth, and lay it aboue the sore, if it be beneath the heart, to keepe it downeward, and none vpon the sore, for that will driue it into euery part of the body: but if the sore be aboue the heart, apply it beneath the sore, and to the nape of the necke. Face to be white, anoint with freshe Barrowes grease, the white of an egge, and a litle powder of Bayes. Windinesse, make powder of Bayes and Antes egges, and vse it. Yexing, or hickit, when it commeth of colde, annoint it with oyle de Baye warme. Eares deafe, put in oyle de Bay with as much vnguentum Agrippae. Chollike and stitche, drinke powder of Bayes Ginger, and also vse it in meates. Feuer shaking, mixe powder of Bayes Pepper, and Peniroyall, of eche one and twentie graines with scommed hony, and take a spoonefull morning and euening. boyle foure Bayes in wine, and holde thereof in thy mouth. For griping and wringing in the belly, seethe Bayes and Ote branne in wine, and apply it, also drinke the wine. Sickenesse of the flanke, drinke three or foure Bayes with white Wine, or Ale. For griefes of the lunges, liuer, and milte, drinke powder of Bayes, Fenigreeke, and Pepper euery morning one spoonefull. Cough greefes of the breast, boyle powder of three Bayes with hony and wine, and drinke it when thou goest to bed. Skinne to be white, mixe Swines grease vnsalted with the white of an egge halfe sodden, beat them well together with a little powder of Bayes, anoint. Kidneis and reines griefes, stampe the leaues well, and boile them in wine, til it be thicke, and then punne them againe, apply them. Bladder paine, boyle the leaues in water and apply them. Itch, stamp the rootes with salt and bread, and anoynt therewith. Headach, make powder of Bayes, halfe a dram of Scamony, and Saffron one dram, mixe them with vineger of Roses and anoynt therewith. Bowels or guts paine, seethe the leaues in water and drinke it. Plague, drink one spoonefull of powder of the ripe Beries some salt with vineger and water warme in a hote Feuer, but in wine in a cold Feuer, and couer thee well to sweat and sleepe and be whole. The Baytree is not stricken with lightning nor euill from heauen. The branches defend from mothes, wormes and corruption both clothes and bookes. The Beries taken with wine is good against all poyson, venom, and venomous bitings. The powder of them mixt with hony or some syrup, and often licked and kept in the mouth, is good for them that waxe dry and are in a consumption, and for difficultie of breathing and ouercharged with flegme in the breast. The decoction thereof in wine, or the iuice thereof dropt into the eares, helpeth their deafenes and noyse. The Beries are good in medicines to refresh them that are tyred and weary, for cramps and drawings of the the sinewes. Moyst and dry scuruinesse, being applyed with oyle or oyntments seruing to that vse. The oyle of Bayberies is of the same vertue, and also serueth against bruses blew marks. The barke of the roote drunke with wine, prouoketh vrine, breaketh the stone, and driueth it foorth and the grauell also, and openeth the stopping of the liuer, milte, and all other stoppings of the inner partes. Wherefore it is good against the Iaundes that is inueterate and rooted, the hardnesse of the milt, the beginning of the dropsie, and to prouoke termes. Anoint all cold aches with oyle de Bay, Aqua vitae. The broth of Bay leaues is good to sit in for the diseases of the mother bladder. The greene leaues stampt, heale the stingings of Bees and Wasps. The same with parched Barly and bread, swage all inflamations and hote burnings. But if they be drunke, they make all that is in the stomake to go foorth by vomite. Bayes are good in an electuarie with hony or sodden with Malmesie against the consumption, shortnesse of breath, and all reumes that fall vpon the lungs. The bark of the root breaketh the stone, and is perilous for women with child, halfe a dram thereof drunke with wine is good for the griefes of the liuer. oyle of Bayes is good for the head ach, the Morphue, the singing in the eares, and it causeth vomite. The oyle de Bay is best that is fresh and bitter and sharpe: it hath power to soften and to open the breath holes of the veines, it driueth away wearinesse. There is no better remedie against the diseases of the sinewes, coldes, falling downe of humors, ache in the eares, diseases of the kidneys that come of colde, then this oyle is, if it bee layd too, but if it be drunke, it prouoketh vomite, it is good also for the ache of the liuer, The Megrim that commeth of colde cause, the paine of the milt, of the great gut, and of the mother, and for the scalles and skurfes, wormes, scabbes, wheales, and plookes. The powder of the Berries licked in with hony, or the pappe of raisins, are good against the consumption, straitnesse of breath, all griefes of the breast comming of reume, and for the torments of the belly. The berries bruised are good against the stingings of Scorpions. The berries being cleane husked, powdred, steeped in wine and drunke, purgeth women after their childebirth, and taketh away their torments. The iuice of the berries taketh away filthie skurfe, and with olde wine and Rose oyle, it helpeth the ache and deafenesse of the eares. The oyle is good for all colde aches, the Sciatica and colde Agues. Eares deafe and noyse, put in the iuice of the leaues. Reume, cough, and hoarsenesse, take vp the vapour of Bayes in water. Vomiting and lothing, stampe Bayes, Masticke, and Cummin ana one ounce, with the iuice of Rue, and apply it to the stomacke with tow. Chollike, Ilyake, and windinesse of the stomacke, apply Bay leaues and Cummin to the stomake. To cleanse the Matrixe, to voyd the paine thereof, and to cause conception, stand ouer the fume of powder of Bayes layd on hote coales, it causeth deliuerance. Gout, seeth the leaues in water, and mixe it with purselaine water, and wash therewith. Feuer quotidian, take two peny weight of the powder of the berries with a soft egge, or broth before the fit. Heart griefes, seeth Bayes in white wine and drinke it. finely, and temper them with common oyle, and heate them ouer the fire often: but seeth it not, and when it is greene, vse it. Breast incumbred, take halfe a spoonefull of powder of Bayes with pottage, or drinke to cleanse and purge downeward marueilously. Feuers, vse powder of Alysander, Bayes, and Time in brothes. Cough of colde, anoint the chest with oyle de Bay. Chollike and Iliake, drinke powder of nine or twelue Bayes with wine. Eyes griefes, seeth Bay leaues in wine and Foment therewith. Flowers to stop, lay Ginger, Bay leaues, and Sauin on coales, and receiue vp the fume thereof through a funnill. Matrixe fallen out, drinke powder of Bay leaues, Harts horne, and Myrrhe ana like much, with Wine or Ale. Palsie vniuersall, eate oyle of Bayes with crums of bread hote. Bay: Reines ach, boyle the leaues in wine, till they be coagulated, and apply it by it selfe, or fryed with oyle. Ach in the stomacke and small guts: Mixe two parts of Bayes, and one part of Cummin with Hony, and plaster it to thy stomacke. Head apostume, apply powder of Bayes and Cummin to the head. Flankes griefes generall, drinke powder of nine leaues morning and euening. Itch, mixe powder of Frankincense, with oyle of Bay, and anoint therewith. To make oyle of Bay, stampe the leaues, grinde them, and let them stand two or three dayes, then seeth it and streine it, and that which is aboue, is the oyle. Sinewes shortened, seeth a blacke sheepes head with Bay leaues, Sage, and Camomile stamped, till it be well sodden, then streine it, and anoint therewith. greene oyntment, take Bay leaues, Rue, and Wormewood ana one pound, Sheepes tallow three pound, mixe them well, and put thereto three pintes of Sallet oyle, and let it stand two dayes, then heate it, and stirre it till the herbes bee somewhat hard, then streine it and vse it. Oyle of Bayes, stampe the greene Beries, and seeth them, and streine it and vse it, or stampe the berries leaues, streine it, and keepe it in a glasse: or stampe the ripe and fresh Beries, and presse out the oyle: it is good against the Iliake, chollike, and Sciatica. Make oyle of Iuy Beries in like sort, which is good in colde causes, especially against colde ioynt aches. Haire falling Hicket Hoarcenesse Hote griefes Iaundes olde Ilyak pas. BArberie: the greene leaues are good in meates for sause, as Sorrell to refresh and cause appetite, and is good for them that bee hote and vext with the burning Ague. The fruite stop the lask and all superfluous fluxes of women, and all vnnaturall fluxe of blood. The roote steeped in lee, maketh the haire yelowe being often washed therewith. The conserue thereof is good against all fluxes both red and white, it stoppeth the termes and comforteth the stomake and liuer, and so doeth the water of the flowers and leaues distilled in May. The ripe fruite stamped and applyed, breaketh and healeth all hote apostumes, and taketh away the paine. Chollik, take halfe a glasse or lesse of the iuice of the ripe Beries, with as much powder of red Corall as will lye on two groats, and drinke it. Seethe Barberies in Whay, and drinke it for the heate of the liuer. To heale an olde fluxe of the mother, and to scoure the matrix, drinke the iuice of Barberies: but for that fluxe and all others, drinke the Barberies themselues. Heart faint, make pottage with Barberies and Barley meale, and eate them. Stomake chollerik and thirstie, and to stop the fluxe, and cause appetite, eate as much as a Wallnut of conserue of Barberies. Iaundes yelow, seethe as much of the Bark as a Wallnut in a pinte of water bound in a cloth, and coole it, and drinke it morning and euening a good draught, and vse also thereof in thy drinke. Set a quart of the Beries on the fire till they be soft, then streine them and put thereto thrise their waight in Sugar, and seethe it till it be incorporated, and vse it. Heart faint Iaundes Liuer hote Matrix fluxe Pricks Stomake hote Thirst Whites BArley: Bake a cake of Barley flower, and vineger, burne to coles, and rub the teeth therewith to cleanse them. Mixe newe Pigeons doung and Barley meale, with vineger, and apply it to the Shingles three dayes, and then renew it if neede be. Boyle Barley and Lycoras in water, and vse it to helpe the Feuer and impostumes of the breast and short ribs. The meale mixt with vineger and egs and applyed to impostumes, letteth them from growing any further. plaster of the meale with Turpentine, hony and Lilie rootes, softneth and ripeneth impostumes. For Felons and rancklings, seethe meale of Linseede and Barley in Ale, and apply it. Headach: Mixe Barley meale with Hartes grease, and the iuice of Sorrell, and apply it to the temples. Breast griefes, make pottage with Barley meale, Baulme, Mynt and water, and vse it. Chafing of the flanke, or shares: Anoynt with oyle of Roses, and the meale of Beanes, Fitches, and Barley. To open a wound that is closed, and too soone whole. Take hony, and the whites of egs of eche like much, and a litle Barley meale, and anoynt therewith three or foure times a day. For a swelling, frye Barley meale and powder of Cummin with hony, and apply it. Seethe Barley with ten times so much water of an Easterne spring, with a slowe fire twelue houres, till it haue the colour of Beere, and drinke thereof foure ounces at once against chollerike heate, obstructions to mooue sweate and vrine, to cause sleepe, to alay thirst, to nourish, for all griefes of the breast, and for Burning agues, to sweate take it warme, to lay thirst, take it colde sometimes with Sugar, sometimes without. It helpeth the heate and rednesse of the vrine and the cough comming of heate. Cough, make pottage with Barley and butter and eate it: and drinke Barley water with Licoras. To dry vp a reume, seethe asshes of Barley chaffe in water, and set thy feete and legs ouer it, and couer thee well to sweate, and after wash thy legs and handes vp to the knees and elboes, and dry them, and lye downe in thy bed warme, and put a tent of Labdanum into thy nose, &c. Burning or scalding, Gout, apply Barley meale, with the iuice of Nightshade or vineger. Headach: apply Barley meale with Frankincense, and the white of an egge two dayes with a paper, it helpeth the Megrim. To make haires growe where thou wilt, burne Barley bread with Salt, and punne it with Barrowes grease, anoynt. Apostumes hote and Feuerous, apply a plaister of Barley meale, Mallowes, whites of egs, and fresh grease. Nose bleeding, stampe Ribwort, and Housleek with Barley meale, and apply it about thy necke. Emerods, steep crums of Barley bread in womans milk or Goats milke, with the yolke of an egge and Saffron, and apply it to voyde the paine. Headach of choller, drink water sodden with Barly, hold Sugar Candy in thy mouth. For griefes of the liuer, and the Iaundes, eate the pap of Barley sodden with water butter, drink Barley water to restore the taste. Loynes apostumed, stamp Barley meale three ounces, Figs two ounces, and the iuice of Mallowes sixe ounces, and apply it. Feuers, vse Barley water to bedward, and apply as much butter as a beane to thy nauill. Face swolne, seethe cleane Barley into pappe, and apply it hote. Cods and yarde swollen, boyle Barley meale and Cummin, and apply it. Freckles, seethe flower of Beanes, and Barley in womans milke, and apply it. Eyes watring, stampe Camphire with Barley meale, the yolke of an egge, and a little vineger, and apply it. Eyes hurt or brused, seethe Red Roses in water, and stamp them with Barley meale, and the yolke of a rawe egge, or apply Barley meale with the iuice of Mallowes and the yolke of an egge. For the Hoste: Mixe Barley meale and Salt ana with Butter, and make pellets thereof, as much as halfe a Wallnut, and eate two of them in the morning fasting. Breast griefes, seethe Barley meale in water, and put Fresh butter to it, and eate it often. Breast flegme: seethe Isope, fat Figges, Lycoras, and Barley in water, and drinke it. right side, apply a plaister of Barley meale, vineger, the iuice of Houseleeke, and Morell, and anoynt the side with the iuice of Penyroyall. Cods swollen, melt Sheepes sewet in Red wine, and put thereto Barley meale, and apply it. Feuer quarten: on the sicke day eate a hote cake of Barley meale, and drink thereto a good draught of Red wine, before the sit. And then stampe foure Plants of Plantine with their leaues, and streme them with White wine, and foure spoonefuls of colde water, and drinke thereof before the fitt take thee. frye Sheepes tallowe with Goats doung, and Barley meale, and apply it. Apostume to breake, apply Barley meale with hony, and the iuice of Smallach or of Wormwood. Vse Barley meale in all medicines for Apostumes and Impostumes. Chollik and Ilyake: apply a plaister of Barley meale, Wormewood, vineger hony. Teeth to be white: rub them with Barley meale, hony and salt. Legs swollen: Mixe the iuice of Wallwort with Waxe, vineger and Barley meale, of eche like much, and apply it. Morphue, vse a bath of Barley chaffe, and make fine powder of Barley meale, Fenegrek, and Boras of eche like much. Mixe it with the iuice of an Onyon, and cleare hony, and anoynt therewith. Chollik: seethe meale of Linseede, and Barley, with oyle of Camomill, and apply it hote to the nauill. and swelling, seethe Barley branne with wine and hony, and apply it. Wilde fire and creeping vlcers, and all burnings, frye Barley meale with oyle, and apply it. Boyle Barley meale, with Figs in honyed water, to dissolue swellings, both hot and colde, and with Pitch, Rosin, and Pigeons doung, to ripen all hard swellings, with Tarre, oyle and waxe, and the vrine of a childe to digest and rypen the hard swellings of the necke, called Strumae. The same with Melilot, and the heads of Poppy, swageth the ach of the side, and with Linseede, Fenegrek Rue, and it is good to be layd to the paine and windinesse of the belly and guts. Barley giuen with Myrtles or wine, or wilde tart Peares, or with Brambles, or with the rynde of a Pomegranate, stoppeth the running of the belly. Plaisters made with Barley meale: is good against the scurfe and leapry. The same mixt with vineger, or Quinces, swageth hote inflamations of the Gout. ioynts, it stayeth the falling downe of reume and humours into them. The bread thereof doeth not nourish so well as the bread of Wheate or Spelt: the greatest and whitest is the best. Take Barly hulled one pound brused, seethe it in ten pound of water in a vessell of earth or tinne close stopt to the one halfe, coole it, and seethe it and drinke thereof to quench hote burning choller in vehement Feuers. You may put to it the seeds of white Poppy and Letuce, not onely to coole, but also to cause sleepe. And to clense the lungs, shortnesse of breath, hoarsenesse: Put in Figs, Lycoras, Reasins of the sunne, Anniseeds, and a little Isope with Sugar, and seethe all, and let it stand close couered till it be colde, then streine it and vse it. Seethe Barley meale, Linseede, Fenegrek, and the iuice of Rue with Malmesey, and apply it warme to the belly, to voyde the swelling and paine of the guts. Seethe the meale with vineger, to swage the hote burning Gout, all hote Inflamations of the body. Seethe the Meale in hony with Rosin, and the iuice of Celandine, to heale olde rotten sores. With oyle meale of Fenegrek, to swage the swelling of the stomake. Temper the meale with hony and Poppy, to helpe the swelling heate of the priuities and paine of the side. Seethe Barley with Fennell, and sup it to increase milke greatly. With Mellilot and Poppy heads, it swageth the paine of the side. Giue Barley halfe sodden to Hens to make them lay egs the oftener and greater. Lye three dayes three nightes in thy bed couered with sodden Barley, to cure the Dropsie perfectly, though the belly be greatly swollen. Seethe Barley, dry Beanes, and Lycoras, cut small, of eche like much, in water: and drinke thereof first and last fiue dayes or more, to destroy any Impostume, and to cast it out. Mixe asshes of burned Barley with burned Roch Allom and vse it to galde Horses backes: and for Fistulaes, and to eate out dead flesh, but as it shall heale, put in more Barley and lesse Allom. Burne Barley bread with Salt, and mixe it with Bores grease, and anoynt what place thou wilt, and haires will growe there. Seethe strong Ale with a gentle fire till it be thicke, and vse it to olde rotten sores and aches. Consumption Cough hote Dropsie Eyes watring and hurts Emerodes Face swolne Fellons Feuers Hennes to lay Horcenesse Horsebacke sore Iaundies Iliake passion Impostume Inflammation Iointes griefes Kernels Leapry Liuer griefes (see breast) Milke to increase Morphue Necke swolne Nose bleeding Obstructions Pusands Thirst Throte kernell Vrine hote stopt Wilde fire Woundes Yard swolne BAsill: speech lost, mixe the seedes with wine, and drinke, and holde thereof in thy mouth. Short winded, drinke halfe an ounce of the iuice, with halfe a scruple of Saffron. Swooning, sleepe Basill in wine or Rose water, and drinke it. Feuer quarten, certian, and quotidian, the stitch, and stopping of the vrine, stuffe a Henne with Parsly and Basill, and the substance of a rawe egge, and bake her in paste, and eate thereof dayly, and no other meate. The smell of Basill comforteth the braine, but it hurteth a weake braine. The seedes are gathered in Iuly. The leaues sodden and drunke, doe take away the swimming of the head, and so doth the hearbe steeped a night in wine and drunke, The hearbe sodden in wine, doeth cause a pleasant smell, heateth a colde stomake, and helpeth digestion. The powder of the hearbe drunke with the iuice of Sloes eight dayes togeather, doeth helpe an outward rupture. Seethe the hearbe in water, and foment the matrixe therewith, to cleanse it and drawe downe the termes. To cause deliuerance, and bring downe the secondines, drinke the iuice of Basill. Seethe Basill in wine and oyle, and applye it to the fundament to ease the often desire to goe to the stoole. Boyle it in raine water, and drinke it with a little powder of the iuice of Sloes, to helpe the flixe comming of colde. Wartes to rise vp by the rootes, mixe the seedes with shoomakers blacke, and apply it. Drinke the seedes in wine to auoide all melancholy sadnesse, and to cause boldnesse and mirth. Basill helpeth the stomake, digesteth hard meates, and is good for the heart and liuer. Lungs inflamed, stamped Basill with Barsey meale and vineger, and applye it outwardly. Braine and nose stopt, and to purge and stay reumes, smell to Basill. Eyes mistie and running, droppe in the iuice, or eate the hearbe. Vse drye Basill in thy meates, and wines, and drinkes. Seethe it in wine, and vse it against shortnesse of breathe, the olde cough, to expell grosse humors, vrine, and termes, morning and euening as Peniroyall. Vse it in sessions for womens griefes, as Peniroyall and Mintes, &c. Seethe it in wine with Spikenard, and drinke it against dropsies; windes, flegmes, coldnesse of the heart, and hardnesse of the stomake. Smell to it to comfort the braine and heart: but the vse of it in meates decayeth the sight. It is not much to be vsed inwardly nor outwardly. Drinke Basill with vineger to voide windinesse, to stoppe vomiting, to prouoke vrine, and for the Dropsie and Iaundies. Eyes dull, and reumatike, and running, drappe in the iuice. If thou beest hurt with a scorpion, eate Basill the same day, and it shall not hurt thee. Basill softeneth the belly, mooueth the spirites, expelleth vrine, and breedeth milke. The seede drunke, is good for them that are puft vp, with winde, that breede melancholy, and cannot make water. The seedes or leaues put into the nose, cause sneesing: but when thou sneesest, shut thine eyes. Eate Basill, and no venemous thing shall hurt thee that day. To heale a streyning, boyle it tender with vineger and oyle, and anoynt or bathe the place therewith. Milke to cause Myrth to cause Mother cleansing Nose stopt Reume Seconds to cause Sneesing to cause DRinke it in wine against all venemous bitings and stingings, and to comfort the heart, and expell melancholly and sadnesse: it is good for all things that Horehound is good for, but it is much weaker. Bee hiues being rubbed therewith, it keepeth the Bees together, and causeth other to come to them. The common Balme is good for the strangling of the mother, being eaten or smelled vnto. The iuice put into greene woundes doeth glewe and heale them vp. Seethe Balme in white wine, and drinke iii. or iiii. mornings together to purge the breast, to helpe the shortnesse of winde, to comfort the heart, to driue away dumpish heauinesse, to helpe the falling sicknesse, and all other diseases. Teeth aking, wash with the iuice or broth of it. Vse it with hony in an Electuarie for the gnawing of the belly shortnesse of winde. It skowreth fores being applied, swageth the paines of the ioynts. houres in white wine, and distill it in a glasse for the torments of women, the strangling of the mother, wringing at the heart, &c. iiii. spoonefull at once. Seethe Balme with Cammomile flowers in a bag, in wine or water, and presse it, and apply it hote to the paines of the matrix, to make it tarrie in the place, and put it in to keepe it from falling downe. The water thereof healeth all skabs, pushes, and venemous bitings of serpents, spiders, and mad dogges. clearenesse, and laid vpon meate, it keepeth it from flies. Nothing doth more comfort the heart, then the decoction thereof, or the water. Burrage water and fine muske sodden in a cleane vessell and drunke when the heart is weake, it helpeth the hickit. Stampe it with nuts and hony, and apply it to cleare the sight. Distill it against melancholy, with Burrage, Buglosse, and Hysope, and vse it. Make Ale or Wine thereof as of Sage, for the griefes of the lungs and chest, and to cause a good colour: but there would be put one ounce of good Licoras shauen to it. Eyes to be cleare, to auoide fumes from the braine, stampe Balme, Rosemary ana one handfull, streine them with a quart of Ale, and drinke thereof morning euening. Seeth of eche one handfull with a quart of milke, as it commeth from the Rowe, and drinke thereof hote morning and euening dayly with some of a grated Nutmeg euery day a quart as hote as may be suffered, and anoint with the oyntment of Lauender: it auoideth the causes of and helpeth the griefe. houres or more in Ale or Beere, and drinke thereof morning and euening. For giddinesse of the head, stampe it with oyle and apply it: and doe the same for the eyes. For the comming out of the matrix, drinke the powder of it with wine, and for the prefocation, drinke the distilled water of it. Vrine dropping, seethe with in good wine, and drinke it, and apply the herbe to thy bladder. For them that haue vtterly lost their hearing, drop it into their eares. For the or colde goute at the bone, which destroyeth the marrowe, drinke the iuice of it with halfe as much Feuerfewe with stale Ale ix. dayes, stampe the leaues of Popler and Feuerfew with clarified butter and olde oile Oliue, and apply it sixe times. Ache, shread Broome flowers, Balme, and Feuerfewe ana one handfull, and seeth them in a little May butter, and keepe it, and anoint therewith by the fire, and be whole. Falling sicknesse, drinke Balme water with Treacle to cure it. Breast to purge Chest griefes Chollike Colour to be good Deafenesse Eyes to cleare Heart wringing Head giddie Hickit Iointe paines Kernels Matrixe paines Mother Mouth vlcers Skabbe Sores Squincie Sweate to preserue from Termes to prouoke Vomiting to stop Vrine dropping Wenne Winde short BEanes, put the flowers into a close glasse in the hote Sunne, and it will turne to an oyle, good for the saulsflegme. Felon ache, seethe Beanes till they be tender, and grinde them to apply them. Sinowes rankling and swelling, seethe Beane meale long in white wine till it be thicke, and put thereto some hony, and apply it till it be whole. Wounds to heale, mixe red Coleworts, Garlike, Beane flowre, the white of an egge, and faire grease, and heate it, and apply it. Paps ache, and all other ache, apply Beane meale with yolkes of egs. Stone, stampe young greene Beanes as small as Peason, and distill them, and drinke the water. Cods swollen, seethe Beane meale with hony and Cummin, apply it. Face or skin to be white, doe off the huskes of Beanes steepe them in vineger or wine houres, then drie them in the sunne, and mixe their powder with a Lilly roote, and temper them with water luke warme, wash therewith to bee ward to voide al slime and spots. Chollike, drinke the distilled water of Beane cods, iii. or iiii. times. Whites to stop, seeth it in the milke of a Cow to pap, and put thereto clarified hony, cloues, mace, and saffron, and eate thereof warme as often as neede is. boyle powder of parched Beanes in ale with sugar, drinke it as hote as may be suffered. Haire not to grow, mixe the bran of Beanes with a childes vrine, and anoint. Swellings, seeth Beane flowre in vineger, till it be thicke, and apply it hote. Stomake hote, mixe the meale of Beanes Lynseede, with the white of an egge, and apply it colde to the stomake. Haires to voide, vse Beane meale in steade of sope dayly. Fundament figge, make powder of Beanes, Geniper berries, and Pepper, of eache like much, and drinke it morning and euening. Apost. to ripen, apply Beane meale with hony vpon vnwasht wooll. Cods swollen, apply Beane meale with vineger colde, or stampe greene Beanes with hony, and apply them colde. Skull broken, take ye seedes of Pla~ten iii. ounces, of sharpe leaued Dock iiii. ounces, meale of blacke Beanes, as much as you will, stampe them well, and seethe them in very strong wine, and apply thereof morning and euening. Colde apost. of the cods, apply Beane meale with ye pulp of raisins, hony powder of Cummin. Distill the flowers before they be yellowe, in Balneo Mariae, and droppe thereof into the eyes that are red dropping at night. Haire not to growe, seethe them in water, wash dayly therewith, or stampe ye huskes or skins of greene Beanes, and apply it. Fluxe, seethe greene Beanes, pods and all in water vineger, eate them al. Skin to be faire, wash with water of the blossoms. Flux to stoppe, drye Beanes ouer the fire, seeth good store of the flowre of them with a quarte of Ale, and eate thereof hote at night. Head giddie, and dasling of the eyes, bruise hulled Beanes with the white of an Egge, and apply it. Flux, seeth Beanes in vineger, and eate them, or apply them to the nauel. Cods swolne, apply Beane flowre with the iuice of Wallwort and common oyle. Lust to abate, and to preuent the growing of haires in boyes genitors, applye Beane meale. Goute with swelling, mixe iiii. ounces of Beane flowre with the yolkes of Egs, and apply it. Glandules, kernels, and scrophules, bake Beane flowre with the iuice of Coriander, and apply it. Beanes greene and vnripe eaten, doe loose the belly, and therefore are to be eaten with Cummin. Drye Beanes binde the belly, especially eaten with their huskes, and nourish but little. The meale applied, dissolueth all swellings and tumors, and is good for the vlcerations and inflamations of the paps and genitors sodden with wine. seeth Beanes with their huskes in water and vineger, and eate them, it stayeth all fluxes and vomiting. The flower by it selfe or with Barley meale applied, swageth inflamations bruses and their markes. With meale of Fenigreeke and hony, it taketh away the swelling of the paps with curded milke, the inflamation thereof, and swellings, impostumes, and swellings behinde the eares. But with Roses, Frankincence, and the white of an egge, the eyes that fall outward, and swellings, both windie and others. The same knodden with wine, helpeth pearles stripes of the eyes. Beanes chewed without any huske, and applied to the forehead, stoppeth the humors that fall into it. Halfe a Beane without ye huske, stoppeth bleeding that commeth by the sucking of a Horseleech, being applied to the place. Beanes sodden in water, and applied with swines grease, easeth the goute. The leaues are good for the brusing and woundes of the sinowes, especially the meale sodden with hony and vineger. With white Frankincense, the white of an egge, and sore swelled and dropping eyes. With oyle and vineger applied hote, it swageth swollen cods. Strained twentie times with colde milke, it cleanseth the face being washt therewith at night and in the morning with colde water and milke, and so it keepeth it from sunne burning, taking withall one dram of Aloes put into two or three raisins to open the liuer, and to withstand flushings into the face. Inflamations Kanker Kernels Lust to abate Nose bleeding Pusshes Rancklings Sinowes griefes Skrophules Sunne burning Stomake hote Stone Vomiting Whites Woundes Beeche. BEeche, the leaues are very good to be laid to the beginning of hote swellings, blisters, and vlcers. The water founde in the hollownesse of Beeche, doth cure noughty skurfe and wild tetters or skabs of man or beast, of horses, kine, or sheepe being washed therewith. The nuts are sweete and good to eate, and do serue for almost all purposes ye Pineapple kernels do serue for. The leaues chewed are good for the diseases of the goms lips. The nuts burned and mixt with hony, is good for a skalde and skuruie head when the haire goeth off being laid to. The leaues, barke, buds or cups, sodden in red wine or running water, and sitten ouer stoppeth the termes, putteth backe the matrix and fundament that are fallen: and the decoction thereof in cleane red wine with Cinamon and Sugar, is good to the same effect. Blisters Byles Fundament fallen Flowers to stop Gomes griefes Head clean. skales skurf Haire falling Lippes griefes Matrix fallen Skurfe Stone Swellings hote Vlcers Beetes. BEetes, the iuice put into the nose cleanseth the head, it swageth the ache of the eyes, it cleanseth the head from lyce and nits, and restoreth haire, it destroyeth byles and botches. The ouermuch vse of it nourisheth euill humors in the body. Seeth white Beetes in water, and wash running sores therewith. Put the iuice of the roote into the nose to purge the head. Roste the roote in the embers and eate it, to take away the smell of Garlike, Onions, or Leekes. If one haue drunke a Horseleeche or Bloodsucker, let them drinke the iuice of Beetes, with some brine and vineger to kill it. Head ache, megrem, and swimming, put the iuice of the barke of the roote into the nose: and for the tooth ache, put it into the nosestrell on the same side that the ache is on bloodwarme by it selfe, with cowes milke or womans milke. It causeth sneesing, and so is good for the Iaundies. Belly bounde, strake a little salt on a Beete roote, and put it into the fundament, and so to auoide head ache that commeth of costiuenesse. Head ache of murre or reume, put the iuice of a greene roote with a tent into the nose, the white fome being scommed off. Seethe white Beetes in water and wash the head therewith, to voide the dandruf skales. Vse the hearbe but little inwardly, especially rawe, because it breedeth euill humors. Seethe it with mustardseede to helpe griefes of the milte. Put iii. or iiii. drops of the sodden roote into the eares to voide their paine. Take the iuice with the seedes of Cummin, or Dill, to voide the gripings of the belly. Drawe vp the iuice with oyle of bitter Almonds into the nose, to purge the head. Rub the iuice on the gums to cease the raging paine of the teeth. The yong plantes eaten with vineger, prouoke appetite, slake thirst, and represse choller in the stomake. asshes of the roote with hony, restoreth haire, and keepeth the rest from falling. The roote of Black or red Beetes put into the nose, being first bruised, cleanseth the braine. The broth of the roote and leaues skowreth away skurfe, skales and nits of the head, and swageth the paine of kibed heeles, and it helpeth frecles and spots, if they be first rubbed ouer with salt peter naturall, and so it helpeth the falling of the haire, it helpeth running sores which spread abroade and waste vp the flesh as they goe. Sodden in water it helpeth the bursting out of wheales, burnings, inflamations, and such like. Drinke the iuice of white Beetes to cleanse the stomake, put the iuice with hony into the nose to cleanse the braine, and to helpe the head ache, and into the eares to voide their paine and noyse. Stampe the leaues and apply them to spreading sores, skales and skurfe. Eate white Beetes with vineger and musterd, to helpe the obstructions of the liuer and miste. Holy fire Iaundies Inflamation Kibes Lice Liuer stopt Milte stopt Nittes Obstructions Purgation BEngewin, or Lacerpitium, stop it in a glasse, and set it into a dounghill fifteene or twentie dayes, and then streyne it, and vse it as a singular and dayntie oyle. Toes stinke, and face chops, rubbe the place with the powder of it or of Myrrhe. Dissolue it in water, and drinke it to cure the hoarcenesse that commeth suddenly. Suppe it with a rere Egge to cure the Cough. It is good against crampes and shrinking of the sinowes and other members one scruple being taken. With Pepper and Myrrhe it expelleth the termes, seconds, and dead birth. And taken with hony and vineger, or with syrupus Acetosus, it is singular against the falling sickenesse. Taken with the kernels of raisins, it helpeth the flixe that commeth of weaknesse of the stomake called Celiacus morbus. Being drunke with Wine, Pepper, and Frankincence, it driueth away the shakings of Agues. Make thereof an Electuarie with Pepper, Ginger, and the leaues of Rue with Hony. It is good against all venemous bitings and poysoned dartes and weapons to be taken inwardly, and also applied to the woundes. It is very good against all woundes and bitings of dogges, mad beastes, and serpents and stingings. Being straked on the eyes with Hony, it quickeneth the sight, and taketh away hawes and webbes in the eyes at their first comming. Being put into aking, hollowe, and corrupt teeth, it taketh away their paines, and so it doeth being sodden with Figges and Hysope in water, and holden in the mouth. Apply it with hony to stay the falling of the Vuula. Gargle it with Hydromel or Meade, to cure the Squincie. Gargle it with vineger, and keepe it in the mouth, to make the Horseleeches to come out of the wesand or throte. Apply it with Rue, Niter, and Honie, to breake the pestilentiall Apostumes and Carbuncles And likewise to Cornes or agnailes, being first scarifyed with a knife to take them away. Apply it with Coprose, and Verdigreece to all superfluous outgrowings of flesh, and the polyp in the nose, and all skuruie manginesse. Apply it with vineger, pepper, and wine, to cure the noughtie skurffe of the head and falling of the haire. Boyle it in vineger with the pill of a Pomegranate, to take away all outgrowings Boyle it in oyle, and annoint kibed heeles therewith, being long bathed first wt wine. Vse to eate thereof to haue a good fresh colour: with a soft egge it helpeth the cough. Take halfe a scruple for the bowing backe of the head, drinke it with vineger against clodded milke in the breasts: with Oximel for the falling sicknesse. It is melted with bitter Almonds, or Rue, or hote bread, to make drinkes of it. Crampe Colour bad Dead birth Dropsie Eyes griefes Falling euill Feete stinke Feuers cold quarten Flesh superfluous Fluxes Flowers stopt Fundament griefes Head bowing skurfe Haire falling Horcenesse Iaundies Kibes Mad dog Mandge Nose polip Plague sore Plurifie Poyson Polip Seconds Sinowes Skinne griefe Squincie Stomake weake Throte griefes Venom Vuala fallen Woundes Betony. BEtony, ache or goute, put a spoonefull of hony with ix. cornes of Pepper into an egge shell full of the iuice of Betony, and drinke it with a draught of wine. To be deliuered of a dead childe, drinke the iuice of Betony Nep with Ale. Eyes dull, put in the iuice of Betony to stop the teares, and drinke Betony Stamp Betony, apply it to the forehead of them that are frantik, or possest with deuils: proued. For all goutes and headache, seeth Betony well, and drinke the broth, and apply the rest to the place. seeth Betony, Veruin Wormewood in water, and wash therewith, and grinde the same hearbes with some of the water and wheate branne, and apply it hote to the molde of the head thrise and be whole: proued. For the head ache and broken bones, drinke the iuice, and apply the drosse to the place, to draw out the bones, and heale the wound. Head megrim, seeth Betony, Veruin, Horehound, and Hysope in white wine, and wash the head therewith, and apply the hearbs as hote as may be suffered. Head ache of colde flegme, seethe Betony in wine with a third part of water, and apply it. Head noise, paine and turning, drinke powder of the leaues dried in the shade, or rather eate it with slices of bread steeped in wine first and last to restore the braine. Vomite to stop, make a confection of powder of Betony one ounce, and hony iiii. ounces, and take thereof euery morning fasting. Braine to restore, vse powder of it in thy pottage. Head ache, make lee of Betony, and wash the head therewith thrise a weeke. Eares ache, put in the iuice with oyle of Roses. Eares deafe, put in the iuice of Betony and Horehound. Eyes smarting, wash them with the iuice of Betony, and white wine. Nose bleeding, put in powder of Betony, with as much salt as can be taken vp with iii. fingers. Teeth ache, seethe Betony and wilde Gourdes in wine or vineger, and holde it hote in thy mouth. Palsie and losse of speeche, drinke iii. drams of Betony with Goates milke iii. dayes. For vomiting, stopping of the breast, and shortnesse of breath, drinke one dram and a halfe of powder of Betony, with a goblet full of water fasting. Stomake gnawing, vse Betony and Wormewood with warme water and sugar. Spitting blood, drinke the iuice with Goates milke, or vse the powder witholde wine. Breast to cleanse, and to purge flegme, drinke the powder with warme water. Backe or reynes greefes, drinke it as before for head ache, Bladder paine, seethe the roote of Smallage in water, and drinke it with powder of Betony. Fistula, stampe it with salt, and put it in, and apply the hearbe. Treacle for the mother and all poyson, take powder of Betony one ounce, of Centory iiii. ounces, of Rue ii. ounces, mixe them with clarified hony, and keepe it, and vse it. Blood to stop, stampe it with salt put it in. Emerods, drinke the iuice of Yarow, Betony, and Mouseare often. Flowers to cause, drinke the iuice with good ale. Head ache, mixe the iuice of Betony, Mints, smallage, with as much vineger, put thereof into the eare, and apply the drosse thereon, proued: or stampe Camomile Betony, and seethe them in sowre ale, and apply it hote: or drinke powder of Betony with faire running water, sugar, and nutmegs, proued. Backe ache, stampe Betony, Egrimony, and Mugwort, of each like much with Galts grease vineger, and apply it. Mouth bleeding, drinke powder of Betony and Peniroyall iii. dayes. Teeth wormes, seethe Betony in wine or vineger, and hold thereof hote in thy mouth. Hart Cardiak, mixe the iuice with Treacle and powder of Cloues, Cummin, Annise, and vse it Venom or poyson, seethe powder of Betony with red wine, drinke it. Woundes and bruses, stampe it with stale Ale and swines grease, and apply it. Head ache, seethe iii. handfull of Betony in a pottell of wine to a pint, and wash the head therewith, and apply the hearbe. Eyes dim and blemishes, seethe Betony, or the roote thereof, and wash therewith. Eyes cloudy blind, drinke one dram of Betony with water. Eyes cloudy, stampe Rue and the flowers of Betony, and streine them with morning dewe, and put it in. Eares paine, deafe, and other impediments, put in the iuice of Betony warme. To helpe digestion and withstand vomiting, vse Betony with hony. Reumes, ache, and to expell the stone of the reynes and bladder, drinke Betony with Wine, Hony, and Pepper. Yard payne and swelling, seethe Betony in wine, and apply it. To cause deliueraunce without perill, seethe Betony in wine, and take one dram, and looke there be no peares in the house, for they are hurtfull, and suffer not the matrix easily to open. Gout paine, seethe Betony, and drinke it and also apply it. Feuer quotitian, stampe Betony two drams, Planten one dram, streine them, and drinke it before the fit. Feuer quarten, take iiii. drams of Betony, with wine, water, and hony, before the fit. Glandules, scrophules, and kernels, stampe the roote with doues doung, and grease, and apply it. Eyes dim, or blemish, seeth it in water, and wash therewith. Eyes bloody cloudy, drinke one dram of the powder with the water thereof. Gout, drinke a litle dishfull of the iuice euery of the Back ache stampe Betony, Egrimony, Mugwort, and their rootes with old grease vineger or vergis, and apply it iii. dayes. Surfet, stampe it drinke it with a little hote water and wine morning euening iii. dayes. Poyson drunke, seeth one dram of the powder in wine a little, and drinke it to haue present helpe: and drinke fasting to withstand poyson. Serpents being in a circle of Betony, cannot goe out of it, but rather wil dye with beating themselues. Eies stroke, stampe it and apply it, and drinke the iuice with smal drinke or water, and wash the eye with water wherein it, or the roote thereof hath beene sodden. Eyes running, stampe it with the white of an egge, and apply it with flaxe hurds. Flegme in the stomake to breake it and purge it abundantly, vse the power of it in pottage, and drinke the iuice of Sorell. Headache apply Betony water with a cloth from eare to eare. Betony hath like vertues to Balme, it breaketh wind, comforteth a weake stomake, either the flower or hearbe boyled, or the distilled water, or powder of the hearbe by it selfe, or with hony: it helpeth the mother. The leafe, flower, or roote in drinke, conserue, electuarie, syrupe, or potion, or powder, is singular for all diseases of the stomake, liuer, milt, kidneis, bladder, the obstruction of the matrix, and the moysture thereof, the consumption of the lungs, coughes, dropsies, continuall Feuers, boyle the leaues and flowers in honied water to haue present remedie. Teeth ache, seethe it with Sage and alom in vineger, and apply it. speedily, take halfe a spoonefull of the rootes and leaues in powder, with white wine, possit ale, broth or drinke. Ptisik, seethe the powder with hony to an Electuarie, and vse it. Barrennesse by too much fatnesse, drinke one dramme of the powder, with one ounce of the water. Eye bruse, stamp the leaues either sodden or rawe, and apply them. To cause a pellet or shot to come out of the flesh: stamp it with the fat of a Hare into an oyntment, and apply it. Nosebleeding, stamp it with salt, and put it in, and anoynt the forehead with vineger. Spetting blood, drink the rootes with Goats milke three dayes, or boyle Betony, Rue, Smallach, and Mints in Goats milke, and sup it warme. To expell euill humours which annoy the eyes, drinke Betony with warme water ix. dayes. Head broken, stamp it and apply it with Swines grease. To purge a costiue body gently, seethe Betony, Sothernwood, and Penyroyall ana one handfull to the third part, and drinke thereof. Headach, seethe it with Cammomill and Fenell in water, and wash the head therewith. Ptisik and spetting blood, seethe it with Horehound, Nep, and xx. corns of Pepper in wine, and drinke thereof dayly with Pyment nine dayes, and the tenth day drinke a cup full of the iuice of Betony with common oyle. Reins ache, drink an egshelfull of the iuice of Betony, with as much wine and ix. corns of Pepper ix. dayes. Feuer quotidian, drinke Betony and Planten, of eche two ounces, with water warme. Head broken, and to draw out bones, stamp Betony, Veruin, and Rue, with hony or Rye meale, or Wheate flower, and the white of an egge, and apply it. To expell a dead childe, drink Betony and Rue, and Isope with warme water. For all maner of sicknesses, drinke the iuice of Betony euery morning of May a good draught to be free from all sicknesses, but death for one yeere. Gout to preuent, drinke halfe a pinte of the iuice yeerely in the beginning of May. Eares dull, put in the iuice with as much oyle of Spike. Headmegrim, drinke Sage royall, Betony and Wormewood with vineger xxx. dayes. Flegme to auoyde, make little pellets of the powder with hony, and swallowe Spetting blood, seethe Betony, Mints, Smallach, Rue in milke, and drinke it first and last. Eyes ache, apply the water or iuice of Betony, and also drinke it. Eyes web, stamp it streine it with wine or water, drink it x. dayes to destroy it. Teethach, stamp it and seethe it with vineger to the one halfe, hold thereof often it thy mouth. Cough, the iuice or powder with hony make it an electuary, vse it ix. dayes. Yard sore swollen, stamp it with white wine, apply it. Gout, seethe it in water and drink it, also wash ye feet therewith, apply the herb. Drunkennes to withstand, drink the herb or pouder in the morning to be free that day. For the plague if one be infected, drinke the water of Betony, Scabious, of ech like much, with a good quantitie of Treacle of Andromachus, or for want thereof common Treacle, drink thereof often to expell the poyson from ye principal parts, to saue life. Headach stamp Betony, Veruin, and Cummin, apply it, or drink Betony fasting daily, or drink Betony with water x. dayes, or take Betony, Cammomill powder of Nutmegs ana like much, if ye stomak be stopt, put therto one ounce of Sene, seethe them in Ale, and take thereof halfe a spoonefull morning and euening warme, or drink the iuice of Betony, wine, and hony of eche one spoonefull with nine corns of Pepper foure dayes. Speech lost, drinke the roote of Betony, or beare it about thee. Bruses of all sortes, seethe Betony, Auens, and Cammomill of eche like much in stale, and apply it, and he whole. Head broken, drinke the iuice of Betony to cast out the broken bones. Bytings of mad Dogs, or Adders, drinke Dragons, Rue, and Betony. Byting of an Adder, seethe Rue, Betony, and Fenell in Butter, and drinke it. Belly bound, stampe the roote of Betony drink it with Ale, it purgeth well. Speaking in sleepe, take Betony about thee when thou goest to bed. Teethach, drinke the roote of Betony, or beare it about thee. The decoction of Betony drunke, prouoketh vrine, breaketh the stone of the kidneys, clenseth scoureth the breast and lungs, and is good for the Ptisik or consumption, and the cough. dramme of powder of the leaues with Hydromell for the cramp, and diseases of the mother, and to prouoke termes. Drinke the dryed leaues in Wine against venomous bytings and inward poyson, and apply the herbe to the place: And taken beforehand, it preserueth from poyson. Betony openeth the stopping of the liuer, milte, and kidneys, and cureth the same, and is good for the dropsie. Drink it with wine and water against spetting of blood. It cureth all wounds both inward and outward, it comforteth the stomake, helpeth digestion, voydeth belching and the desire to vomit, being taken with clarified hony after supper, and so doeth conserue made thereof with Sugar, as much as a Beane at once. The powder of the roote taken with honyed water, prouoketh vomit, and to cast out tough flegme and superfluous humours. Drinke Betony with Hydromell to losen the belly gently, and to helpe the falling sicknesse, madnesse and headach. Betony hath like vertues of Balme, it breaketh wind, comforteth the weake stomake, either the herbe or flower boyled, or the water or powder worketh all these effectes, and is good to be vsed either alone or with hony, it is good for women that are troubled with the mother. The leafe, flower, and roote sodden and drunke, or vsed any other wayes, is singular for all diseases of the stomake, liuer, milte, kidneys and bladder, it freeth the Matrix from all obstruction, and draweth from thence all superfluous moystnesse. Boyle the leaues flowers in honyed water to help the consumption of the lungs, coughs, dropsies, and consuming Feuers comming from the stomak. Dry the leaues and roots in an ouen wherein browne bread hath bene baked, and vse halfe a spoonfull of the powder in white wine, possit ale, drinke, or pottage to prouoke vrine speedily. Seethe one spoonefull of the powder in a draught of white wine, and drink it after the drinking of poyson to helpe thee. Seethe Betony in water, wash the eyes therewith, for any dimnesse or other blemish. Eyes cloudy bloody, drink Betony water, with one dram of the powder of it. Vse Betony, the flowers thereof any wayes against the belching weaknes of ye stomak, the strangling of the mother, all griefes of the stomak, liuer, milt, kidneis, bladder, Matrix, the Iaundes, the Ptisik, sighing, griefes of the lungs, the disposition to the dropsie, the rotten and continuall Feuers which begin in the stomake, especially the leaues and flowers sodden in water, and drunke with hony warme, and so it helpeth also them that be mad, the falling sicknesse, the Sciatica, and the palsie. Bytings venemous, seethe the leaues with Red wine, and apply them. Mother strangled, drinke one dram with water and hony. Serpents byting, drink iii. drammes, with xviii. ounces of wine. Drinke one dram with vineger and hony, against the griefes of the liuer and milte. Take as much as a Beane with sodden hony after supper to helpe digestion, and to auoyd sower belching, and stinking of breath. Drinke halfe a dramme with two ounces of colde wine for spetting of blood. Drinke it with water against the Sciatica and ache of the kidneys bladder. Drink two drams with water and hony against the dropsie in an Ague, but without an Ague with wine and hony. Drink foure drammes with honyed water to purge the body. Vse it with hony against the Ptisik, and spetting of matter and corruption from the lungs. Wine and vineger made with Betony, are good for the stomake, and to clere the eyes. Seethe it and Wormewood in White wine to purge flegme: it killeth Wormes. S. Iohnswort, Betony, Centory, and Selfeheale, of eche one handfull, stampe them and mixe them well, and let it distill in a glasse all the Sommer, then presse it out: it cureth all wounds by onely anoynting them morning and euening: it expelleth humours, and is wonderfull in fractures and bruses, and all such like. BIrch: Put powder of Birch coales into any wound or great sore to heale it perfectly. Skotch the body of the tree after the Spring time, and gather the water, and drinke it for the stone in the reines. Some vse to distill the iuice and to vse it against many foule griefes of the skinne, and exulcerations of the mouth, wheales, and pusshes and such like, and likewise the distilled water of the leaues. But lee made with the asshes of the Barke thereof is more effectuall for the griefes aforesayde. The iuice of the leaues is good to be kept for cheeslop to saue the cheese from breeding of wormes in it. Iche Mouth sores Pusshes Skinne griefes Sores Stone Wounds Wheales Bistort. BIstort, the roote boyled in wine or water and drunke, stoppeth the bloody fluxe, the flowers, and all issues of blood, and the desire to vomit, and so doeth the powder drunk with Red wine. The decoction of the leaues is good against all sores and inflamations of the mouth and throat, and fasteneth lose teeth The root doeth glew wounds together and hath the vertues of Britannica. Drinke one dramme of the roote with Wine or Ale against the plague to expell it by sweat: so doeth the water or decoction of the roote. It helpeth also the bloody flixe, bruses, Iaundes, and all venemous bytings. The roote with Piretrum of eche like much, put into a holow tooth with hony, ceaseth the paine, and draweth out the reume. Wash the kanker of the backe, the polip of the nose, and all maligniant sores with the water thereof to heale them. Bruses Flowers to stop Iaundes Inflamations Kanker Mouth sores Nose polip Plague Sores BLessed thistle: drinke powder of the seedes for the paine and stitches in the side, and all grypings in the body. The powder eaten or drunke prouoketh sweate, and helpeth headach, giddinesse, and the memorie, and restoreth hearing. The leafe, iuice, seede, or water, healeth all kindes of poyson. The water healeth the kanker in the breast of a woman, though it be eaten to the very ribs. For the Feuer Quarten and all other Feuers, take one dramme of the powder, or three ounces of the water distilled, in May, a quarter of an houre before the fift, and couer thee well to sweat. It preserueth from the plague being taken within xxiiii. houres before a man come into the infected place. It it is good for the disinesse in the head, shortnesse of breath, and diseases of the lungs, it strengtheneth the teeth, expelleth termes, prouoketh sleepe, and helpeth the falling euil and inward bruses. The same put into the guts by a Glister, helpeth the chollik, and other griefes of the guts, and the wounds of the same. The water or iuice helpeth the rednesse of the eyes, and the itch of them. The leaues brused are good for the bytings of Serpents, burnings and Carbuncles, there is nothing better for the Kanker and olde festering sores. The leaues are good for fomentations and to bee sitten ouer in water, that the vapour may come to the diseased places, against the stone and stopping of the flowers. Vse it to all headache, whirling, and giddinesse, to cause a good memorie, to comfort the braine, to clense the brest, chest, stomake and throte, to prouoke appetite, to consume reume, and for paine in the belly, either the iuice, water, powder, seede or greene herbe. The white Cotten healeth all mortall wounds in three dayes without paine or griefe. The herbe or powder eaten, causeth a sweete breath, fasteneth the teeth, strengtheneth the gums, helpeth the matrix, cleareth the heart. If the nauill of little children fall out, boyle the herbe in wine, and wash the nauill there with. Blessed thistle, either eaten or drunke, or eaten greene with bread and butter as Sage and Parsely, or boyled in pottage with other herbes, or the iuice with wine or Ale and Sugar, or the water of it by it selfe, or with wine, or Ale with Sugar, or the water by it selfe, or with wine or Ale, or the powder of it vsed any wayes before meate, or with Sacke after meate, or a good handfull of it sodden in a quart of running water to the one halfe, and then drunke with wine, or with Sugar or any other wayes vsed. It strengtheneth all the inner parts of the body, sharpeneth the wit, memorie, and sences, comforteth the stomake, causeth appetite, resisteth poyson, and preserueth from the plague. And is excellent against any kinde of Feuer, if one dramme of the powder be drunke with Ale or wine warme a quarter of an houre before the fitt, and the body well couered to sweate till the fitt be past, or the distilled water drunke after the same maner, and so it helpeth against the plague and pestilent Feuers being taken within twelue houres after the first taking of the griefe. It openeth the obstruction of the members, and prouoketh vrine. The herbe eaten, helpeth the paine of the lungs and head, and causeth good hearing, sharpeneth the wittes and memory, and putteth away giddines. It comforteth the braine and the sight, both being eaten, and the eyes anoynted therewith: when the iuice can not be had vse the powder, or the dryed herbe steeped in water, and wash therewith. Apply the herbe to the bleeding of the nose or any other place. Eate the powder of the herbe with hony to spet foorth flegme and grosse humours the more easily. It helpeth a weake stomake, prouoketh appetite, and softneth the heart, it consumeth euill blood, and breedeth good blood. Boyled in water and drunke, it consumeth euill humours, and breedeth good humours. The herbe eaten, strengthneth the palsie members, and healeth blistred lungs. The herbe boyled or drunke rawe with Wine breaketh the stone. And boyled in the vrine of a healthfull manchilde, and drunke, it helpeth the dropsie, and the plague, and breaketh all impostumes, and mastreth the Kanker and Falling sicknesse. The Doune layde on cuts and newe wounds, doeth heale them without paine. Boyle the herbe in Wine, and drinke it a quarter of an houre before the fitt, and couer thee well to sweate, to helpe all Agues both hote and colde, or drinke the powder with hote Wine, or the distilled water for the same purpose, and so it helpeth against any inwarde poyson. Eate or drinke the powder of the herbe, and sweate three houres to helpe the stitch in the side. The herbe, powder or iuice drunke, helpeth the headache, and Megrem. And taken in meate and drinke, it is good against disinesse swimming and giddinesse of the head, and is a singular remedie against deafenesse and prouoketh sleepe. The iuice layd to the eyes, quickeneth the sight, and so doeth the water or infusion of the drye herbe the eyes being washt therewith. water or iuice dropt into the eyes, cureth their rednesse, bloodshooting itch. The same rubbed on ye teeth with a clout, fastneth them strengtheneth them. The powder stancheth blood in the nose or els where. The broth or decoction of the herbe in wine, helpeth an euill weake stomake. The powder eaten with hony or drunke with wine, doeth ripen or digest cold flegme, purgeth bringeth vp that which is in the breast, and causeth the breath to be easily fetcht, and the herbe chewed, healeth a stinking breath. And one dram, or a wallnutshelfull taken immediatly after the infection, expelleth the venom of the infection from the heart, so that a man sweat after it. So doeth the herbe boyled in wine, or in the vrine of a healthfull manchild and drunke. Drinke the iuice with wine against shortnesse of winde, the griefes of the lungs, and for the consumption, or ptisik. Eate the herbe against the trembling of the palsie members. Vse the powder in Glisters against the chollik other griefes of the guts: Or drinke the water or decoction to the same effect, and for the greene sicknes, the griping paine of the belly, to open obstructions, to cause passage of the vrine, to dissolue brused blood and to prouoke sweate. The leaues, iuice, powder, or water healeth the kanker, and olde rotten festered sores. The leaues stampt and applyed, are good against hote swellings, Carbuncles and sores that be hard to be cured, especially plague sores, and also the bytings of venemous beasts, Serpents, and creeping beastes. The decoction of the herbe killeth wormes, and taketh away all inward paine of the backe and belly. The herbe either greene or dry drunke and applyed, helpeth all grieuous and swelling sores, bruses, bytings, &c. and couereth the flesh with skinne, and is good in drinks for the French pocks, and sores of the paps and teats, the powder being layd on them. For all inward griefes it may be sodden in Ale or Wine, with Hony Lycoras or Sugar, or the powder with bread and butter, or bread and hony, or lickt in with hony: the seede may be sowed at any time of the yeere, and so it may be had at all times. The water healed a woman that was eaten with a Kanker to the very ribs. Stampe the herbe and seethe it with Swines grease, wine, and wheate flower into an oyntment, and vse it to all sores and vlcers, first washing them with white wine, and then anointing them therewith twise a day. Drink powder of the seedes, to helpe the paine, pricking and stitches of the sides, belly, and guts. Stamp the greene herbe, apply it to wounds to heale them speedily and miraculously. Steepe the dryed herbe in Aqua vitae, and drinke it against any grieuous paine, and be whole in short time. Make a paste thereof with bread and hony, and distill it with white wine, and it is most excellent for the sight. Stampe it grosly when it beginneth to flower, and steepe it in common oyle and Aqua vitae with a little Frankincense, and let it remaine till it be macerated, then boyle it and streine it, then take thereof a third part, and put thereto a little Virgins waxe, and boyle it till it beginne to fume and turne to blacke colour, then streine it, and keepe it in a close glasse, and drinke one dramme of the oyle with sweete Wine colde, to resolue any infirmitie, and to preserue health. And with the blacke humour anoynt all the body when thou goest to bed colde, to resolue any euill qualitie, and to preserue good state. It mainteineth the haire blacke that it waxe not white. It killeth wormes in the body with diuers other things not nowe written of. The powder drunke in Wine or taken in pilles cutteth and driueth downe grosse humours, helpeth the griefes of the breast, purgeth the blood, and is good for the Pcisik. The leaues sodden in Wine and drunke hote, ceaseth torment, prouoketh sweate and the termes, and helpeth the plague, if it be taken within xxiiii. houres after the first assault thereof: and also all rotten Feuers, the Quarten, and all maner of poyson, and the swelling that commeth thereof, and so doeth the water or powder. The iuice, tops, seedes, and leaues with Pepper and Wine stamped together, is very good against all stingings of Serpents. The brused leaues and the water, are good for burnings, Carbuncles, and bytings of Scorpions and Serpents. The leaues, iuice, decoction or water, are good against the Kanker and all other malignant sores and filthy vlcers. The herbe is good in foments and bathes for the stone, and to driue downe the flowers. and stomake and throte, prouoketh appetite, consumeth reume, and the paine in the belly. The herbe or powder eaten, causeth a sweete breath, fastneth teeth, strengthneth the gums, helpeth the matrix, and cheareth the heart, &c. For the Quarten, and all other Feuers, colde, drinke one dramme of the powder with some of the water of the same herbe, and drinke it with Aqua vitae to kill wormes, and in short time to take away all grieuous paine of the body. BOmbase or Cotton: the seede swageth the cough, and is good against all colde diseases of the breast, it augmenteth naturall strength, and increaseth seede of generation. The iuice of the leaues is good for the laske of yong children, and for the gnawing and grinding in the belly. The oyle of the seede taketh away freckles and spots of the face. Belly ache Breast griefes Colde griefes Cough Face deformed Freckles Flixe Seede to increase, strength to increase Borage. VSe it in wine to cause gladnesse and mirth to expell sadnesse and melancholy. Boyle it with honyed water for the roughnes hoarsnes of the throat. Take that which hath three branches with the root with drink for the Tertian Feuer, that with foure branches for the Quarten Feuer. Drink the iuice with Sugar for the paine giddines of the head. Vse the syrup of the iuice thereof with Sugar and the bone of a Harts heart for the panting, trembling, and beating of the heart. Mix the iuice of the herbe with Sene, the syrup of Borage, and drink it morning euening to increase the sences, to put away melancholy. flowers, or drink them with wine to cause good blood, and auoyd the trembling of the heart. The dried flowers for one yeere, serue for all purposes that the herbe is for. Steep the flowers in oyle, and sunne it certaine dayes, anoint the region of the stomake and heart therewith to comfort them. Distill the water in Balneo Mariae, and drink two or three ounces morning euening of the water, for the griping and swelling of the belly, for the bloody fluxe, the hardnes of fetching wind, to comfort the heart and braine, to increase the memory wit, to purge the blood, to auoyd the frensie. Apply the water with a linen cloth to the venom of a spider or waspe, to take away the paine thereof. Dip a red cloth in the water and apply it to the eyes, to auoyd their paine, and to cleare them. The water of the flowers purgeth the blood serueth for all the things that the herbe is for, much better. Being drunke morning euening two ounces thereof, it helpeth all distillations of the head, burning Agues, the Iaundes, and cooleth the liuer, being applyed with linen clothes to ye region of the liuer. Burne Borage, and mixe the asshes with with honyed, and vse it for the vlcers and blisters of the mouth, gums, tongue throat, &c. (See in Buglosse. Drink two ounces of the iuice to driue out a dead child. Feuer quarten, seethe Borage, Sorell, Violets, Mercurie ana, foure handfuls in faire running water, from a gallon to a pottell, then streine it, and when it is cold, drinke thereof in thy most heate to coole thy thirst. Heart stitch, of blood heate, or bruse, drink the water of Borage, make pottage with water, Borage butter, and eate them morning and euening warme. Heart griefes, vse Borage flowers, leaues, or roots any wayes: vse the flowers in brothes to refresh the body. Breath stopt, seethe Borage, Mallowes and Mercurie with a piece of pork, make pottage therewith vse them, or seethe them in wine or whey, vse them to drink. Morphue, drink water of Borage Fumeterre, of eche like much xiiii. dayes, thine owne vrine with black sope anoynt often therewith. Morphue Mouth sores Reume Seconds Stitch Stomak bad Stinging Thirst Throat griefes BOxe, the lee wherein the leaues haue bene sodden or steeped maketh the haire yelowe being often washed therewith. Byting of a mad dog, stampe the seede with a litle Holy water, and drinke it and lye downe. BRamble breer, or Blackberry: the newe springs thereof doe cure the hote and euill vlcers of the mouth and throat and the swelling of the gums vuula and almonds of the throat being often chewed. Wash the mouth often with the iuice or decoction thereof to fasten the teeth. The leaues stampt applyed to the stomak, helpeth the trembling of the heart, and losenesse and ache of the stomake. They cure the emerods and stay back running and consuming sores being layd to. The vnripe fruit stoppeth the belly, the bloody fluxe, and all other issues of blood. The iuice of them boyled with hony, is very good against all hote vlcers swellings in the mouth, tongue, throte. The root is good against the stone, to prouoke vrine. They heale running sores of the head, and are a good remedie for the eyes that fall downe. The leaues are good to be layd vpon hard swellings of the fundament, and the emerods, and ache of the stomake. The iuice pressed out of the leaues braunches, and dryed in the Sunne to a hard lump, is good for all the diseases aforesayd. The iuice of the ripe Beries is good for all the diseases of the mouth. The vnripe Beries stop the belly, and so doe the flowers drunke with wine. The fruit dryed before they be ripe, stop the laske and losenesse of the belly. Make balles of the vnripe fruite dryed with vineger, and dry them in the Sunne, and put thereof into hote wine it will be vineger. The like may be done with Mulberies, Quickenberries, greene Grapes or wild Acorus. Eyes griefes, apply the iuice of it with the white of an egge flaxe. To drawe out an apostume, stamp the leaues with Elderne leaues ana one handfull with white Mustardseede, and apply it. Gout to soften, stampe Rue, Red Breer crops, and Broome flowers ana, like much, with Gilts grease, and boyle them well together, streine it, anoynt therewith. Leapry, vse the iuice of the Berries, with syrup of wilde Sage euery morning halfe an ounce. BRead, plurisie mixe leuened bread, butter, the decoction of Holyoke, and oyle de Bay together, and eate thereof, and also apply it before and behinde. Bruses and pustules of the legs, mixe the pith of leuened bread with wine and hony, and boile them together and put tallow to it, and apply it. Ache, bruse, or swelling, mixe crooms of sowre bread with vineger, and Rose leaues, and apply it to heale it. Squincy, eate bread with hony, and apply plasters thereof hote. Crampe, steepe bread in vineger as it commeth hote from the ouen, and apply it hote: proued. Breath stinking, toste it well and steepe it in vineger, and eate it. Megrim, toste the neather crust of a browne loafe, and soke it in vineger till it be soft, then heate it againe, and apply it to the temples as hote as may be suffered. Stomake weake, stampe ye crooms with Wormewood and vineger, and apply it. Stomake hote, boyle cleane water, and steepe therein shiuers of browne bread, till it be almost colde, and drinke thereof often iii. or iiii. dayes. Eyes sore and bloodshot, lay a toste of leauened bread in red wine that is not mingled halfe an houre, then lay it in a fine linnen cloth and apply to either eye one. Felon, seethe vineger with the croomes of hote wheaten bread and hony, till it be thicke, and apply plasters thereof. Temper stale browne bread with vineger, and a little Cinamome, and Aniseedes, and apply it with iii. or iiii. folde of linen betweene the skinne and it to finde speedie ease. Megrime, boyle gray bread, and powder of Cummin in vineger, and when it is thicke, apply thereof. Plague, weete sowre bread in vineger, and binde it to the temples, and drinke water of Tormentill. Stomake weake, bake a loafe of wheate meale as it commeth from the mill in the midst of the batch, and of the cromes thereof make three spoonefull of myes, and mixe it with white vineger, that it may be standing thicke, and eate thereof with Ginger, when thou goest to bed, and drinke not after it. wormes, apply well sauoring bread as it commeth hote from the ouen. Swelling of blood letting, stampe white Bread crooms with wine, and apply it. Wounds to heale, apply white Bread crooms stamped with water, and the white of an Egge. Head swimming, apply the pith of Bread baked with Coliander seede. Eares deafe, bake a round lofe full of Sage, breake it in the midst, and apply it hote to the eares iii. or iiii. times. Eies heate and swelling, seethe white Bread and Sothernewood, and bathe therewith. Squincy, put hote Bread into hony, and apply it hote, and gargle with ye iuice of Planten. Stitch, toste a piece of white leauened Bread, and spread Treacle on it, and apply it hote with a fine linnen cloth. For the plurisie, and for such as are vsed to be letten blood, to saue them from being letten blood, and to dissolue all ill blood. Cut fine shiuers of Rie Bread, and drie them in the winde, and when neede is, steepe them foure houres in strong vineger, then seethe it and make a plaster of it, and apply it as hote as may be suffered, it helpeth also the paine of the liuer and milte. For all bone ache, boyle a pinte of white wine with an Oxe gall and scom it, and put thereto crooms of white bread, and apply it iiii. or v. times. Sinowes ache, weete Bread in milke, and apply it hote. Goute in the bone, dip hote tostes of Bread in the iuice of Garlike, and apply it hote being well stamped. Chollike passion, seethe cromes of wheate Bread and powder of Cummin in white vineger, and apply it hote. Stone to breake, bake a Rie cake, and slit it through the midst, and spread thereon Onions rosted very tender, and apply the one to the backe, and the other to the bottome of the belly. plaster of sowre bread boyled in wine, draweth sores passing well being laide to all night. Wounds Bentbrow, stampe it with marigolds that neuer flowred and streine it, and an with the iuice with a crowes feather all fleshmoles, and such like markes. Branne, flowers stopt, seethe it in wine or ale, and drinke it, (See Wheate, Rye, Barley, Otes. Brasel, make milkered with the powder of it, and steepe therein Wode or Bone, and in viii. dayes it wilbe red. apost. to breake, seethe it with Lilly rootes in wine, apply it with oile. Plurisie, seeth it wt mallowes in oile of violets, apply it often. BRoome, the seede or flower drunke with Mulsa, purgeth by vomit, and also downewards from the ioyntes, cleanseth the reines from all superfluities, prouoketh vrine strongly, breaketh the stone in the reines and bladder, and suffereth no matter to be fixed there to a stone. The flowers stampt with hony of Roses, or with an Egrere rosted, resolueth scrophules. Oximel thereof, or of the seede, dissolueth apostumes of the milte, Vomite with the seedes often to helpe the goute, sciatica, paine in the reines, vse suppositers of the powder thereof with the iuice of Planten to stop the bloody fluxe, and pessaries, to stop the termes or foment with water of the decoction thereof. Teeth to cleanse, mixe asshes of Broome branches with an eight part of powder of burnt Alome, and temper them with water, rub thy teeth therewith. Teeth stinking and foule, mixe the said asshes with as much burnt alom, rub them therewith. Swelling of ye dropsie stamp yong Broome, and streine it with stale ale, and drinke it first last fiue dayes: proued. Make lee of asshes of greene Broome, and red wine, and when it is cleare, drinke it first last, and the humors of the dropsie will burst out at the fingers toes, the dropsie cured. Gout, seethe the flowers with hony apply it, or make an oyntment of the flowers of Capons grease, or dogs grease, and vse it. Or boyle the iuice of the flowers with as much hony, to the thickenesse of hony, or an oyntment, and vse it for the goute: proued. Or vse the rootes steeped in vineger streyned, or the branches of greene Broome steeped and streyned. Stone and chollike, to be made in May, stampe the buds of the flowers, and mixe them with clarified May butter, and keepe it in a close vessell eight dayes, then seethe it and streyne it, and anoynt therewith morning and euening. Dogs maungy, seethe Broome tops in bouke lee halfe a day, and wash therewith, then mixe blacke sope with bay salt, brimstone, and fresh greace, and dresse him therewith. Ache in armes or legs, stampe the flowers of Broome and Woodoose with May butter in a stone morter, and make them into round balles, and lay them in an earthen pot houres, then boyle it well, streyne it into an earthen vessell and none other, and anoint therewith against the fire, till it be dried in, and then apply a warme cloth. Plurisie, drinke the water of Broome flowres, and of Roses, and anoint the griefe with oyle of both the same flowres. Kings euill, to auoide the kernels of it, drinke two ounces of the water of the flowres fasting, to purge the humors downewards, and to waste and heale them without breaking, and make an oyntment of the red docke stamped with grease, and vse it. Teeth blacke, burne greene Broome, and mixe the asshes with a fourth part of burnt Alome, and rub therewith. Gout to soften, stampe Rue, red Bryer crops, and Broome flowres, of eche like much, with gylts grease, and boyle them well together and streine it, and anoint therewith. Put Broome rootes into a vessell of wine, beere, or ale, and drinke it to keepe thee cleare from all poysons. Seethe the flowres in the milke of a cowe of one colour, till it be thicke, apply it to the legs to heale the dropsie. Vnguentum Genistae, take Broome flowres, Puliol montan, and mallowes ana like much, stampe them with May butter, and set it in a close earthen pot in hot horsedoung It is good for the goute, boneshawes and all aches, being applied colde. Water of Broome clenseth the mother, liuer, and milte, and helpeth the maras. To kill lice, mixe the iuice with oyle of Raddish, or of Senuie, and anoint. Gout, seethe the iuice of Broome flowres, and Scalaceli, and hony, ana like much to the thickenesse of hony, and anoint. Dropsie, seethe two gallons of fine Ale, with two good handfull of greene Broome to the one halfe, and drinke thereof fasting dayly, and vse no other drinke. For the boneshawe and goute, seethe the flowres with wine and oyle oliue, and apply it. Sores of all sortes, mixe good store of the flowres with Valerian Smallage, with May butter, and make them into balles as much as Egs, and lay them on shelfes to moulde throughout, then frie them and streine them, and keepe it in an earthen pot, and vse it. Aches, shreade Broome flowres, Balme, and Feuerfue ana one handfull, and seethe them in a little May butter and keepe it, and anoint therewith against the fire. Mouth set awrye by sicknesse, drinke as much of the seede as thou canst take vp with thy three fingers with water. The water of the flowres drunke, breaketh the stone, and so doth one scruple of the seede, and causeth sweate. Broome stamped with swynes grease, helpeth ye ache of the knees. The leaues or crops, or branches boyled in water or wine and drunke, are good for the dropsie, stopping of the liuer, milte, kidneis and bladder: for partly it purgeth out by the belly, and partly by the vrine, all watrie, tough, and superfluous humors: so doth the seedes taken one dram, or one dram and a halfe. The seede is good in all medicines to prouoke vrine, and breake the stone. The flowers with swines grease swageth the paine of the goute. Our English broome may be vsed to all effects, as Spanish Broome. Broome seedes taken one dram, or one dram a halfe with mede or wheye, purgeth humors from the ioynts both vpward downeward, and suffereth no tough humors to abide in the kidneis or bladder, and killeth wormes, and cleanseth the stomake: the oyle healeth tetters. The iuice of the plant or roote may be dryed and kept.
