Drinke eight ounces at once, and sweate two houres, or more or lesse as strength may beare, and drye vp the sweate with warme clothes, after put on thy clothes warme, and sit by a good fire or walke in thy Chamber till eight a clocke, then goe to Dynner: first sup a little of the broth with a little bread, then eate competently of the flesh, and after walke, or vse some recreation of minde and bodie, and suppe at foure of the clocke, and goe to bed at seuen, and drinke eight ounces, and sweat. For all griefes of the ioynts, knots, tumors, &c. Receiue Lignum vite well prepared one pound and an halfe, Lycoras and Polipody ana one ounce, Sene, Aniseede and Fenell seede ana halfe an ounce, water twelue pounde: steepe the wood in the water twelue houres, then seethe it with the rest in an earthen vessel and scum it as long as long as the scumme will rise, and saue the scumme to anoynt withall, and take the water euery morning or euery other morning, and couer thee well to sweate two houres, and continue it three or foure weekes. For the salt humor, seeth halfe a pound of the wood and the barke thereof with Lycoras and Aniseedes, and halfe a pound of cleere Hony with cold herbs, as and two ounces of french Barley, and halfe a pound of Reasins of the sunne, the stones taken out, seethe them well and vse it. Sciatica Senowes ach Shyngles Salt humor Sickenesse generall Stone Strangury Swellings Tympany Vrine stopt Haresfoote. HAres foote, Seethe it in wine and drinke it to stop the laske bloody fluxe: but in an Ague, vse it with water. Apply it to the inflammations and heate of the Share. HArts ease or Pances, seethe the flowers and drinke it, to cure and stay the beginning of the falling sickenesse in children that fome at the mouth. Seeth the flowers and plant together, and drinke it to cleanse the Lungs and the breast for feuers and inward inflammations. Vse the herbe inward and outward, or the powder thereof for all woundes and ruptures, especially with red wine. Drinke the water of it for the torments of the belly of children, and for inflammations, and to cleanse the Lungs and Chest: or seeth it in wine and drinke it. It is good for all wounded men, women and children, and for all them which haue broken bones. Outwardly it cleanseth the skin from all Itch, Skab, shingles, vlcers, &c. It healeth greene woundes without danger of any Apostumation. Vsed in Plasters or the iuice preserued with oyle, for herbes being streined, and the iuice clarified on the fire, and cooled and kept in a cleane glasse and a little oyle Oliue powred on it, it may safely bee preserued till time of vse for Syrops and Salues. Bursten Falling euill Greene sickenesse Feuers Hogs squincy Inflammations Itch Lungs to cleanse Ryngwormes Skabs Skin deformd Shingles Sores Wounds HArtshorne Planten, Stampe three pound, and mixe it with common oyle and let it stand nine dayes, then put to it one pinte of water, and boyle it till the water be consumed, so that the oyle be greene, then streine it and vse it for the Gout and all aches. It hath the vertues of planten, and is singular good against pissing of blood, the grauell and stone: it helpeth the Flixe, and is good in sallads: it doth cleanse and comfort the stomacke, and healeth burnings. HArtstong, Seethe the leaues in wine, and drinke against biting of Serpents: it stoppeth the Laske and bloody Flixe: it is good for the Milt that is too loose, or too much opened. Powre it into the mouth of the cattell that are bitten with Serpents. The same is good against Dygs of the mouth being gargarised. Apply it with to the heate of the Liuer and stomacke. It stoppeth all fluxes both in man and beast: it must be gotten earely or late, when neither the sunne nor Moone doe shine on it: it is of nature much like to Cetrache. Stone and Strangury, binde it fast together, and seethe it in a messe of sweete Milke, and make a possit thereof, and drinke the ale warme, or seeth it in three parts of water till two parts be wasted, then streine it and drinke one part thereof with two parts of good white wine to expell the stone and grauell. Iaundies and griefes of the Liuer and Milt, seethe it in water or wine and drinke it, or eate the herbe. Heart griefes, drinke powder of it, and of a Harts horne, Maces, Nutmegs, Cloues and Saffron, and Suger, and vse them in broths. Milt griefes, make powder of it, and of the Lungs of a Foxe, Maces Suger candie, drinke therof with wine or ale proued. Or make powder of it and quickebeam of ech like much dried in an Ouen, put thereto as much powder of large Maces, some red Saunders, and a little Saffron, and as much Sugar Candie as will make it sweete, and eate thereof, the oftner the better. Liuer griefes, seeth it with Fumiterre Liuerwort, of ech one handfull in clarified Wheye, and drinke thereof first and last, especially in May, with a litle Rubarbe or Chamepiteos. To drie vp diminish the Milt, drinke it with wine thirtie dayes. Milt stopt, drinke powder of the roote with wine at the wane of the Moone. Iaundies, drinke one dram and an halfe of the powder of it with white wine twenty mornings. Seethe it in oyle of Roses, and apply it to Apostumes to breake them. HAsell Nuts and Filbeards nourish very little, and are hard of digestion, they ingender winde in the stomacke, and cause headach if they be eaten too much. Roste them and eate them with a little Pepper to ripen the Rume and Catharre. Burne them and apply them with Hogs greace or Bores greace, to heale the skurfe and skales of the head, and to restore haire. The skales or huskes are good for the Squincy, euen as the huskes of Seeth the inward rynde of greene Hasell branches in small ale to the one halfe, and drinke thereof a good draught first and last eight or ten dayes to haue sure remedy for the Strangury. Burne the seedes that hang on the tree, and blowe the powder of it into the Nose to stop bleeding of it. rynde of Nuts maketh ye haire blacke being stampt with vineger. Seeth Nut leaues in water, wash ye head or beard therewith where haire falleth away. Hasell Nuts cause ye Cough, therefore they are best to be eaten wt Reasins: they may be eaten after fish, in steade of Cheese. Take two ounces of the powder of the Shales with tart wine, to stop the Fluxe and the Whites. Stampe Nut kernels with Honie Hysope water, to helpe the Cough. Stampe them with Dittanie blacke sope, to drawe pricks out of the flesh. The shales burned applied to the hinder part of a childes head, cause the gray eyes to become blacke. Flowers to stop, Drinke one dram of the powder of the skinnes that couer the Kernels. The Kernels ground with the greace of a Hog or Bore, restoreth haire, being anoynted therewith: or drie Nuts with their Shels on a Harth, and make them into powder, mixe it with olde Lard of a swine vnsalted, and anoint therewith, to haue present helpe. Fluxe to stop, drie the flowers in an Ouen, and drinke the powder with wine. Fluxe to stop, stampe the kernels with as much Elecampana, and seeth them to an Electuarie, vse it. Venom of all sorts, Apply a Plaster of Nuts, Rue, and Figs. To knit broken bones in fiue or sixe dayes, drinke powder of the Catstaile of the tree, and of red Docke seeds. Head pose, Eate the kernels rosted, with powder of Pepper. Lay Hasell of three yeeres shoot in the fire, gather the sap, drop it on a new ground Axe, and touch the Web in the eye therwith to breake it, then anoint the eye with healing salues. Haire to bee blacke, Mixe the shales or vtter rindes, with the iuice of Sloes ynke with Vineger apply it. Haire falling, Seethe the leaues in water, and wash head beard therewith. Cough horcenesse, Roste Nuts eate them with Hony. Reines Bladder paine, stampe Filbeards and drinke them with water or wine. Feuer quotitian, Seeth the middle barke in water, and drinke it with nine graines of the lesse Spurge, or Peony. The rynde and leaues of a Nut tree drunke in Vineger taketh away the rigor of the feuer quarten. Apostume flegmatike or melancholy, to breake it, Stampe Nuts with Rue and Hony, apply it. Waxe. Eares oul, Vse the iuice or sap with other medicines, especially with the greace of an Eele, or with Hony. Nose bleeding, Burne Hasell stickes, and blow in the ashes or powder therof. Haire to grow where none is, Burne ye Nuts husks with and the leaues of Elecampana, mixe the ashes with Hony, and seeth it, anoint therewith. Stampe the kernels with May Butter Pigeons dung, and apply it to Apostumes to breake them, auoyd the paine in the backe. Fill a pan full of the flowers, seeth them xxiiii. houres, put wine to them that they burne not nor drie not, and streine it, drinke therof in Februarie fiue dayes to become Leane. Mixe the ashes of the Nut and husks with old swines greace anoint, to cause the haire to grow. Mixe ye ashes of ye shels wt powder of Senuie Goose greace, anoint a leprous face therewith to heale it. Mixe powder of the takling, two drams with an Egge rosted with oyle, till it be hard, take it foure or fiue mornings fasting, to helpe the bloody fluxe: if that serue not, take iiii. drams with an Egge. Apply the Mosse of the tree, the older kept the better, to stop blood. olde Eares dull Wormes Eyes web to be blacke Face leprous Feuer quotid. HAuergrasse which is like Otes, Seeth the herbe and root in water, till the third part be wasted, then streine it and boyle it againe with hony til it waxe thicke, and so it taketh away the smel of the stinking sores of the Nose being put in with a Tent, especially with some Aloes put to it. Seeth it in wine with dryed Roses, wash the mouth therewith to amend ye corrupt smell of it. HAwthorne, Stampe the Barke with red wine, and frye it with Bores greace and apply it hote to drawe out a pricke. Vse the leaues with white wine to expell the stone. The Hawes stop the Laske and the Flowers, and are good against the grauell and stone, especially with white wine. Heath hather HEath hather or Linge, Eyes ach red and dull, droppe in the iuice of the leaues. Stone in the Bladdar, seeth it in faire water, and drinke fiue ounces warme morne euen three houres before meate thirtie dayes, and at the last, enter into a bath of the decoction thereof, and sit vpon the Heath in the bath. The barke of it may be vsed for the barke of Tamariske. The water of the flowers is good for the Chollicke and Headach, and the paine and rednesse of the Eyes. Stingings of venemous things, and the swelling of the same, stampe the flowers with the tender springs, and apply them. It is good in Foments and sweating bathes, namely the flowers of it, for the Gout, Palsie, and griefes of the ioynts. HEye: leapry, holde a piece of iron ouer the reeke of Heye, and anoint with the liquour that is on the iron, all itche, skab, and marmoles. HEmlocke: apply it to the stones of yong children, or brestes of yong maydens, to cause them to continue small, but then they will be weake and sickly all their life time. Apply it to hote apostumes, inflammations, and wilde fire, to swage the paine heate, as Henbane and Opium doth. Leg swolne, heate it betweene two tiles and apply. Birds to catch, steepe such seedes as they liue by in the iuice, or in wine lees, and sprinckle it where they haunt, and by eating thereof they will become giddy, and then they may be taken. Quench hote iron iii. or iiii. times in the iuice till it be colde, and it will become soft. Apply it to womens breasts after they be deliuered to waste away the milke. The iuice may be gathered and dried in the sunne, and kept to vse. It must be taken out of the tops leaues before they seede, the same is good in eye medicines, S. Antonies fire, all hote griefes, and the things aforesaide, and for running sores that spread abroade. They are not to be vsed inward, but the hearbe, iuice, or water applied somewhat warme, it helpeth all inflammations and swellings that cannot otherwayes be holpen: it taketh away heate and ache of the head, or any other part, the shingles, holy fire, ringwormes, tetters, it ceaseth all ache, procureth sleepe, and helpeth all hote griefes. The iuice is strong poyson, but if any haue drunke it, let him drinke plentie of hote and sweete wine. seeth them soft, and apply them hote all night morne and euen iiii. or v. times. Seeth it in wine, and drinke it to helpe the falling sicknesse. Stampe the leaues, and drie them, and make it into a plaster Legs swolne with a fall or bruise, heate it betweene ii. tiles apply it. Gout, seeth old pisse, clarifie it, seeth it therein apply it, or seeth it in wine apply it. Breasts not to be great, grinde the seedes with vineger, and anoint them often. Lust to abate, stampe it, and apply it to the pecten: matrix swelling, comming out, stampe it and apply it. Goute hote, apply the iuice with swines grease, it helpeth great swellings. Falling euil, apply it to the soles of the feete, to drawe downe the humors. Matrix falling swelling Ringwormes S. Antonies fire Sleepe to cause Sores Swellings If a man take a litle too much of it, it drieth vp naturall seede, and the milke of women. Iaundies, and stopping of the liuer, stampe ye seede, and drinke it with wine. Eare paine, and vermine therein, put in the iuice of the greene leaues. Goute shrinking of sinowes, seeth the roote in water, and apply it. Belly bound, stampe the seedes, and seeth them in running water and streine it and drinke a good draught when thou goest to bed. Oyle to make, stampe the seede, and sprinckle it with a litle wine, and heate it in a newe earthen pan well glased, and when thou canst not suffer thy hand any longer in it, presse out the oyle through a square bag, drink one ounce of it, to make thee merry, fierce, and hardy to fight, and comely to see to: and in like sort thou Cough dry, seede the seedes in milke, and vse it. Giue a horse as much seede to eate as thou mayest take vp with both thy hands to cause him presently to pisse and void the chollike and stone, but he must not drinke of ii. houres after. Feuer quarten, take the iuice of Hempe before the fitte, (see Fenigreeke. Sinowes shrunke, seethe the rootes in wine, and apply them. Eares noyse, purge with pilles Hiera picra, and put in oyle of warme with a litle vineger, but if it come of great heate, then with womans milke, and leape on the foote on the same side often, and prouoke sneesing. Breast suppuration and mattering, seethe in water, and vse the milke therof. Stampe ye seede streine it with water, and put to it two reare rosted Egs, and take it fasting to stop the bloody fluxe. Eares wormes, put in the cleare iuice of the leaues and seedes. Appetite to cause, steepe ye seedes in ale one night, then rub them betweene your hands till ye huskes be off, and wash them cleane, and stampe them, and make it like an Almond caudell and vse it often. Canker or fester, burne Rie meale, mixe the powder with ye iuice of Smallage hony, dip tents of linnen therein put it in. Seeth ye seedes in Goates milke to ye third part, drinke it iii. dayes to auoid al inward poiso~. Appetite to cause Blooddy fluxe Belly bound Breast griefes Cough drye Eare paine and vermin noyse Fester Feuer quarten Gnats to voide Goute Hens to laye Horse sicke Iaundies Kanker Liuer stopt Milke to abate Mirth to cause Oile to make Sinowes shrunke Seede to abate Strong to be Vrine stopt Windinesse Henbane. HEnbane: Emerods, stampe the leaues of it Purslen with oyle of Roses, crums of bread, and the yolke of a hard egge, and apply it to haue speedie helpe. fume of the seedes tempered with waxe and laide on coales. Anoint thy temples with the iuice, and thou shalt see meruailes in thy sleepe. seeth the roote in vineger Rose water, and hold thereof in thy mouth, or seeth them in white wine, hold the wine in thy mouth hote a good while. Wormes in hands or feete, set a red hote tyle in a vessell of water, and lay Henbane seede on it, and holde the hands or feete ouer the vapour of it. Cods apostumed, apply meale of Beanes and Barley with Henbane leaues, and oyle of Roses. Stampe the seedes with lyme, and apply it to sores that rot at the bone. heate the roote well, and apply it to the roote of the tooth, or burne the iuice with Leekeseede, and receiue vp the fume of it. Poysoned, drinke one dramme of Symphonia, with a womans vrine. take vp the fume of the seedes with Leekeseedes and Frankincense. Apostume to breake in one day a night, apply Henbane leaues. Frensie, apply a plaster of the leaues or seedes luke warme to the forehead, and if hee sleepe, hee shall mend, or else die. Or seethe it in sweete wine, and bathe the forehead therewith, and the temples, eares, and nostrels. Tooth to fall out, touche it with the powder of the roote. Oyle of Henbane, frie the seedes with oyle and presse it out, it helpeth all swellings and burnings. make a candle of the seedes with waxe and Pimpernell, and holde thy mouth ouer it as it burneth, or seethe the roote in Oximell, and apply it, or seeth the seedes of it and leaues, and take vp the fume. Wormes called Digs, lay a hote tylestone ouer a vessell of water, and lay thereon Henbane seede, and hold thy feete ouer it, and they wil come out. Sleepe to cause, Seeth Henbane in water or wine, and wash thy temples, pulses, hands and feete therewith. Yard apostumed, apply a plaster of Henbane and Gilts grease. heate the roote of blacke Henbane well, and apply it to the tooth the roote thereof, and it will fall out. Cods ache and swelling, stampe the leaues and seedes, and apply them. Brestes paine and kernels, stampe the seedes with wine, and apply it. Gout paine, anoint with the oyle of Henbane, or boyle the iuice with hogs grease, and put waxe to it, and anoynt therewith, or seethe the hearbe in wine, and apply it. Scabs, pockes, and Leapry, take vp the fume of the seede to the grieued parte. The seedes mixt with ye seedes of Hemlocke, and a candle made thereof, and burnt on a stone, with the smoke thereof, slayeth wormes in the teeth. It is good for the cough, hote apostumes the goute. To auoide ye ache of the gout by by, stampe the seedes with oile oliue, let it stand so xxiiii. houres, then frie it streine it, and apply it. The iuice is drawne forth of the leaues stalkes, and dried in the sunne, it is good for collyries for the eyes, for the heate, reume and paine, and the like in the eares and matrix. The same laid to with meale of wheate or parched barley, is most profitable against all hote swellings of the eyes, feete, and other partes of the body. The seede is good for the cough, falling downe of reume and humors into the eyes, or vpon the breast, against paine, the inordinate fluxe of the termes, and all other issues of blood viii. or x. graines being taken with Hydromell. The same stampt with wine and applied, swageth the paine of the goute, healeth all paine and swellings of the genitors or stones, swageth the swellings of the paps after deliuerance. It may also be put into all anodyne medicines, to swage paine. The leaues alone, or stampt with parched Barley meale, or mixt with other oyntments, plasters, and medicines swage all paine. If one wash his feet with ye decoction of Henbane, or take it in glister, it causeth sleepe, so doeth the seedes layde to with oyle, or any other liquour to the forehead, or if one doe but smell often to the hearbe and flowers thereof. The leaues, stalkes, flowers, seede, roote, and iuice, doe coole all inflammations, cause sleepe, and swage paine, but it may not be vsed too much. Seethe Henbane in water, and wash thy forehead and feete therewith hote, to cause sleepe in the hote euill, and apply a plaster of the seedes with womans milke and vineger hote to thy temples. Teeth ache, bruise Henbane, and holde it in thy mouth a good while. The iuice mixt with other medicines for the purpose, taketh away hayre. Frensie, drawe the humors downeward with suppositories or glisters, and dip a spondge in the iuice or decoction of Henbane, and apply it to the head, or smell to Henbane, to prouoke sleepe, or seethe it in sweete wine, and wash the temples, eares, and nostrels therewith to prouoke sleepe, or apply the flowers, seedes, or hearbe, to voide madnes cease paine. Apply the iuice with a cloute to the eyes, to voide their inflammation, running and paine. Eares ache, put in ye iuice or oile. Ache or swelling, apply the greene leaues. Apply Henbane with parched Barley meale to any ache or goute. Sleepe to cause, wash thy feete with the decoction thereof, or anoint thy forehead and temples thereof with the oyle of it and vineger. The iuice may be mixt with wheate flower and made into litle cakes and dryed and kept to vse for one yeere. The smoke of Henbane taken in at the mouth, is good for the cough. HErbe Robert: it stauncheth blood of greene wounds bruised and applied. It is excellent good against sores and vlcers of the paps of women, and priuities of men, either the iuice or the substance applied. The iuice cureth ruptures and sores of the mouth, and the stinke of them. The powder of it slayeth the canker in any place, and so doeth the hearbe stampt with salt and hony. Blood to stop Brestes sores Breath stinke Bursten Kanker generall Mouth sores Priuities sores Wounds HErmodactil: goute cold, stampe the roote of it, and of wallwort, with hogs grease and apply it, or stampe Hermodactil with vineger, and apply it. Take Hermodact. iiii. drams, Cummin, and Ginger ana one dram, and take thereof ii. drams in powder. It is wonderfull good for all goutes griefes of the ioynts. The powder of it taketh away superfluous flesh of knots in the face, and with Agrippa it doeth heale vp the same. It purgeth flegme from the farre partes, and is very good against the goute, sciatica, and paine of the ioynts. It must be taken with a litle Ginger, long Pepper, Anise, or Cummin, and a litle Masticke, and so it doeth not ouerturne the stomacke. And with Barley meale and hony, they drawe foorth all prickes. The rootes bruised and applied, draweth foorth all great aches. HEps dried, the downe taken out, stoppeth the belly strongly, but the leaues bind weakely. The downe within it is very perilous for the throte wind pipes. Tartes made of Heps, are very good against fluxes and vomiting. Stampe vii. or viii. of the beries, and streine them with olde wine without an ague, but with water in an ague, and drinke thereof iii. dayes if neede be, to helpe the griping, fretting, and streining of the belly. HYpocistis stoppeth all laskes fluxes of the belly, and is of stronger operation then the flowers or leaues, and therefore cureth al fluxes the termes. Ladanum drunke with old wine, stoppeth the laske, and prouoketh vrine. It is very good against the hardnesse of the matrix laide to in a pessary. The perfume, taken vp, draweth downe the seconds being laide on hote coles. Head skurfe, and haire falling, apply it with Myrrhe, and oile of Myrrhe. Eare paine, drop it in with hony or oyle of Roses. Vse it in oyntment to ye breast for the cough, and in other medicines: for ye cough: fluxe, to cause vrine, drine it wt wine. Eares deafe, vse it melted in oyle of bitter Almonds. Haire falling, melt it with Bares grease, or oyle of Myrrhe, and anoint therewith. Vse it in suffumigations to bring downe the seconds, and termes, and vrine. Drinke it with old red wine to stop the bloody fluxe: vse it both inward and outward to preserue health. Put a tent of it into the nose to breake the pose. Falling euill, anoint the spine of ye Backe with it. Apply it with wine to skars of sores or wounds. Reume in the braine, vse a Pomander with cubebs, maces, and greeke pitch. Ache Bloody fluxe Cough Eares deafe paine Falling euill Flowers to stop Fluxes HOlly: eares deafe, put in the sap of Holly layd on the fire and prouoke sneesing, or vse it among other like medicines. Pricks, apply birdlime with the yolk of an eg. Some say, that fiue of the Beries taken inwardly are good for the chollick, and prouoke to the stoole. The broth of the Barke of the root is good for ioints that be out and haue waxed hard thereafter. It dissolueth and driueth away swellings and sodereth together broken bones. Chollicke, stamp the Berries streine them with ale and drinke it warme. Stone and stopping of vrin, seethe a handfull of Berries in a pint of ale to the one halfe, then streine it and drinke it with a litle butter v. or vi. spoonfull at once. Flux red, drink powder of the leaues, and vse it in thy meats. Stitch, dry the leaues in an ouen, and take off the pricks drink the powder of the leaues with ale. Eares deafe Ioints out Pricks Stitch Stone Swellings Vrine stopt Holyoke. HOlyoke and Mallowes: crampe, take Holyoke, oyle of violets, and swines grease, of ech like much, fry them streine it, and anoynt therewith. Belly hard stampe it with sope and apply it to the nauel. For all aches and bruses of wounds and strokes, seethe the rootes tender, and grind them, and fry them with wheat flower and oyle oliue, and apply it as hote as may be suffered. Griefes of the matrix after deliuerance, stamp the roots, fry them with newe swines grease and apply it. Wounds generall, seethe the roots, put in the iuice of them, or stamp the roots with otemeale, and seethe them and apply them. Apost. behind the eare, seethe the root to pap, and fry it with bores grease brused, Linseed, Fenigreke and barly meale, and apply it to all impostumes. Dead childe to expell, stamp the leaues with a litle salt, and goose grease, and apply it to the matrix. For paine of the backe, loynes, belly and matrix, seethe the leaues in water, wash them often therwith. Yard canker and swelling, seethe it and apply it with gylts grease, or stamp powder of Linseede with it and Wormwood, and seethe them and apply them, and so it ripeneth apostumes also. To breake a botch bile or keyll, seethe the roots in water, and stampe them and streine them, and put theereto swines grease, and apply it to draw and heale. Plurisie, dip wooll in the decoction of Holyoke and butter and apply it. Gout, fry Holyoke with sheepes tallow, and apply it three dayes. Seethe it with Linseede to dissolue all gatherings of humours in the body. Apostumes, seethe the roots to pap, and put thereto as much Fenigrek and Linseed as the pap, seethe it till it rope, and stamp them well, then strein it and put thereto barowes grease barly meale, and fry it and vse it. Holyokes or garden Mallowes white or red, are moyst as the other kindes are, and may be vsed both inward and outward. Seethe the herbe, root, or seed in milke, or in wine, and drinke it to cease the hot and dry cough, the blistering of the lungs and ptisik. Seethe it in wine or water mixt with hony and Allom, and gargarise therewith to heale the blisters of the mouth and throat, and other stinking sores. Belly bound, seethe it, and eate it, to helpe the ague that commeth of costiuenesse, or seethe it, and make therewith a glister to open the belly and soften it. Distill water of the flowers of the greater Mallowe, to heale the breaking out of the mouth, and all inward and outward heates, the holy fire, blisters of the throat, and all other swellings being gargarised or otherwayes applyed with linnen clothes. to clense it from all scurfe, the roots do the like. Stamp Mallowes and Garlike together, and streine it with white wine, and drinke thereof nine times to cause thee to make water freely. Seethe Mallowes in water, and stampe them well, and fry them with swines grease till it be somewhat thicke like an oyntment, and apply thereof morne and euen to swollen legs three or foure times together and be whole. Seethe the seedes of Holyoke or other Mallowes with figs and raisins in water, and vse it for the coughs and chincough. The garden Mallowes is better inward then outward, and the wilde better outwarde then inward. Mallowes taken in meate, nourish better then Lettuse, and soften the belly, but art hurtfull to the stomacke by loosing, mollifying, and relenting the same. Eate the rawe leaues with a little salt, to helpe the paine and vlceration of the kidneys and bladder, and for the same purpose, and for the grauell and stone boile them in water or wine, and drinke it. Drinke the decoction or broth of the rootes presently after the taking of any kind of poyson to vomit it vp againe. Bath in the broth of Mallowes to mollifie the hardnesse and tumours of the matrix. And vse it in glisters for all painefull griefes of the guts, bladder, mother, and fundament, and going off of the skinne. Drink the seeds in wine to cause abundance of milke and for the grauell and paine of the bladder. Apply Mallowes to the stinging of Bees and Wasps, and to drawe out thornes and splinters. Stampe them rawe or sodden by them selues or with swines grease, and apply them to supple, mollifie, ripen, and dissolue all kindes of tumours hote or colde. Rost Mallowe rootes in the embers and stampe them and apply them to the exulcerations and sorenesse of womens breastes. Mallowes boyled and moderately eaten with oyle, and vineger are indifferent good of concoction, and doe auoyde superfluous matter, through the belly. Vse Mallowe roots or seedes in Wine or milke dayly for the hote cough and exulceration of the lungs and Ptisick, and vse the herbe, seedes or rootes dayly in meates and brothes, or conserues of the flowers. Fenel and Dill, and drink it to haue plenty of milk, for gnawing of the belly, guts, and bladder, to losen the belly. Drinke the distilled water continually to coole all hote feuers, and to helpe the griefes of the lungs sides, the plurisy and spetting of blood and matter, the bloody flixe and hot impost. of the kidneis and bladder. Seethe the flowre in water or wine it wt hony Allom as sometime the disease requireth to clense ye exulcerations of the mouth and throat all inflammations both inward and outward, the holy fire, the squincy, and other kinds of swellings. Vse the water or iuice against the stinging of wasps bees. The leaues and roots sodden in wine helpeth the scurfe of the head. The leaues, roots, and seeds with swines grease soften all hard apost. and the swellings of the liuer, milt matrix. Seethe the herbe, root, seed with barly meale in water, it with oile of Roses, or of oliues, and apply it to soften all hot apostumes, the holy fire, shingles, inflammations, and to draw out pricks stings. Seethe a bag full of the leaues and roots in water and bath therein apply the bag to the grieued place for the obstructions of the liuer, milt, kidneis, and bladder, to help the stone. Drink halfe a cup full of the iuice euery day to preserue thee from the falling sicknesse and all other sicknesses. Eate the tender leaues with salt to heale the impostume of the eye, and to preuent the danger of the fistula there, and also apply thereto the herbe stamped with hony. Scotch the root of a Mallow and rub the teeth therewith to clense them and make them white but of all things for that purpose powder of Mastick rubbed on once a moneth is the best, and so preserueth the gums. Chew the leaues raw and apply them with a litle salt and hony to the corner of the eye to helpe the apostume there, but when it beginneth to heale put in no salt. Stampe the leaues with oyle, and apply them to the wilde fire and burned places, and rub thy face or hands therewith, and no bees nor wasps shall sting thee. Eat the leaues with salt and hony to heale the squincy. Seeth the root soft apply it to womens brests with black wooll warm to heale the ach, burning, swelling, hardnesse of them. Seethe a handfull of the leaues with oyle and wine to purge women. to the mouth of the matrixe after deliuerance, to stay the falling downe of it, and to make it soft. Seethe it in oyle and vineger and apply it to burnings and saint Anthonies fire. Drink the seeds in wine to clense the stomacke from rotten and stinking flegme and melancholy. Drink the iuice often to clense the lungs, to haue a clere voyce. Seethe Holyoke with swines grease, goose grease, and Turpentine, and apply it to the belly to asswage the grieuous swelling, burning, and inflation thereof. Seethe the root in wine, and drinke it to prouoke vrine, to ease the stone, the clense the reines for the sciatica, ruptures, and bloody fluxe. The seedes be good for the stone and reines, the rootes doe stop the bloody fluxe. When Mallowes are drunke to expell inward poyson, drinke milke after them to vomit them vp. Seethe Holyoke with the broth of a henne, wheate flower and butter, and apply it to ripen apostumes of hard maturation. Vse Holyoke also in fractures of bones to knit them. Bath the feete in the decoction of Mallowes to prouoke sleepe in sharpe feuers. Stamp the leaues with newe swines grease, and heate it on a tile, and apply it to the hardnesse of the liuer or milt. Drink the iuice with wine for the strangury stone. Wash the hands, face, and feete with the broth of Mallowes, or Holyoke, to prouoke sleepe. Drinke the broth of the seedes for the ptisike and cough. The seed sodden in oyle, softneth hardnesse, clenseth and ripeneth. Abhorring meat, anoynt the stomack with oyle of Roses, or of Violets, and seethe Mallowes in the sayd oyles and apply them. Belly bound, seethe Mallowes Polipody, of ech like much, drink the broth. Flowers stopt, anoynt the ouer barke of the root with hony and cast on pouder of Scamony, put it into the matrix. Hoarsnes, anoynt the brest with Bole fresh butter, apply a plaster of Mallowes sodden in sallet oyle to the brest. Impostume, apply a plaster of Mallowes, barly meale, whites of egs, fresh grease to ripen it when it commeth of a hot Plurisie, seethe Mallowes, Brankursin in oyle of Violets butter, apply them. Squincy, apply a plaster of Mallowes Lily roots, with May butter. Stones apostumed, boyle Mallowes, Henbane, and wormwood in water, foment therewith often. Stone to expell, seethe Mallowes long in water and drink thereof warme. Swelling of blood letting, and for swelling of the yard, boyle Linseed, Mallowes, Holyoke together, and apply them. Head dry scalles, seethe the root in water wash therewith often. Eies spots or blemish, hand ye root of Althea or Veruin about thy neck. Brest impost. seethe the leaues seeds of Mallowes in fresh butter or creame with some Capons grease, and strein it anoint thy brest therewith. Cough straitnesse stopping of the breath and heart, sit in a dry bath ouer the decoction of Mallowes, Valerian, ote straw, sweat well, if the liquor coole, put hot flints into it, but if thou be fat haue a siege or two first. Sweat to cause, put Mallowes into a close tub, and sit ouer the fume thereof in a bath. Belly swollen, seethe a basket full of Mallowes in water, sit therein warme as thou canst suffer, keepe thy belly soluble. Fundament falling, seethe Mallowes in goats milke, and apply them hot often. Strangury, seeth Mallowes and Garlike wel brused in a quart of wine til the third part be wasted, and drink therof thrise a day. Haire to grow to voyd scurfe, seethe Mallowes and their roots and wash therewith. Back sore, seethe Mallowes in water apply them hot in a red cloth. Belly bound, vse Mallowes Mercury in pork broth, drink whey after it. Apost. to ripen, stamp Mallowes, wormwood, Mugwort, of ech like much, fry them wt swines grease, wheat flowre hony, boile it together till it be thick apply it. Eies rupture of the tunicles, ye iuice of Mallowes wt barly meale the yolk of a raw eg apply it. Plurisy, seeth Mallowes in wine apply them hot (see Fenigrek in Linseeds. Belly bound, seethe Mallowes put thereto a cup of new ale eat them. ech like much stamped wt hony swines grease apply them. Face rawnes spots, seeth ye roots of wild Mallowes, stamp them wt vineger, wine, sallet oile hony, anoint therwith. Head scurfe, seeth Mallow roots in ru~ning water wash therwith. Whites to stop, seethe wormwood Mallowes in sack, apply it to the belly hot as may be suffred. Belly bound, seethe Mercury Mallowes ana i. handful wt a piece of pork or wt whey, or white wine, drink the broth. Wounds to heale speedily, seethe Mallowes wel stamp them strein them the iuice wt olde barowes grease and barly meale apply it. Plurisy, stamp iiii. ounces of wild Mallow roots wel sodden, put therto butter i. ounce, hony i. ou~ce a halfe, pigeons doung ii. drams, them apply it hot to break the corruption. Eies vlcers, chew the leaues of Mallowes apply them wt a litle salt. Morphue, bath in the decoction of Mallowes, wormwood, the chaff of barly or otes, vse ointme~ts after it. Belly bou~d, stamp a root seethe it, it with old hogs grease a litle bran, apply it to the stomack. Paps swolne, stamp Mallowes apply them hot wt oile. Matrix paine after childbirth, seeth ye roots of Marsh Mallowes walwort, stamp them apply them with oile. Gout to heale in iii. daies, stamp wild Mallowes roots with stale grease apply it. Belly bound, vse Mallowes and Mercury with sweet hogs grease. Impost. hot in ye beginning, stamp Mallowes apply them, or stamp them wt swines grease, lay it on a hot tile, apply it to ye impost. to ripen break it. It destroieth al hardnes of the liuer milt. Brused blood to cast out, drink ye iuice of white Malowes wt wine. Belly bou~d, seeth Mallowes red nettles in water, sit ouer the fume thereof. Legs swoln, seeth Malowes stamp them, fry them wt barowes grease til they be as an ointment, apply it morn euen iii. or iiii. daies. That no flies nor bees shal touch thee, stamp Mallowes wt oile oliue anoint, but if thou be stinged already stamp Mallowes apply them. Mix i. li. of ye powder of Mallow roots dried in ye shadow wt iii. li. of hony sodden scummed, stir it on the fire to an electuary, vse it for shortnes of wind. Backache, stamp i. li. of Mallowes with fresh sheeps doung loffe grease of ech ii. li. apply thereof with vnwasht wooll. Matrix windy, seethe Mallowes Parietary, and bath in the water, apply the herbs in a bag. Wounds made with iron, seethe them in water stamp them with swines grease barly meale apply it. For sicknes and anguish in the sides, seethe the tender crops in water, stamp them put thereto the fatnes of wheat, so that it be tough as glew and apply it hot as may be suffred. ripening plaster, seethe Mallowes wormwood to pap, then let ye water run from them, then grind them finely wt i. li. of old swines grease: it is most precious of all other for sore brests that do rot. It doeth ripen clense by the pores, mitigateth paines in the brests and all other apost. as of the neck, throat, armeholes or els where. It must be applied warme on a double cloth morne and euen. Teeth black or yelow, clense them well vse to rub them with a Mallow root. Botch, seethe them with Rue, wormwood in running water, whe~ they be soft, fry them wt fresh butter or fresh grease apply it. Ranckling S. Anthonies fire Sciatica Sinews shrunke Shingles Sicknesse generall Sides griefes HOrehound white, boyle it in water, and drinke it to open the liuer, and milte, and all stoppings, it cleanseth the breast and lunges, and is good for the olde cough, paine in the side, olde spitting of blood, the ptisicke, and vlceration of the lungs. The same taken with the roote of Iris, causeth to spit grosse humours, and tough flegme from the the brest, and so doeth the iuice boyled with the iuice of Fennell, til the third part be wasted, and taken a spoonfull at once, and so it helpeth the olde cough. Boyle it in wine, and drinke it to open the matrix, to expell the termes, seconds, and dead birth, and to helpe deliuerance in time of trauell, and against the bitings of venimous beastes and serpents. Droppe the iuice with hony and wine into the eyes to cleare the sight, and into the eares to swage their paine, and open the hearing, and drawe it into the nose to take away the yellownesse of the eyes, remaining after the Iaundies. Stampe the leaues with honie, and apply them to olde vlcers, corrupt vlcered nayles, or agnayles, and painefull swellings about the nailes, and ioynts to cure them. Mixe it with hennes greace to resolue the swelling or Struma in the necke. The dried leaues with vineger doe cure virulent and spreading vlcers. Drinke three spoonfull of the iuice with as much scummed honie, for the falling sickenesse. Seethe the leaues in white wine, or water, with scummed honie, and drinke it against shortnesse of breath, the cough and the plurisie. And with Iris for the stopping of the liuer, milte, kidneys, matrix and bladder, and to bring downe the termes and seconds. The iuice cleareth the eyes, and killeth wormes in the eares. All kindes of Horehound are good for women to bathe in, that are troubled with the whites, and payne in their backe, sides and legges. The distilled water is good against all scabbes, pushes and wheales. The lee of the ashes of blacke Horehound helpeth the scabbes and sores of childrens heads. Seethe Horehound in wine and oyle, and applie it to the bladder to prouoke vrine, and to the milt for the hardnesse therof. Vse powder of Horehound and wormewood, with sweete milke or wine to kill wormes, and laye a plaster thereof to the bellie. dried leaues sodden in water with the seedes thereof, or the iuice of the greene herbe with honie, is good against sighing, shortnesse of breath, the cough and ptisicke. With powder of Iris it cleanseth the lunges from grosse and tough flegme. It is good for women to sit in the broth thereof after their deliuerance, to drawe downe the flowers and secondes if neede bee. It is good for them that haue had a harde and long trauell, and for them that are bitten of Serpents: but it hurteth the bladder and kidneys. The leaues are good with honie to scowre filthie and stinking sores, they staye fretting and eating sores, and agnayles, and swage the paine of the side. The iuice of the leaues dryed in the sunne, is good for the same purposes. The same laide to with honie and wine, cleareth the sight, and put into the nose, scowreth the Iaundies, and put into the eare by it selfe, or with oyle of roses, it taketh away the payne thereof. Seethe it in faire water with honie and sugar, and streine it, and drinke it to cleanse the stomacke from stinking fleagme. Drinke the water therof against the falling downe of the rhewme from the head and lunges. Stampe it with honie, and applie it to the eyes to cleanse the sight. Flixe to stop, seethe it in wine and oile, and stamp it wel, and apply it to the shares. Chollick, stamp it and seethe it with oile oliue, apply it, or drink the decoction of it with the root of a lilie. Emerodes swelling, seethe it in water, wine, sale, and set it in a close stoole, sit ouer it, and apply the herb. Scabs, seeth it in running water, wash therewith as hote as may be suffred, then vse other ointments. Brest griefes, drinke the iuice of Horehound, bulfoot, and hissop with sugar. Cough perilous, seethe the iuice with hony and lycoras, and vse it. Cough, and short winded, take Horehound, hissop, woodbine, chickweed beconie, stamp them, and seeth their iuice with ale or wine, hony, and drink thereof daily. Hoarsenesse, take Horehound and comfery, stampe them, and streine out the iuice, and seethe it with honie, and drinke thereof warme, or eate it fiue or sixe dayes. Breast stopt, seethe the iuice with honie and freshe butter, of eche like much, and drinke it as hote as may bee suffered to beddewarde. To helpe digestion and stay vomiting, seethe Horehound and in water with pouder of pepper, and drinke it luke warme. Side paine, stitch, or impostume: chop good store of white Horehound, seethe it in milke in a bag and apply it. Cough perilous, drink ye iuice with hony. Worms, drinke the iuice of Horehound and mints. Scabs, wash with the iuice, and vse ointment of docks and wormewood. pound of dried Horehound in ten pound of spring water, til the third part be wasted, then strein it, and put thereto good hony a pound a halfe, and powder of pepper halfe an ounce, beile it till it become thick, keepe it in a vessel of glasse, and take a spoonfull morne and euen. For paine in the bladder, and difficultie of pissing, seethe Horehound in wine and water, and strein it, and drink it. Head Vertigo, or swimming, seethe it with rue and penie roiall, with a litle salt in water, till the third part be wasted: then streine it and put hony to it, and seeth it till it become thicke, and take a spoonfull or two seuen mornings. Wearinesse by trauell or labour, anoynt with the iuice and oile of roses. Scab, seethe it in water, wash therewith and be whole. Stomack ach, drinke the iuice with water in a feuer, but in wine without a feuer. Lungs griefs, drink it with butter, or some fat thing. For the liuer, milte and lungs, boile the iuice with as much hony, til the third part be wasted, and take euery day Ptisick, spitting blood, seeth it in water and vse it for all griefs of the lungs. Brest stopt with colde, seethe it with hony and butter, and drink it at night as hote as may be suffered, and couer thee wel to sweat. Brest stopt with choler, lay a bed of fresh butter in a new earthen pot, and another bed of it, and so til the pot be ful: then paste it vp close, and set it in an ouen til the herb be boiled, then streine it and keepe the butter and heate as much as the yelke of an egge, and drinke it hote, it helpeth the moist cough, cleareth the voyce, helpeth the ptisick. Brest griefs, and for the cough, seeth it with fresh butter, add hissope in ale or beare, and drinke it early in the morning daily. take the iuice of Horehound a quart, hony and new butter, of eche a pint, boyle them together, and drinke thereof hote as may bee suffered. The water is good for the lungs, breast, cough, and chollicke. See Brest, Cough, Stomacke Matrix to clense stopt Milt stopt HOundstong healeth wounds, with barley meale it healeth wild fire. The wine or water wherin it hath bin boiled, cureth old sores, wounds, and hote inflammations, and is excellent against the vlcers and griefs of the mouth. Boile the iuice thereof with hony of roses, then mixe it with turpentine, and stirre it hard till it be incorporat, and then vse it to wounds. Roste the root in the embers, and apply it to the fundament to heale the inward emerodes. Seethe the seede, roote, or plant in water, and drinke it for the feuer quarten: wash the teats with the iuice thereof co make them smal and soft, Dogbiting, stampe the herbe with swines greace and applie it. Mixe it with hony to preserue haires from falling: with vineger it quencheth burnings. Seeth it in red wine, and drinke it to stop the bloody fluxe, and the running of seede, and to heale vlcers, scabbes, pocks, and such like, and also apply it. Seethe the roote in wine, and drinke it morne and euen, to soften the bellie. Wrap it in leauen, and roste it in the embers leisurely, then take it out of the leauen, and put it into the fundament, to take away the heate and paine of the emerodes presently, and to cure the same quickly. The water, iuice, or powder thereof is very good for the same purpose. The herbe bruised with swines greace, and fryed, healeth the bytings of madde dogges, and burnings, and restoreth haire in bald places, is good against old breaking out of wheals, pushes, fistulaes, and swellings. Seethe the iuice with as much hony of roses, till the iuice bee consumed, then mixe it with turpentine, and vse it for all the griefes aforesaide. Applie the roote with oyle to heale Wennes, and with barley meale it healeth Saint Anthonies fire, and prouoketh sweate, beeyng anoynted with it. It healeth sores of the mouth, that bee almost vncurable, and all other sores, and is good for the bloodie fluxe: therefore it ought to be vsed for all sores and wounds, the Frenche pockes, and such like. It helpeth also the issue of seede and catharres: wherefore the hearbe made into pilles is good for the rhewme. the Feuer tertian and quarten: it helpeth the cough, ripeneth and breaketh apostumes, and draweth out thornes and prickes beeing applied. Take the roote out of the earth, make a hole in it as long and deepe as you can, fill it vp with salte, and couer it well that nothing come into it, and set it againe as it was, and couer it with earth three dayes, then take it out, and take out the liquor and keep it in a glasse, and put thereof into the eare fourteene daies if need be, to restore hearing. Emerodes, distill it in a limbecke, and drinke three ounces of the water morne and euen, and also washe therwith if they appeare outward. Fundament falling, seeth it with ale in a newe potte, to the one halfe, and drinke it morne and euen. stampe it with salt, and applie it. Swellings of all sorts, roste the rootes and apply them with swines greace. Eyes redde, put in the iuice of it and of centorie. Pissing blood, stampe the rootes of Houndstong, and Oxetong, with galts greace, and applie it to the reynes. Apply Houndstong greene or drie to carbuncles, stings, and venime to ripen it. Fluxes French pocks Fundament falling Head shaking Haire falling to growe Sweate to cause Venime Vlcers Wheales Wennes Wild fire Wounds HErbe Christopher, see Osmund, or Waterfearne, it is good for the falling euill, and the frensie. HOppes, the decoction thereof openeth the liuer, milte and kidneis, and purgeth the blood from all corruption of humours by vrine, and is good for scabbes, scurfe, and such like griefes, comming of corrupt blood, and so doeth the yong springs and tender croppes that come vp in March and Aprill, vsed in sallades. The iuice purgeth yellowe choller, and cleanseth the blood from all filthinesse. The same iuice dropt into the eares cleanseth out their filthe, and taketh away the stinke thereof. The rootes sodden and drunke, openeth the liuer and splene. The syrrop thereof doeth purge grosse rawe flegme from the guttes. The syrrop is good against hote feuers, and the Iaundies. The Hoppe with his iuice, and parched barley meale is good for the burning headache, and for the great heate of the stomacke and liuer. Hoppes purge both choller and melancholie, and driue away impostumes and swellings, and the water of the dropsie. The iuice purgeth most, but it openeth not so much: when it is sodden, it openeth more, and purgeth lesse. The flowers sodden in wine, and drunke, are good against poyson, and all manner of euils in the intralles. The decoction of the flowers is good to bee sitten in against the swelling of the matrix, to prouoke vrine, and for the stone in the bladder. Dropsie Eares cleansing Flegm Headach Impost Kidnes stopt Liuer hot stopt Sickenesse generall Stomacke hote Stone Swelling Sweate to cause Vrine stopt HOrsmint: Eares wormes, put in the iuice of Horsmint and of wormwood, with powder of Aloes Vineger. Kanker drie, Seeth it with Hony and Barly flower and vineger in an earthen pot with vnslaked Lime and blacke Pepper, and let it dry to make powder, and lay thereof to the sore. HOrstaile or Shauegrasse: Yard griefs and swelling, distill it in a Limbecke, and apply it. The decoction thereof healeth chafing of the skin in the flankes or elsewhere. Seeth it in wine or water, and drinke it to stop all fluxes of blood and all other extraordinary fluxes, termes, and laskes both white and red, and so doth the iuice drunke alone, or with wine, and is most conuenient in the same sort for all vlcers, sores and hurts of the kidneys and bladder, and bowels, and all burstings. And boyled with the roote, it is good against the Cough, difficultie of breathing and inward burstings. The powder of it cast vpon fresh wounds, do ioyne them together and healeth them, and defendeth them from inflammation, and so doth the fresh herbe stampt and applied. The iuice drunke with wine stoppeth all maner of fluxes, and helpeth all ruptures and bruises of the bowels, guts and bladdar, and so doth the herbe or roote thereof sodden in wine or water. The iuice or water is good for all Ringwormes, Tetters, red Pshes, Quats, inflammations of the fundament, the bloody fluxe and swellings of the stones. It is good against all stoppings of the Bladder, it cleanseth the stomak, sides and Lungs. The syrope or iuice of it healeth woundes of the Guts, it stoppeth blood, and healeth wounds and ruptures, and falling of the Bowels into the Cods being drunke often and also applyed warme with vineger to the Bellie. The fume of it is good to cause childrens Guts to goe backe into their body, when as through Fluxe or colde they hang foorth, and so it stoppeth the immoderate termes of women. Fundament fallen Nose bleeding Pushes Quats Ringworme Sides griefes Skin off Skabs Sores inward Stomacke stopt Tetters Vrine stopt Wounds inward HOusleeke or Sengreene: drinke the decoction or iuice against the bloody Fluxe and all other fluxes of the belly, and against biting of fielde Spiders. Headach, apply the iuice with parched Barley meale and oyle of Roses. Eyes inflamed, drop in the iuice or bruse the herbe and apply it. Flowers to stop, put in the iuice with Wooll or Cotton. For the hote Goute and inflammations, bruise the herbe alone with parched The iuice made into an oyntment with soote, oyle and waxe, healeth burnings, the heate of the head and Liuer. Apply the bruised hearbe by it selfe or with Barley meale parched, to Saynt Antonyes fire, hote burning and fretting sores or vlcers, skaldings, burnings, and all hote griefes. Eyes sore and hote, applie the iuice with Honie and the white of an Egge with Flaxe hurdes. Eyes burning and pricking, droppe in the iuice foure or fiue nights. Goute hote or colde, stampe it with as much Garlike and apply it, to ease it much. Drinke three or foure spoones full of the distilled water against all burning Feuers, Bloody Fluxes, and other fluxes. Drinke the iuice to kill wormes, apply the water or iuice to all inflammations, heate of the eyes, inflammations of the Liuer, Kidneys and Ioynts, the hote Goute, Burnings, and the Frensie. With the iuice of Solatrum, and the eyes of Poplar tree sodden with swines greace and streined, it is much better then Poplar. The leaues layde to by themselues or with parched Barley meale, are good for burning heate of swelled places, and all inflammations. Stonecrop is of the same nature: it quencheth hote Apostumes, Byles, Fellons, Skaldings, Burnings, the hote Goute, &c. especially with oyle of Roses, Vineger and parched Barley meale. Liuer chaft, stampe Housleeke with Cummin, and seethe them in Vineger and applye it to the side as hote as may bee suffered as often as neede is. Abhorring meate, grinde Housleeke and Penywurt with oyle of Violets, and apply it warme to the stomacke. Eares dull, boyle the iuice with Cummin in an Onion, and streine it, and put it in, and prouoke Sneesing. Eares griefes, boyle it with a Rammes Gaule and the greace of an Eele, and vse it. Stampe the leaues of Housleeke, Sparewort and Peach leaues, and put the iuice into the one eare, till it runne out of the other, to restore hearing, if it be curable. Frensie, shaue the head and apply the iuice of Housleeke to the molde of the head and mids of the forehead, or anoint the forehead and temples, and ioynts of the Armes with the iuice of it. Headach of heate, apply the iuice of Housleeke, Morell, and Lettuse with vineger, or anoint the forehead and temples with the iuice of it, and The same with the white of an Egge applied to the forehead and temples, is good in a hote feuer to auoid the ach, and to cause steepe. Liuer apostumed, apply the iuice of Housleeke, and such like. Mad, seeth Housleeke in water, and apply it warme to the head. Nose bleeding, stampe Housleeke, Planten, and Ribwort with Barley meale apply it to the necke. Madnesse with great heate in the head, stampe Housleeke and Roses of eche like much with womans milke, and apply it to the forehead temples. Eares running, roste the iuice in an Onyon or Skallion and streine it, and put it into the Eare. Legs ach and swelling, seeth Otemeale and the iuice of Housleeke in milke with sheepes tallowe and apply it. Feuer hote and the Plague, mixe the iuice with Wheate flower and the white of foure Egs, and apply it to the sides. Heate burning of Gunpowder, anoint with the iuice and gleers of Egs. Eyes dull, put in Euphorbium with the iuice of Housleeke. Lust to voyd, anoynt the Yard with the iuice of Housleeke, great Morell Vineger. Liuer greefe and swelling, apply the iuice of Housleeke and Morell with Barley meale and Vineger. Apostumes generall, seeth it with Egrimony and Fiue leafe in red wine, and apply it hote. Rubbing and chafing, apply the iuice with Rose water and the white of an Egge, but most of the iuice. Kanker and fester, mixe Housleeke with Garlike and Orpiment, and apply it. Sores generall, put in the iuice of Housleeke and Celondine, and apply the herbe: prooued. Face swolne or scorched, rub it twise or thrise a day with the iuice of Housleeke. Eares dull, put the iuice of Housleeke, oyle Oliue, the iuice of a Leeke, and the milke of a woman that suckleth a boy, into a Viall three dayes, and let it stand open, and vse it. Eares deafe, boile the iuice with as much Eeles greace, a little, and put it into the Eare nine nights: proued. Eyes heate and pricking, clarifie the iuice in an Egge shell, and keepe it in a glasse, and vse it foure nights: prooued. Warts, pill off the skin, and apply it foure dayes or more morne and euen. Face swollen or inflamed, For the hardnesse of the brawnes of the feete, dip them in hote Pisse till they be soft, then launce them about, and apply the iuice of Housleeke, and it will be well on the morowe. Rankling and heate in any place, stampe it with Vineger and Flaxe hurds, and apply it. Nosebleeding Oyntment Pissing much Plague Rankling Sant fire Scalding Skin off Sleepe to cause Sores generall hote Stingings Swellings IA&smyn cureth the foule dry scab, and red spots: it dissolueth swellings wennes, or hard lumps and gatherings being applied, and so doth the oyle therof, which being put into the nostrels, and often smelled vnto, causeth the Nose to bleede, in them that are of an hote complection. the moystnesse of the braine, and is good against the colde griefes thereof, and for salt flegme, and for olde men of a colde complection, and for aches that come of clammie and tough humors. The same either drie or greene laid vpon any Tetter or foule spots will driue them away: It is good for the pose, but it causeth headach in them that are of a hote complection. Aches Braine moist Hardnesse Head griefes Nose to bleede Rume Skabs Spots Swellings Tetters Wennes Iuniper. IVniper: the fruite or berries is good for the Lungs, stomake, Liuer and kidneys, it cureth the olde Cough, the griping and windinesse of the belly, and prouoketh Vrine, being boyled in Wine or Honied water and drunke: and so it helpeth them that be bruised. The iuice of the leaues doth withstand all venom, especially of Vipers and Serpents, being drunke and applied on the wounds. The fruite is good for the same purpose, howsoeuer it be taken. Iuniper or the berries thereof burned, driueth away all venemous beasts, and all infection and corruption of the Ayre, and therefore it is good to be vsed in the Plague time. The ashes of the rynde healeth naughtie skurfe and fretting skabs, being mixt with water and applyed. The gumme is good for the stomacke and bowels that are cumbred with colde flegme: It expelleth all kindes of wormes, and stoppeth the flowres. The perfume of Vernix is good for the Braine, it drieth vp superfluous humors of the head, and stoppeth the Ruine. This gumme tempered with oyle of Roses, helpeth the riftes and chaps of the handes and feete. Vse the berries against all bitings and stingings of Serpents as the best remedie therefore. Drinke the berries against the diseases of the breast, to expell vrine, to helpe bursten places and the suffoc. of the Mother. The ripe berries are good against many griefs, are much more wholesome then Pepper. No man can fully expresse their vertues, being vsed in meates they are good for a colde stomacke, they digest flegme therein, they helpe inflammations and torments, they purge the griefes of the breast, the Cough, prouoke Vrin, expell poyson from the heart, the flowers, tough humors from ye Hyps. Lee made with wine the ashes of Iuniper driueth forth Vrin, helpeth the Dropsie. The precious oyle of the berries is as good as Baulme, and so is the oyle of the dry wood. The oyle healeth all maner of euill skabs, and all chaps clifts of the hands and feete. The ashes of the barke anoynted with water, driueth forth the Lepry, and is good against the bitings of Serpents Vipers. The oyle warmeth the senowes, comforteth the head being ouercome with colde. It is not good to sit long vnder the Iuniper tree. Poyson or plague, make fine powder of the berries, and of Terra Lemnia, of eche two drammes and a scruple, mixe it with Honie, and keepe it in a cleane vessell, and take thereof as much as an Hasell Nut, with three ounces of Mulsa, which is Honie one part, and water eight parts, sodden and scummed till the fourth part bee wasted: if there be any poyson, this will cast it vp, but if there be none, it will rest in the stomacke. Cough in children, steepe the berries in wine and drinke it. Plague to withstand, vse the fume of the berries and clouen rootes. Matrixe apost. seeth the rootes or fruite in water, and bathe therewith. Dead childe and poyson or venom to expell, and for stingings, Gather the berries in September when they be ripe, bruise them distill them through a Lymbecke, and drinke iiii. drams of it. Drinke the leaues with water Hony to cause deliuerance, to expell the seconds. Eares deafe, seeth ye berries with Sauin in good wine, take vp ye fume therof. Dead childe Deliuerance Dropsie Eares deafe Flowers stopt to stop Hart griefes Head griefes IViubes eaten, are hard of digestion, and nourish very little: but taken in Electuaries, Syropes, and other medicines, they mollifie the roughnesse of the Throate, Breasts and Lungs, and are good against the Cough and exulceration and inflammation of the kidneis bladdar, the reines of the backe being vexed with any sharpe or salt humor, they quench the heate of cholericke blood. IVye: boyle the leaues in wine to cure great wounds, and to stay great and corrupt Vlcers. Boile the same in vineger and apply it for the stopping and hardnesse of the Milt. The flowers applied with oyle and waxe, heale all burnings. The flowers sodden in wine, and drunke morne and euen, healeth the dangerous laske and bloody flixe. Boyle fiue Iuie berries with oyle of Roses in the rynde of a Pomegranate, and put it into the eare of the contrary side to that which the tooth ach is on, to heale the tooth ach. The gumme of Iuie killeth Lice Nits. It also taketh away haire from any place that it is laid vpon. To prouoke Vrine, drinke powder of Iuie berries with ale or white wine. iuice of Iuy into thy nose, seethe Mints in vineger, and lay them to thy head. For daseling and turning in the head, mixe the iuice of it with olde larde and anoynt therewith. For the megrem and watching, anoynt thy browes and nostrels with the iuice of Iuy oyle and vineger. For the polip in the nose, put in the iuice of Iuy. For the strangury, put a handfull of Iuy leaues with a pint of good aqua composita into a close vessell, drink thereof iii. or iiii. spoonfuls morn and euen first last v. or vi. daies to haue present help thereof. Take the dried wood of Iuy and the gum of Iuy ana like much, put them into an earthen pot bored ful of holes in the bottome, or in ii. or iii. places set another pot close vnder it in the earth pasted together with clay, and make a fire round about the vppermost pot, and there wil distill an oyle into the nether pot, which healeth all colde griefes of the ioints. To helpe the bloody flixe, drinke one ounce of the flowers in wine and be whole. The leaues sodden in wine and drunk, or the powder of the Berries, driueth downe termes. One ounce of the Berries being bruised and drunke with wine, expelleth the stone. The leaues sodden in wine helpeth all maner of vlcers being washed therewith. Iuy vsed in baths, drawe downe the termes, and so doe the leaues or tops thereof stamped and put in as a pessary. The leaues stampt with vineger and a little Rose water, is good for all olde ache of the head. The tender leaues sodden in sharp vineger and tempered with crums of leauened bread and applyed, doeth helpe the griefes of the liuer. The tender leaues also stamped with Roses and tempered with oyle of Roses, vineger, and womans milk and applied to the forehead, help the paine of the head. The iuice with oile of bitter Almonds put warme into the eares, helpeth the hearing. The leaues sodden in wine are good for the spots, scabs of the face, skin and priuy parts being washed therewith. Nothing is better for the canker then the iuice of Iuy tempered with clarified hony and wine sodden together. The iuice put into the mouth of the matrix, draweth forth termes dead child. One dram being drunk after the flowers be past, causeth sterilitie in women. Hony mixed with the Berries of Iuy will kill lice in childrens heads. The iuice often drunke in wine, doeth heale the terror of a quarten or tertian. The gum of Iuy tempered with wax and put to a pained tooth will drawe it out without paine. Anoint the emerods, or any great aches or cold with this gum. Drink a little of it with white wine against abhorring of meate. They that will gather it must cut off the barke of the Iuy, and renue the cut euery morning, and wash their handes and face with vineger and Rose water before they gather it, but wipe them not and so the gum will not blister them. This gumme must be kept close in a glasse or boxe of mettall. For extreme headache, anoynt with the iuice of Iuy, and oyle of Violets, or with vineger, and anoynt the nostrels therewith. Haire not to grow, anoynt with the iuice of Iuy and asshes of blood suckers mixed together. Marmoll, wash it with the decoction of Iuy to heale it. For the stone, gather Iuy Beries that grow on an Ash tree, dry them and doe off their blacke part, and make them into powder with a quantitie of Cinnamom and lycoras, and vse in brothes and drinkes dayly. boyle the Berries and leaues in wine, and holde it often in thy mouth to take away the ache and stinke, or boyle Iuy and Ginger in Wine, and holde it in thy mouth, and rub thy teeth with the Ginger, or boyle the leaues or gumme of Iuy in vineger in a hote cause, or in wine in a colde cause, and vse thereof. To driue out the stone of the bladder and kidneys, drinke powder of Iuy Berries two ounces morne and euen, with two ounces of wine and be whole. Head swimming, anoynt with the iuice of Iuy and olde larde. Nose polip, put in the iuice, or vse the gumme in oyntments. Oyle of Iuy Berries, stampe the leaues and Berries, and steepe them in oyle and wine three dayes, then seethe it, and streine it, and vse it. Gout paines, garsh the place, and lay thereon beane meale, and lay thereupon Iuy leaues or Colewort leaues. Plague, drinke as much powder of Iuy Berries as will lye vpon a groat, with a draught of white wine, and couer thee well to sweate, and change thy clothes. To draw out a tooth without paine, rub it and none other with powder of the gumme of Iuy. Oyle of Iuy, receiue powder of Balme one ounce, oyle Oliue one pint, set it into an onen after the batch is drawen, and when it is colde streine it, and melt therein halfe an ounce of gumme Hederae, and two penyworth of Camphire, and put it into a viall, and hang it in hote water, and it will be a pure balme. To haue gumme Hederae, cut a great branch of Iuy in sunder, and bruise the ende that is cut with the head of an axe, and set it rest three or foure weekes in Winter when the vertue is in it, and then take it. Shoulders ache, anoynt with hony, and cast on beane flowre, and lay on Iuy leaues. Stone, powder of the red barke of Iuy tree, with as much get, and drink thereof with wine or ale fiue or sixe times blood warme. Haires to be yellowe, wash with lee made with the asshes of the wood without the barke. Haire not to growe, apply Labdanum, gum Hederae, Emets egs, Arsnike and vineger to the place. Toothach, seethe Iuy roots in wine, and holde it in thy mouth. Vrine and stone to expell, drink Iuy Berries with warme wine. Legs painefull, stamp dry figs with the flowers of Iuy apply it. Wine of the decoction of the rootes holden in the mouth, helpeth the toothache. Iuy sodden in wine till it be thicke, breaketh botches. Belly hard and sore, drinke two spoonefuls of the iuice of Iuy leaues. Eyes pinne and webbe, vse water of Iuy growing on an Ash tree gathered betweene the S. Mary dayes (See Alehoofe. To drawe out a tooth, burne a greene Emet or Newt to powder in a newe earthen pot, and melt gumme Hederae with the powder and milke of spurge, and put thereof vnder the stone of a ring well closed, and touch the sore tooth with the stone, and it will fall into thy hand. Pissing much, seethe Iuy Berries in white wine, and drinke it, and it shall stay quickly. Canker, seethe the leaues of wilde Iuy with wine, and apply it to kill it. Pappes hanging sagging downe, weare thereto a garland of Iuy, or stampe Iuy and apply it. Tooth to drawe out without paine, burne the gumme and greene leanes ana like much in a new earthen pot, and the fine powder thereof with milke of spurge, and put some of it into the tooth, but if it be not hollowe touch it therewith and it will fall out. Aches colde, vse oyle of Iuy. Iaundies, seethe it when it flowreth in white wine that is not too sowre nor too sweete, and drinke it seuen mornings. Sciatica, anoint with the iuice of Iuy drawen out by Alchimi, or fry the herbe in fritters, and eate it ix. dayes fasting. Liuer and milt hard and swollen, steepe Iuy in wine x. dayes till it rot, then boyle it strein it when the wine is consumed, it with oyle Oliue and wax, vse it to anoint therewith. Stone, drink ix. of the Berries with wine, or the iuice of the leaues with water. stamp the Berries and seethe them in wine with the shauing of a Hartshorne, and apply it without the cheeke. Aches Belly hard Bladder stone Blister to cause Bloody fluxe Botch to breake Burnings Child dead Colde griefes Cuts to heale Deafenesse Emerods Eyes web Face spots Feuer quarten Paps hanging downe Pissing much Plague Sciatica Shoulders ache Sterilitie to cause Stone to expell KNotgrasse helpeth all diseases of the heart and mouth of the stomacke, the griefes of the backe, the stone and chollick, by drinking it or the infusion of it. Pepper corns before the fitt to put it quite away. It must be gotten on a Thursday, and the iuice gotten in the wane of the Moone. Sweat to cause, and to heale the plague, stamp herb Rape, with the roots of the lesse Planten and Knotgrasse ana halfe a handfull, boyle them in vineger and streine it, and drink it, and couer thee well to sweat. stamp a handfull, and bind it to the plant of the foot of the contrary side, and lye downe sleepe. Pissing blood, drink it with wine fasting and be whole. Blood to stop, drinke it with stale ale. Wormes, drinke the water. Brest or ribs paine and sorenesse, stamp it with butter and apply it, or stamp it with oyle of Roses and anoynt. Eyes perle and web, put in the iuice viii. nights when thou goest to bed. Eares deafe old, stamp Ants egs, and streine them with the iuice of Knotgrasse and put it in. Spetting or vomiting of blood, drink the iuice. Stamp it with Comfery, and seethe it with milke of a red kow, and strein it, and drink it morne and euen to voyd the paine of the backe, and heale any sore of the kidneys. Drinke the iuice to helpe spetting blood, pissing blood, and all other issues of blood, vomiting and lasks. Boyle the leaues with wine or water, and drink it to stay all maner of lasks and fluxes of the belly as well white as red, spetting blood and all such like, and the termes, as well as the iuice. It is also good against tertian feuers, drunk one houre before the fit. Flowers to stop, put in the iuice wt a pessary. Boyle it with wine and hony to cure the inflammations and vlcers of the secret partes. Stampe the greene leaues, and apply them to the heate of the stomack, hot swellings and impostumes, the consuming burning of S. Anthonies fire, and all greene fresh wounds. It would be gathered on Thursday in the increase of the Moone: but the iuice in the wane of the Moone. Seethe it in red wine, and drink it to stop all fluxes, terms, spetting and vomiting blood. It expelleth all poyson, and the stone of the kidneys strongly, and restraineth all inward heat of the stomacke and other partes, and helpeth the gnawings of all the intrals, is good for al the inner partes, so is the water of it drunk with powder of the seeds. The water or iuice is good for all ringwormes, tetters, shingles, holy fire and inflammations both inward outward, stinking filth in ye eares, rotten sores, gangrenes of the gums, all wounds both new and old, especially of the secret parts both of men women, doeth preserue the same against inflammation and all other euill accidents. There is no herb that stoppeth blood better then Knotgrasse. It stoppeth the whites is good for the strangury, all sores of the priuities. It is good to keep backe such matter as would runne to sores or wounds. It prouoketh vrin. Stone to expell, seethe Prosper in wine and drinke it. Brests swelling Bitings venemous Brest paine Chafing Chollick Eares deafe Gangrens Heart griefe Heat inward Holy fire Mouth sores Nose bleeding Ringwormes S. Anthonies fire Shingles Side paine Scabs Skin off Spetting blood LAdies mantel is much like to Sanicle in qualitie, serueth for all such griefes as Sanicle is good for, and also taketh away all heat of all wounds, inflamed vlcers, and apostumes. The same stampt and applyed to the paps of wiues and mayds, maketh them hard and firme. Drink one dram of the powder with iii. ounces of the water to helpe all ruptures in short time without cutting, and with the water sugar xv. or xx. dayes to cause conception letted by cold causes. Apostumes Brests fagging Bursten Conception Inflammations Sores Wounds Lady thistle. The root drunke in wine is good for them that spet blood, that haue feeble stomacks and loose bellies. seethe it in wine, and holde it in thy mouth. The seed is good for the cramp in children, or the drawing awry of any member, and the biting of any venemous beast. Teeth loose and foule, seethe the roote and wash with it. Vrine stopt Larks spur, &c. LArks spur or Larks claw, drinke the seede of it against all poyson, and venemous bitings. LAngdebeefe: it taketh away the red colour of the face, the cardiacke and euill humors in the lungs. The iuice drunk with hote water, causeth a good memorie and wit. It must be gathered in Iune and Iuly. Swellings in any part, seethe it in vineger or wine, and put thereto hony and salt, and apply it as hote as may be suffered. Ioints ache, seethe one handfull in a pint of white wine, and one spoonefull of hony till it be soft, then grind it and seethe it till it be somewhat brown, and then apply it. Ache Face red Heart griefes Ioint ache Lungs griefes Memory Swellings Wit Lunaria, or Moonwort. LVnaria, or Moonwort: it is of the nature of Adders tongue and Picola, in healing all wounds both inward and outward. The powder of it is good for the whites, reds, and bloody fluxe. For a blast, and to heale cankers, stampe it with as much Pimpernell, and apply the iuice. Falling sicknesse, drink it when luna is in virgo in the wane. Blast Blood to stop Bursten Bloody fluxe Falling euill Flowers to stop The leaues purge the slimy flegm, watrish superfluities, are good for the dropsy, so doeth xiiii. or xv. of the Beries taken at once. The leaues chewed or put into the nose, purge the head brain, and cause sneesing. houres in good strong vineger, then dryed, and their powder drunke with Aniseedes and Masticke, or else boyled in whey of sweete milke, or broth of a Capon, and so taken. Or seeth v. or vi. scruples with Comfery in wine, streine it drinke it to purge the belly. litle of the powder giuen to children in pottage, taketh away the superfluous humiditie, killeth wormes. It causeth quicke and speedie deliuerance in childe birth, and bringeth downe the seconds and termes, being drunke three or foure times three penie waight at once, also driueth forth vrine. The same stampt and bound to the head, taketh away the paine thereof. The leaues greene or drie drunke, prouoketh termes, and causeth vomit. Belly bound, temper it with as much hony, and vse it, one sponefull causeth vomit, or seeth the powder with water hony, and drinke it luke warme. To cause deliuerance of a dead childe, drinke the powder. To purge all venome, poyson, and impostumes out of the body, Stampe Laureall and Stonecrop, streine it with olde ale, and drinke it twise a day. Laureall purgeth flegme and choller, and helpeth digestion: the iuice put into the eare, or a suppositorie put into the eare, is good against dull hearing. Make an Electuarie with powder of Laureall, pure hony, and bread crums with good store of Saffron, and vse it both to purge and to restore. Steepe the leaues in vineger, and the iuice of Barberies, or the iuice of Pomegranates, or of Quinces, and cast thereon powder of Mirabolanes, then drie them boile two scruples, or one dram in fat broth with Cinamom Sugar. The powder may be taken fro~ fiue graines to tenne, with Tamarinds, Mastike, and Spike. It helpeth the dropping of vrine, and pissing of blood. LAuender: smell often to it to comfort and cleare the sight. Boyle it in water, and weete thy shirt in it, and drie it againe and weare it, and no lice will be in it so long as it smelleth of it. Steepe the flowers in wine and distill them, and holde the water in thy mouth to recouer speeche lost by the apoplexia. It hath many other vertues, it helpeth all colde griefes of the braine, crampes, and gripings of the body comming of colde, the stopping of the milt, it healeth the belly, and prouoketh termes. Shread the herbe with the flowers, and distill it in Iune, and drinke ii. ounces of the water to helpe giddines of the head, rub the head all ouer with it, and let it drie in by it selfe. The same also helpeth the crampe, apoplexia, the astonishing and trembling of the members and hands, and the palsie members being rubbed therewith. Drinke iii. ounces at once for the heauinesse of the mouing of the tongue. Holde thereof in thy mouth for the vlcers thereof, and the and the blistrings of the mouth. Seeth the flowers in wine, and drinke it to prouoke vrine well, and drinke it iiii. dayes to prouoke the flowers and seconds, to expell winde, and to helpe the Iaundies. Or take the flowers with cinamom, cloues, mace, graines, cubebs, and the leaues of rosemarie, to helpe all the aforesaid more strongly, and also the palsie and Benummed or taken, wash with the water or decoction of the flowers often. For all cold griefes of the head, and to comfort the braine, quilt ye flowers into a cap, weare it dayly. Heart griping, seeth the flowers in wine, and drinke it, especially seethe the flowers with roses, cloues, maces, cinamom, cubebs, cardamom in wine, and drinke it for all griefes aforesaide, for the apoplexia, and to restore speeche, the water will doe the like. Palsie, seeth it well in water, and drinke halfe a pint first and last xiiii. dayes, the same taketh out any stayne in cloth being rubbed therewith. Sprinckle a toste of wheate bread with Malmesey, and cast thereon the drie flowers, and apply it hote in a cloth to the nauell to helpe the chollike. Take as much as a beane of the conserue of the flowers for the beating of the heart, the Iaundies, giddinesse of the head, the palsie members, to comfort the braine. Feuer quarten, seethe Sage, Lauender, and Rosemary in wine, and drinke it before the fit. Speech lost, seethe Lauender, Couslip, and Sage in wine, and drinke it hote. Trembling, vse water of the decoction of Cresses Lauender. For all passions of the sinowes, drinke two ounces of the water, and wash the head therewith.
