Eares dull, put in the oyle of Spike, with as much iuice of Betony. decoction thereof applied to the matrix, stoppeth superfluous termes, and taketh away the humours of the matrix. Drunke with colde water, it putteth away the weaknesse and trembling of the heart. Steeped in lee, and the head washed therewith, it causeth haire to growe, and stayeth it from falling. The oyle of Spike well drawne by a glasse, is very sweete, and hath many vertues, especially for the palsie members. It the goute, and all other greefes of the ioynts. It helpeth swellings of the stomacke, the diseases of the liuer and kidneis, and the Kings euill. The decoction of Spike helpeth the palsie of the tongue, comforteth the sinowes, and drieth vp moisture from the tongue. The flowers steeped in wine and set in the sunne a certaine space in a narrowe mouthed glasse, well stopt, and after distilled by glasse in Balneo mariae with a soft fire, (but if the fresh flowers may be had, it neede not be infused) this water is very precious against all colde griefes both inward and outward. Put thereof with a linnen cloth into the nose for the griefe of the head and braine. Drinke two ounces at once for the chollike comming of colde. Anoint the forehead and nape of the necke for the paine and giddinesse of the head. Applye it to members that haue the palsie, shaking and colde. Matrix inflamed, seethe it in water, and sit ouer it. Vse it to drie vp the moysture of the dropsie. Heart weake, sicke, and swooning, seeth it in wine, and make it a syrupe, and vse it. Liuer and milt stopt, seethe it in goates milke, and vse it long. Dropsy cold, seeth it in the vrine of a goate or blacke sheepe and drinke it, and seeth it in Goates wheye, drinke it first and last a long time for bothe dropsies hote and colde. Spikenard comforteth the braine and sinowes, warmeth euery colde part of the body, and is good for the falling sicknesse, the chollike, fluxe, cardiake, dropsies, and hyckit. With hony it increaseth haire, it prouoketh vrine, helpeth the fretting or gnawing of the stomacke, it drieth vp reumes of the brest and belly, put into the matrix, it doth drie vp and cleanse it, and the fume thereof helpeth conception. For swooning and the cardiacke passion, seeth it in wine or rosewater, drinke it with sugar. Braine weake, put it into the nostrels, or seethe it in oyle, and so it is also good for deafenesse and running of the eares. For coldnesse of the stomacke, want of digestion, and stopping of the liuer milt, with any colde humor, vse wine of the decoction thereof. The oyle thereof is good for the palsey, falling sicknesse, goutes of the ioyntes and of the feete, both taken at the mouth, and also anointed. Steepe powder thereof in oile xx. dayes, then boile it and streine it. Seethe Spikenard in water, and temper thy wine therewith, and also make a syrupe with the saide water, and vse it against swooning, and to comfort the heart. LAuender cotton, or garden Cypers, drunke with wine, is good against all poyson venom: it is the female kind of Sothernwood. Stampe it and streine it with milke, and drinke it fasting to kill wormes. Both it Wormewood are good to be set in the house and windowes to expell serpents. And drunke with wine, are both good against deadly poyson. dayes, helpeth the yellowe iaundies, the obstruction of the liuer and kidneis, and is good against the sciatica, and all things that Rue is good for, and S. Iohns woort. Matrix swolne and falling, stampe it well, and apply it. Backe griefes Iaundies Kidneis stopt Liuer stopt Matrix fallen swolne Poyson Stampe Leekes with salt, apply them to euill pushes to heale them. Mixe powder of Leekes with oyle of Roses and vineger, and drop it into the eares to take away their paine, and to helpe the The much eating of Leekes doeth much harme the stomacke and eyes, and filleth the body with wind, and therefore it ought to be twise sodden with water before it be eaten. Leekes prouoke the passage of the termes, causeth vrine, and procureth Drinke the iuice with womans milke to helpe the olde cough, the blistring of the lungs, and spitting blood. Take two drams of the iuice with as much powder of Galles and Olibanum, mixe them well together, and drinke it against vomiting of blood that is of a bruise, and put thereof into the nose to stop the bleeding of it. Drunkennesse to auoide, eate Leekes rawe. Stampe Leekes with hony and apply it to broken and bruised members to swage the swelling and consume the bruised blood. Sores and woundes colde, and full of rotten flesh, put in the iuice. Sciatica, or paine in the hips, anoint with the iuice of Leekes and Lillie rootes. The often eating of Leekes causeth and thirst, burdeneth the stomacke inflameth the blood. The iuice mixt with salt and laid on fresh wounds, doeth vnclose them. Lust to cause, eate Leekes: for the olde cough and dropsie, drinke the iuice with wine. mixe two partes of the iuice with one part of hony, drop it into the nostrels eares. Seethe vnset Leekes in white wine and butter, and apply it hote on the belly iii. or iiii. times together to helpe the chollike. Distill the rootes in Iune, and drinke ii. ounces of the water morne and euen, against spitting vp of colde blood. The same is good against barrennesse, being often drunke, and put into ye nose, stoppeth the bleeding of it, and being drunke, it looseth the belly, helpeth the sciatica, purgeth ye kidneis and bladder, causeth vrine, and expelleth the stone. Wounds, wash with ye water morne and euen. The same helpeth ye exulceration fractures of the matrix after childbirth being bathed or washed therewith morne euen. Vnset Leekes eaten with vineger, are good for the stomacke, soften the belly. And eaten wt hony, are good for the griefes of the breast, increase natural seede, are good for all kinds of vlcers and apostumes like as Onyons are. seeth them in wine, and apply them to the forehead temples. Drinke the iuice with hony against the bitings of serpents and venemous beastes. For the olde cough, horsenesse, and to clense the breast, vse the iuice in an Electuarie, or Lohoc. Abath of Leekes sodden in salt sea water, openeth the stoppings of the matrix, and prouoketh termes, and softneth the hardnesse of the matrix by sitting ouer it. Nose bleeding, put in the blade or iuice with a little vineger and fine powder of Frankinsence, or with like quantitie of Myrtle berries, or Galles, or Mintes. The iuice with womans milke stoppeth the issue that commeth when a woman hath had her birth before her time. Eares griefes, vse the leaues with a Goates gall, or like portion of honied wine. Drinke two ounces and a halfe with hony to skowre the mother. Leekes quench thirst, driue away drunkennesse, and soften the belly, prouoke termes, scower the breast, voide sowre belchings, and are good for a moyst and slimie matrix, and are good to bee vsed of them that woulde haue children. Vse them in a ptisand, or eate them rawe euery other day fasting to cleare the voyce. The heads twise sodden, and the water changed, stop the belly. Fistula in the fundament, sit ouer the fume of the seedes. Licke in the seedes with hony for all griefes of the breast. Apply Leekes with salt, to take off crustes of sores. Leekes are good for the Emerods, and such as haue cold stomackes, but not for them that are hote of nature. Lips chopt, annoint with ye ashes of Leekes mixt with hony. Leekes are best sodde~, or washed thrise before they be eaten. Cough, drinke the iuice by it selfe, or with womans milke. To destroy the wilde fire, stampe Leekes heads on a shard ouer the fire to burne, and while they be moyst in the shard, apply them. For all goutes, seethe Leekes Otemeale with sheepes tallowe, and apply them hote. Wounds or cuts, put in the iuice of Leeke heads with tents, and apply the drosse vpon it, and renue it euery day once, and after the third day mixe hote milke with white wine, and apply it with linnen clothes, do so euery day til it be whole, and drinke Bugle, Pagle, and Goldin. Stone all griefes of the bladder, stampe Porrets of vnset Leekes, and seeth them in ale or wine fro~ a pottel to a quart, drinke thereof ix. dayes morne euen with powder of Filipendula one ounce, and be whole. Chollike and stone, drinke the iuice of vnset Leekes, and of the beries of Kneuel with stale Ale. Emerods, stampe vnset Leekes, and fry them with sheepes tallowe, and apply them as hote as may be suffered two or three times, and be whole. Belly stomacke swolne, stampe the heads, and drinke them with cold drinke, and rost them in Docks and apply them hote to the breast and nauell. Reines running, vse pottage of water, otemeale vnset Leekes, anoint the reines with oyle of roses: proued. Eares ache, seeth the rootes in vrine, and put it in. Seconds to cause, drinke ye iuice of Leekes and persley, with oyle of peniroyall. apply the heads sodden in oile. Yard swolne, stampe them with fresh Bores grease, apply it. Woman in trauell, stampe the blades, skald them in hote water, and apply them to her nauell hote, and when the childe is out, say quicunque vult thrise ouer her, and she shalbe safe. Canker in any place, seethe a handfull of vnset Leekes with their rootes with xx. branches of Yarrowe in white wine till it be soft, then straine it clarifie it, and drinke it morne and euen blood warme, and vse locall medicines withall. Chollike passion, stampe al ye white part of vnset Leekes fry it with May butter, apply it. To heale wounds yt are bloody and bleeding, stamp ye blades wt vnset Leekes, with hony wheate flower, vse it raw. Eares running, drop in the iuice of ye heads and rootes wt a litle vineger. Eares deafe noise, put in ye iuice with Cummin warme. take vp ye seedes of Leekes and Henbane sodden in water. Stone griefes of ye bladder, stamp vnset Leekes wt their rootes, seeth them in wine or ale fro~ a gallon to ye one half, drink it ix. dayes wt powder of Filipendula. Reines impost. seeth the rootes of Leekes lillies wt hysope in milke, vse it. Pissing blood, seeth the heads rootes in water to the third part, and drinke it. Yard swolne, apply a plaster of Leeke blades about it all night. Goutes generall, seeth Leekes, stampe them well, put thereto otemeale greates, and sheepes tallow, boile them well together, apply thereof. Apost. to breake, seeth ye rootes wt hony oile, apply it. stampe the heads and rootes with white wine and swines greace, and apply it. Emerodes, stampe mullin and Leeke beardes, and frie them with May butter, and apply them hote in the nights. Blood to stop, put in the iuice of Leekes with oyle of roses and vineger. Emerodes, stampe vnset Leekes with a litle honie, and apply it, or stampe vnset Leeks, Columbine, red dock leaues rosted in the embers, and apply them, and be whole in three dayes. proued. Heart paine, stampe mints vnset Leeks, and seethe them with vineger, and apply them to the heart and stomacke. Nature to restore, stampe Leeke heads very small, and seethe them in water with marowbones, and the flesh withall, then break them a litle, and boile them a litle more, then take out the marrow and put it into the potte againe with worts that haue bene boiled, then streine it, and put thereto powder of pepper, ginger, cinamom and nutmegs, and eate thereof first and last. Wormes in children, stamp vnset Leeks, rosemary, and plantine, of ech like much, and seethe them in Malmesey, and apply it to the nauell. Pissing blood, boile the heads and roots in water to the third part, and drinke it. Wormes to kill, stampe the blades with vineger, and apply them to thy stomack, and sit in thy warme bed. The seedes also kill wormes: the iuice stoppeth both the flowres and Deliuerance to cause, drinke the iuice of Leekes with warme water. Seconds to cause, drinke the iuice of Borage, Leek blades, and patsley roots with oile. Glandules, scrophules, and kernels, stampe the roots and apply them, make ointment of the iuice of the blades, oile and waxe, and anoint therewith. Put nine or ten fresh Leeks on a threed and hang it about thy necke, the blades vpwardes to stoppe the bleeding at the nose. Nose polip, mixe the iuice of vnsette Leekes, with greene waxe, and powder of Tartar, and put it into the nose with a tent. Coughs vehement, seethe the iuice with oyle and drinke it. To stop the bleeding of Emerodes, drinke the iuice before breakfast. Distill the rootes in Iune in a Limbecke, and apply the water with bombast to the ruptures of the matrix, and bleeding of the nose. Yard apostumes, seethe the blades with honie and oyle oliue, Hoarsenesse comming suddenly of heate, or cold, holde the iuice of Leeks long and often in thy mouth. Swelling by bloodletting, frie the blades with oyle, hony and wine, and apply them lukewarme. Ptisick, and spitting of blood, drink the iuice of Leeks boyled with oyle. Blood to stop, drinke a violeful of the iuice. Deliuerance to cause, scalde the blades, and binde them to the nauell, and remoue it assoone as the childe is borne. Grauell and stone, stampe the heads of vnset Leekes and frie them with life honie, and a little white wine or vineger, and apply them to the nauell as hote as may be suffered. Iaundies Kanker Kernels Kidneis apostumes Lippes chapt Lungs griefes Lust to cause LEntils: milke curded in the brest, vse the seeds with sea water. Glandules or kernels, drink the seeds with wine to expel them. Seeth Lentils, and cast away the first water, and seeth them againe in fresh water, and then they binde and drie, and are good for the bloody flixe, dangerous lasks, and excesse of termes, especially with some vineger put thereto, or Cicory, or Purslan, or red Beets, or Mirtles, or the rinde of a Pomegranate, or seruises, or vnripe binding peares, or dried roses, or medlars, or quinces, or plantine, or whole gals, or the berries of Sumach, the pil or shel of Lentils doth the like and much better. Swallow down thirtie graines of husked or hulled Lentils against the ouerturning of the stomacke. Boyle them with parched barley meale, and apply them to the ache of the goute. Their meale with hony cleanseth and healeth rotten sores and vlcers. Boyle it with vineger to dissolue Wens, and hard swellings strumaes. With Mellilot, a quince, and oyle of roses, they helpe the inflammations of the eies, and fundament, and with sea water it helpeth shingles, S. Anthonies fire, and such like. Ache Belly bound loose Bloody fluxe Brests curded Eyes inflamed Flowers to stop Fluxes Fundament inflam. Kings euill Sores Shingles S. Anthonies fire Swellings Stomack turning Vlcers Wennes Lettuce. LEttuce doth moysten and coole, causeth sleep, nourisheth and breedeth good blood, it is better sodden then raw, except for the~ that are cholerick. Yong Lettuce is good for the stomack, and increaseth milke in the breastes, but when it is harde, it is both drie and bitter, and hotter, and breedeth euill blood, hurteth the sight, and corrupteth the sperme. But being young, it helpeth the ague, eyther rawe or sodden beeing eaten. Liuer and milte stopt, seethe it with vineger and a little saffron, and eate it and drinke the broth. Liuer and milte stopt, to breede good blood, and to helpe the feuer tertian, eate it rawe or sodden with vineger and sugar. Dropsie, seethe it and mixe it with oyle oliue, and eate it with meates. Stampe it with oyle oliue, and apply it to apostumes to asswage them mightily. Let milch women eate the seeds to increase milke amend the sight. Drink the bruised seedes in wine to cause sleepe, and voyde venerious dreames, and abate lust. Bruise the seedes with the milke of a woman that hath a woman childe, and the white of an egge, and apply it to the forehead temples to procure sleep. Drink the bruised seedes with warme water for the ague. Drinke the seedes to staye the shedding of nature speedily. Drinke the iuice fasting, and thou shalt not be drunken that day. Pluck vp Lettuce with thy left hand before the sun rising, and lay it vnder the couering of a sicke mans bedde, (hee not knowing thereof) to cause him him to sleepe: or gather fiue, three, or one of the leaues next the stalke, and lay them vnder his feete, and as many next to the toppe vnder his boulster, hee not knowing of it, to cause him to sleepe: it is not good for women with childe, or would bee with childe, to vse Lettuce much, because it causeth barrennesse, and maketh the children raging of minde, and foolish, and the same is euill for them that bee short winded, flegmatike, or spitte blood, beeing much vsed, especially rawe, and in Winter. Vse Lettise with vineger, salte and oyle to prouoke appetite, to temper the heate of the blood, to mitigate the heate of the liuer and heart, but the often vse of it, doeth greatly hinder the increase of sperme. Vse Lettuce in Sommer with oyle, vineger, salt and sugar, to temper the heate of the stomacke and liuer, but it is better sodde~ in broths, or in water, with some rocket, onions, leeks, or garlike. The seede drunke with ale morne and euen, voydeth lust, euil dreames, and flowing of seede. Apply the green leaues bruised to burnings, and scaldings before they be blistered, and all hote swellings, wilde fire, and shingles, drinke the seede with wine against the stingings of scorpions. Apply the seede with oyle of roses to the stomacke, to destroy the hote apostume there. Drinke the iuice or powder of the seede to heale the flixe. Brests sore, seeth Lettuce apply it hote: lust to abate, vse the seeds. Headach, apply the iuice of housleeke, Lettuce, morel with vineger. Mad, vse syrrop of the iuice of Lettise and sugar. Sleep to cause, seethe Lettise in vineger, and anoynt thy forehead temples therwith. Sweating too much, stamp linseed with Lettise, and apply them to thy stomacke till thou be well. Cough of heat, and the vrine red, make pottage with Lettuce, water and butter, and eate them: for vnkind heate of the stomacke, drink Lettuce with wine, or eate it daily. Canker fester, and fire of hell, stampe Lettise with white vineger, and apply it somewhat from the sore, and so neerer and neerer. Headach, mixe oyle of roses with vineger, womans milke, and the iuice of Lettuce, apply it with linnen cloth to the forhead and temples, or stamp the seeds of Lettuce smallach, with the white of an egge, rose water, and womans milke, and apply it to the forehead, Sleepe to cause, mixe the iuice with rose water and womans milk, of ech like much, and cast thereon powder of a nutmeg, and apply it to the forehead and temples with a cloth. Pissing bedde, drinke the seedes Fluxe to stop, make drinke of the seeds of Lettuce, and white poppie, and vse it. Sleepe to cause, anoynt the head and stomacke with the iuice and oile of roses. Bitings venimous Blood to increase Brests sore Burnings Cough hote Dreames Drunken Dropsie Eares griefes Eyes dull Fester Fire of hell Feuers Sweating too much Swellings hote Vrine burning Whites, See Gomor. LEntiske, or Masticke tree: The leaues and barke stoppe the common laske, and the bloodie Fluxe, spitting blood, pissing blood, the Fluxe of the Matrix, and all other fluxes of blood, and are good for the falling downe of the Matrix and fundament. The Masticke is also good against spitting of blood, the common Laske, the bloodie fluxe, the fluxe of the Matrix, and all other issues of blood from any part, it strengtheneth the stomacke, stayeth vomiting, and swageth all paine and griefes thereof, and reuiueth the appetite. Being chewed, it doeth drye and comfort the brayne, stayeth the falling downe of rhewme, and humours, and causeth a sweete breath. Rubbe the teeth therewith to make them white and fast, and to strengthen the gummes and iawes: no man can reckon the vertues of Masticke, Rosen, Turpentine, and Pitche. Masticke is good in oyntments to cleanse the face, and to make the skinne white. Turpentine, and also Rosen doe cleanse woundes and sores both newe and olde, and doe soften all hardnesse and Apostumes in the bodie, and doe heale all manner of scabbes and deformities of the skinne of man or beast. Mixe powder of Masticke with the white of an egge, and anoynt chappes therewith. Swallowe downe three graines of Masticke euerie night when thou goest to bedde, to preserue thee from paine of the stomacke. It is good in perfume against corrupt ayre. The pilles thereof bee of singuler vertue against rhewme. The oyle thereof doeth much comfort the sinewes, and doeth incarnate flesh. And anoynted on the head, helpeth the catharre or rhewme. Teethach, mixe powder of Masticke, Corall, and galles with honie, and anoynt or rubbe them therewith. Lungs griefs, drinke powder of Mastick and sugar with cold water, as the best medicine. Nature or seede distilling, vse powder of Masticke, Olibanum, Storax and Cardamomum. Blood to stoppe, mixe powder of Aloes and Mastick with the haire of a Hare, and the white of an egge, and apply it, or cast on powder of Masticke, and Sanguis Draconis. Mouth stinke, washe it first, and then chewe Masticke a good while. Vomite to stop, applie it with the white of an egge to the stomack. Applie it with wine, the white of an egge to the temples, helpeth the windie griefs of the head, and staieth the falling of rhewme. Seeth it in water, and drinke it to comfort the stomacke, and make good digestion. With bolarmoniack, the white of an egge, and vineger applied plaisterwise to the stomack, it restreineth the cholericke vanitie. Seethe it in raine water, and drinke it to stop the fluxe, boyle it in raine water, or rosewater, and drinke it to stoppe the fluxe and vomiting, but it must be sodden but a litle. Plague, make pouder of mastick two ounces, euphorbium one ounce, spikenard fiue ounces, if thou be vnder ten yeeres olde, take one scruple, from ten to twentie dramme and a halfe, from twenty vpward one dramme, and apply rosted fiueleafe to the sore, as in fiueleafe, take it with drinke. To keepe the teeth vncorrupt, eate euery morning some graines of masticke. Chaps, anoynt with masticke, frankincense, new waxe, and oyle of roses. For cholericke or flegmatike vomiting, take powder of masticke, and frankincense ana one dramme, with the yelke of a rosted egge euery morning. Boyle anniseedes in white wine, and drie them, and make thereof powder with masticke and cinamome of eache like much, and vse it in meates for the cruditie of the stomacke, and to auoyde the hicket. Eyes blood, mixe powder of masticke, frankincense with the iuice of smallach, and the white of an egge, and apply it. Vomite to stop, mixe powder of mastick white frankincense, with rose leaues, and the iuice of mints and apply it to the stomacke. Make fine powder of white pibble stones, found by the water one ounce, mastick a dram, and rub thy teeth therewith exactly euery fortnight once to keepe them cleane. ounces, mastick three ounces, seethe them in a double vessell, it comforteth the stomack, liuer, sinewes and ioynts, it softneth hard apostumes, and swageth aches, and is right precious. Chew mastick gently to clense the head and brain, to help the toothach, or take vp the vapours of it. Burne gum arabick and mastick, of ech like much on a tile, mixe it with floure make thy bread therof, and vse it for the bloody fluxe. Face scabs, and filthy sores, put three egges into strong vineger foure or fiue dayes till they be soft, then put thereto powder of masticke, and frankincense of ech three ounces a halfe, and spred therof on a linnen cloth, and apply it without remouing till it fall off, and the scabbes with it. Pissing blood, bleede in the inner saphene veine if neede bee, and mixe powder of Masticke Olibanum of ech like much with whites of Egs and oyle of Roses, and apply it to the reines. Heart griefes, vse to eate one graine of Masticke with Suger. Liuer griefes, seeth Masticke and Madder in water and drinke it, it keepeth a man from all sickenesse of the Liuer and stomacke. Wounds to heale, melt Colophony and Masticke with sheepes sewet and waxe ana, vse it. Vomite to stoppe, melt Masticke in a vessell, and apply it on a cloth to the pit of the stomacke, and in like sort it healeth woundes. Masticke helpeth against the spitting of blood and all fluxes white and red, the termes and vlcers of the intrals, it resolueth impostumes of the stomake, and is good for the Cough. Lips chapt, anoint with Masticke, newe waxe, Frankincence and oyle of Roses made into an oyntment to heale them presently. Heart griefes Head griefes Hardnesse Impostume Ioynts griefes Lips chap Lungs griefes Matrixe griefes falling Mouth stinke Oyle Pissing blood Sickenesse generall Stomake griefes generall cold Impost peyne rawe weake LIcium stoppeth the laske, the bloody sluxe, spitting blood and the Cough. It stoppeth the termes either taken inward or applied outward. It is good against corrupt Vlcers and running skabs, and running eares, the inflammation of the Gums and Almonds vnder the tongue, and the chaps of the lips and fundament being applyed. It cleareth the sight, and cureth the skuruie festered sores of the eyelids and corners of the eyes: it maketh the haires Yellowe, it drieth moist skabs, and is good for them that are bitten of a mad dog. Bitings venemous Bloody fluxe Chaps Eyes dull Flowers to stop Fluxes generall Fundament chaps Haire to colour Lips chapt Mad dog Mouth sores Skabs Sores Spitting blood Vlcers Whites Licoras. LIcoras: The root is good against the roughnesse of the throat and breast, it openeth and cleanseth Lungs that be stuft and loden, it ripeneth the cough, and bringeth foorth flegme being chewed, and so doeth the iuice of the roote taken in like sort, and for the same cause they make a kinde of small cakes or bread against the Cough with the iuice of Lycoras mixt with Ginger and other spices: but the same serueth but for olde and colde Coughs like infirmities of the Lungs. The root quencheth thirst, and doth coole and comfort the hote and drie stomacke, and is good for the diseases of the Liuer either chewed or drunke in a decoction. The same is good against the vlcers of the kidneis and skabs, and sores of the Bladder: It cureth the sharpnesse and smarting of the vrin, and also the filthie corruption and mattering of the same, being boyled in water drunke often. Licoras and the iuice thereof is good and wholesome to swage paine, and for all griefes of the Lungs, kidneys bladder. For the heate of the stomake breast liuer, skabs of the bladder paine of the kidneis, drinke it with malmsie. It healeth wounds, griefes of the mouth, quencheth thirst, helpeth the cough hoarcenesse, softeneth impostumes. The fine powder of it put into ye eares, helpeth the running sores therof. With wine and Hony it healeth wounds both inward and outward. For all griefs of the breast, and for the cough, seethe it with smallach seedes in water and drinke it. Take Licoras scraped bruised, powdred halfe a pound, seethe it with a Gallon of newe Wurt in an earthen pot with one dram, powder of Ginger, two ounces, clarified Honie one pound, seethe it to the one halfe, and streine it and vse it at euen hote, and at morne cold for the Cough. Heart burning, chewe Licoras and swallow downe the iuice and spit out the rest. Pipes stopt, seeth Anniseeds Licoras in water to the one halfe, and streine it and drinke it at euen hote, and at morne colde. Breast or ribs impostumed or plurisie, seeth it in water vse it, or the iuice of it. Reines backe to purge and heale, drinke the powder with water that Centory hath bene sodden in. dredge powder: take fine powder of Licoras and Anniseeds of ech one pound, suger candy two pound, Peper Ginger of ech two ounces: mixe them and vse it for most inward griefes. Reume, holde two pieces of an inch long and as thicke as a Barley corne betweene thy gums and cheeke on either side one all night, fifteene nights to drie it vp. Sickenesse sudden in the stomacke and breast, put a spoonefull of powder of Lycoras to a spoonefull of Aqua vite three houres, and drinke it fasting or to bedward. Lungs stuft, mixe powder of Lycoras, Aniseedes and suger, with sacke possit ale, drinke it fasting. Feuers generall, seeth a quart of white vineger with Saunders and Lycoras, of ech one peni worth to the one halfe, and drinke a spoonefull or two at once. Kernels Kidneys griefe Kings euill Liuer hote griefes Lungs griefs The roote rosted, with Rose water healeth the holy fire, and increaseth flesh in wounds. The roote sodden mixt with swines greace or oyle Oliue, softneth impostumes mightily. Take the roots of white Lyllies, marsh Mallowes and Brankursin of eche a quarter of a pound, bruise them wel with foure measures of wine, and seeth them with halfe a pinte of oyle Oliue, vnto a thicknesse, then streine it and put thereto a litle Waxe, and vse this oyntment for the hardnesse and paine of the Milt. Burnings, seeth the rootes tender, and after seethe them with oyle of Roses and annoynt therewith. Seethe the roote in wine and drinke it to bedward to purge the body downeward from noysome humors. Wounds to heale, seethe the leaues in vineger and apply them. Senewes loose or cut, applie the rosted rootes with Honie. The oyntment of Lillies softeneth the senowes well, the hardnesse of the Matrixe. The iuice sodden with Honie and vineger in a brasen vessel, is a good medicine Roste the root and mixe it with oyle of Roses to heale burnings, to soften the Matrixe, to bring downe the termes, and to couer wounds with a skinne, and with Honie it healeth cut senowes places out of ioynt, skurfe, skales, skabs, lepries: It skowreth away running sores in the head and face, it taketh away wrinckles. And brayed with Henbane leaues, wheate meale and vineger, it swageth the inflammation of the stones. The seedes drunke, is a remedie against the bitings of Serpents. The leaues and seedes are good to bee laide to inflammations and Shingles, or holy fire. The water restoreth the voyce that is lost, and is good for feeblenesse or faintnesse deing drunke three or foure spoones full at once. The water of the roote is excellent good against the inflammation of the Liuer, the dropsie, the paine of women in trauell. The oyle of Lillies is good against all hote aches, burnings, and Carbuncles: especially the leaues of the flowers being applied after the anoynting. The flowers are the best part, then the rootes, and then the leaues. The rosted roote with Hony and vineger, healeth all deformities of the skin in the head, face or body. Stampe the root with Henbane and Barley meale, and apply it to all inflammations and aches, hardnesse and swellings, or vlcers in the hands, cods or elsewhere: some seethe the rootes in Goates milke for all the same purposes, and for the swelling of the Paps and Genitors. The fresh leaues are good for the holy fire, blacke pushes or whelks the stingings of Scorpions. The roote sodden in Honied water drunke, driueth out by seege, all corruption of blood. Seeth the roote in vineger, and apply it to cornes of the feete three dayes without remoouing to take them away. The same mixt with oyle or greace and applied, bringeth haire againe vpon burnings or skaldings. The rosted roote with oyle of Roses, is good for all foule breaking out, and the wilde fire, for burnings, and to close vp vlcers: the leaues haue the same vertues, and are good also to bee laid to the bitings of Serpents. With the flowers is made a good oyntment or oyle to supple and soften the senowes, and hardnesse of the Matrixe. The roote sodden in water, taketh away rednesse in the face being dressed therewith morne and euen, so doeth the iuice of the roote mixt with vineger vsed Lyllies and Roses planted together, will both smell the pleasanter. Wash a roote seeth it in white wine to the one halfe, and drinke thereof against the pestilence, and thou shalt be full of blisters as if thou skalded, and they will drie vp of themselues and become whole. The rosted root applied hote, breaketh the plague sore or botch. Stampe it with tallow or oyle to ripen and breake apostumes. Stampe good store of the roote with Docke seedes and Louage rootes, and steepe them nine dayes in oyle, then seethe it and streine it, and put waxe to it and anoynt the sore and hard milt therewith. The iuice healeth the venome of Addars and wounds, Roste the roote and mixe it with oyle Oliue to heale burnings. Drinke it with ale, wine or beere against many diseases, and to comfort the senowes. To drawe out any pricke, or an arrowe head, stampe the roote and seethe it in wine and apply it three dayes. For all spots and wrinckles of the face, roste the roote vse it with other ointments or with oyle of Roses. Dropsie, knead cakes of Rye meale with the iuice of the rootes, and bake them vnder an earthen lay them to the belly hote one after another often. Fellon, drinke the iuice of Matfelon and of Lyllie, of ech three spoones full at once, and dip clothes therin, and apply them. Apost. stampe Brankursin Lyllie rootes with oyle and apply them. Pissing against will, seeth the roots in water apply them to the reines. To heale a wound that no print shall be seene of it, Roste the rootes and grinde them with olde swines greace, and when the wound is healed, anoynt therewith often. Face skabby and skelfering cheekes that will not heale, roste Onyons and Lylly rootes of ech like much, cleanse them, stampe them and streine them, and put thereto oyle of Roses and anoynt. To cause an easie sweate, lay vnder thy feete the leaues and flowers of Eldren, and Lyllie leaues, of ech two handfuls, and lie on thy backe vpon them to sleepe. Apostume to breake, boyle the roote an Onyon, and stampe them and frye them with swines greace and apply it hote. Matrixe hard, frie the rootes in oyle, and apply them. Face and hands to be white, stampe the rootes of Louage and Lillies, and seethe them in water till the third part be wasted, and wash often therewith. Eares dull and impost. roste a Lyllye roote and apply it. Matrixe hard, seethe the iuice with oyle and anoynt therewith. Matrixe griefes generall, vse the oyle. Skabs, leaprie, and plowks, stampe the leaues apply them. Face red, seeth the rootes in water, and wash therewith morne euen, or mixe the iuice of the roote with vineger, of ech like much, and anoynt therewith nine nights. Byles, Fellons Vncomes, mixe Honie with wheate flowre, womans milke, blacke sope and Lyllie rootes and apply it, and when it is broken, heale it with other salues. To breake a sore breast, seeth the rootes in milke with leuen till it be tender, apply it hote morne and euen, and when it is broken, stampe a handfull of Parsley with a piece of fat Bakon, and the Yolke of an Egge, and apply it to heale it. Sores olde, boyle the iuice of the leaues, with as much Hony and vineger as the iuice, and apply it. Strangurie, seeth the rootes in white wine and drinke it. Face sauce flegme, seeth Lyllyes in water, and wash therewith three dayes. Sores, seeth thee rootes with Otemeale greats in milke till it be thicke as a Plaster, and vse it three dayes. (See skab.) to be white Skalding Shingles Skales (See skab. Stones imflamed Strangury Swelling Sweat to cause Venom Vlcers (See sores.) LIgnum aloes: Head and braine weake and cold, vse the fume of it: Milt griefes, take as much of the powder of it as will lye on a groat with broth or wine fasting three mornings, &c. Limons. LImons: Freckle, wash with the iuice and Bay salt, and let it drie in as often as neede is. Seeth raine water with as much verges to the one halfe, and as it seetheth, fill it vp with the iuice of Limons, and when it is colde, put to it the Whites of foure new layd egges beaten together and vse it against all sunburning filthinesse, and staining of the skinne. For steines of the hands, wash with the iuice of Limons and a little Bay salt, Plague, drinke the iuice with wine, and powder of Angelica. Skin to be white, and to voide freckles, &c. see before in vergis and raine water. Teethe to be white, distill Limons, and wash them with the water or with the iuice. For grauell and pissing blood, drinke one ounce of the iuice of greene Limons with iii. ounces of Malmsey when the griefe commeth. Put a piece of golde, or the leaues of gold into the iuice of Limons, houres, then drinke the iuice with white wine, and powder of Angelica, or the decoction of the roote of it against the plague, though it seeme that all hope of remedie be past. Wash thy hands with the iuice of Limons and Baysalt, and let it drie in by it selfe, and after wash with cunduit water, to make them white and soft, and to auoide all deformities of them. Stone, drinke the iuice of Limons with white or renish wine and sugar fasting thrise a weeke, to strengthen the heart, stomacke and wits, to resist poyson, to expell melancholie, and cause a sweete breath. Face cleansing, lay Limons in butter milke, and wash therewith. LIuerwort cleanseth the hardnesse of the liuer: and is good for the feuer quarten, and with fresh grease it healeth woundes. Stampe as much as an egge, and apply it one night to the region of the liuer (but not to the stomacke) for the griefes of the liuer, and for all vncomes and vnkind heates, blaines, blisters, swellings and inflammations one night, and after anoint with newe vnguentum album. Liuer chafed, kneade thy bread with the iuice of Sorell, and Liuerwort, and apply the drosse to the place. Liuer corrupt and wasted, bruise it a litle and seethe it in strong wort, with some Rubarbe, and vse it till you be well. For the vnkind heate of ye liuer, seeth it with Fumiterre Harts tongue in wheye, and clarifie it drinke it morne and euen. Liuer stopt and inflamed, the feuer tertian, and inflammation of the blood, vse ye decoction of it. Wounds bleeding, bruise it and apply it to stop the blood, and to keepe it from inflammation and impostumation. Apply it with hony to all skurfes, spreading skabs, burnings, pockes, wilde fire, and burning with iron. Reume to stop, boyle it in water, and hold it in thy mouth often. Blaines Blisters Blood to stop Burnings Bursten Chaps Feuer quarten tertian Inflammation Liuer griefes LOng rape, Nauewe, or Nauet gentle, is in nature much like Turnips. The seede is good against poyson, and therefore vsed in Treacles, and preseruatiues. The rootes sodden and preserued in salt, are wholesome to be eaten. They sharpen the sight, smoothe the breast and throte, and heate the kidneis. Drinke the seedes fasting to purge both vpward and downeward. And vse them in glisters to ease ye goute in the feete. Steepe them one night in wine, and drinke it to expell the termes, and dead youngling, but because the seedes be very strong, the seedes of Anise and Fenell may be mixed with them in like waight. Vse the hearbe in bathes, and rub well the body therewith to open the pores and drawe foorth euill humors. Seethe the seedes in wine or water, and drinke it to open the stopping of the milt. Bruise the seedes with Cummin seedes, and drinke them in wine to mende the stomacke and auoide winde in the belly. Bruse the seedes, and seethe them in wine with Galingale and Cinamom, to helpe the griefes of the stomacke, milt, and bowels, the paine in the belly &c. Seeth the seedes in wine, and drinke it to voide paine in the belly, swelling in the stomacke, the bitings of Snakes Adders, and to prouoke vrine termes. Drinke two or three drams of the distilled water morne and euen for the griping of the sides and stomacke, the griefes of the stone, kidneis, and bladder, hoarsenesse, and the dangerous swelling in the throate called the Squincie, and wash the face therewith morne and euen to make it faire. The decoction of the roote, seede, or hearbe in wine or barley water, clenseth the lungs, passages of the vrine and termes, and doth heale inward wounds. Dead childe, apply it warme to the belly to expell it. To skowre the reines and milt, to expell winde, and mende the liuer, drinke powder of the seedes with some thinne broth, or pearcing wine, and so it expelleth the seconds. The seedes eaten alone prouoke vomite, but vsed with Rue, it is good for the dropsie. Let women drinke the decoction of the roote for the health of the matrixe, belly, precordials and breast, it warmeth and maketh good concoction. The powder of the roote is as good sause to all meates as Pepper that is brought out of farre Countreys. It is good for a colde stomacke, it helpeth digestion. Drinke halfe a dramme of the roote in powder with good wine to cease inwarde paine, to expell vrine, termes, poyson, and all things that Angelica serueth for: the seede is more hote and effectuall in all things. Iaundies, and Plurisie, gargarise with the water, and also drinke thereof. The roote may be condited in Vineger and Salt, as the roote of Elecampana, and other hearbs, and kept in store. Bathe in the decoction of Louage to expell the stone and vrine, and to heate all inward partes. Stampe the roote or seede, and apply it to any venemous bitings, or stingings of mad dogs, or serpents. Teeming women, vse the rootes and leaues in meate and drinke, and sweating bathes, that they may be purged rightly after childebirth. The Squincie is healed by continuall drinking of the water of it through the stalke of it. The water cleanseth the face and skinne from all blackenesse, spots, bruises, skarres, skabbes, and such like, being often washed therewith, and it helpeth the exulceration of the mouth, throte, fundament, and priuities, being applied with linnen clothes. (See Angelica, Parsley, and Smallage: for Louage is much of like nature to them.) Vse powder thereof with powder of Cinamom for the windinesse and ache of the stomacke and guts. The roote is good for all inward diseases, and so is the seede, and may be vsed for Pepper. The infusion or decoction of the seedes with as much Fenell seede, or Aniseede streyned and drunke, worketh in purging the body as doeth Parsley and Fennell. Legges red, stampe the leaues and stalkes, and distill them in a Limbek, and bathe with the water, and apply it with linnen clothes. Emerods, stampe Louage and Rue with hony, and frye them and applye them. Seethe it with Yarrowe in wine, till the third part be washed, and drinke it to strengthen the stomacke. Thirst to voide, seethe the roote in wine or water, and drinke it three dayes. Knees swolne, stampe it with Rue and Hony, and apply it. Face to cleanse and to make it white, mixe the roote with water and wash therewith, or drinke Borage in wine. Liuer and milt griefes, vse the water or decoction thereof. sore and swolne, apply it with rue, and hony thrise. For the host, stampe the rootes and streine them with water, and drinke it when thou goest to bed. Bladder griefs, stampe Parsley, Louage, and Fenell, and drinke them with water to auoide vrine well. Reines cleansing Rising in sleepe Seconds Sickenesse generall Side paine Skabs Skin deformed weake Stone Swellings Thirst Throte sores swolne Vomit to cause LInden tree: for filthie sores of childrens mouthes, Seethe the leaues in water, and wash therewith. Skabs and white skurfe, stampe the barke with vineger, and vse it. by the bloody fluxe, drinke the distilled water of it. Burnings with tough humours on them, seethe the inner barke in vineger, and vse it. Bloody fluxe Burnings Falling euill Feete swolne Gunpowder Mouth sores Skabs Skurfe Lungwort. LVngwort of the Oke, or of the ground made into powder and drunke with water, is good for the inflammations vlcers of the lungs. Wounds bleeding, cast in the powder to stop them and heale them. Boile it in wine and drinke it to stop the spitting of blood, pissing blood, the flowers, the fluxe and That of the oke ioyneth and healeth greene wounds, especially of the lungs. Take Lungwott iiii. drams, Aniseedes, Fenelseedes, Licoras, ana ii. drams, ye lungs of a Fox i. dram, Elecampana a dram an halfe, Sugar one ounce, make them into a fine powder, take a spoonefull euery day morne euen with wheye, for griefes of the lungs. Hoarsenesse, take Lungwort, Liuerwort, Horehound, of eche one handfull, bruise them and boyle them in oile, and streine it, and put sugar candie to it, and drinke it warme morne and euen. Emerods, seeth it in wine, and bathe them therewith, and apply the hearbe to destroy them. LVpines: haire to fall and growe no more, apply the branne. Morphue, mixe powder of Lupines and mint leaues with vineger, and anoint. Head fistula, seeth bitter Lupines in salt water, and put vineger to it, and streine it, and put in powder of Germander, and wash therewith. Wormes, apply ye meale with as much oxe gall as will thicken it to the belly, with wooll as often as neede is. Wormes in children, kneade ye meale with hony, apply it to the nauell. Belly wormes leanenesse of body, mixe ye gall of a Cow with a litle meale of Lupines, and apply it with wooll iiii. or v. dayes. Their meale taken with hony or with water and vineger, doeth kill expell all kindes of wormes, so doth the decoction thereof drunke, or stampt and applied to the nauell fasting. of Lupines boyled with Rue, and Pepper, and drunke, openeth the liuer and milt. pessarie of Lupines, Myrrhe, and hony mixt together, draweth downe the termes, seconds, and dead birth. The decoction of Lupines doeth beautifie the face, and driueth away all freckles, spots, and lentiles, and so doth the meale applied with water. The meale, with meale of parched barley and water, swageth all apostumes and swellings. The same boyled with vineger, swageth the paine of the sciatica, dissolueth and consumeth the kings euill or swelling in the throte. Soke them long in water, till they haue lost their strength or bitternesse, and then they may be eaten, and so they take away the lothsomenesse of the stomacke, and desire to vomite, and cause appetite, but they ingender grosse humors. Seethe Lupines in raine water till they be broken, and streine it when it is colde, wash the face with it to take away all foulenesse and spots. Cankers to kill, apply the hearbe and seede with swines grease, vineger, brimstone, and so it also healeth skales of the head. Seeth it in Parsley water and drinke it to cleanse the bladder and prouoke vrine. Drinke it with vineger to cleanse the stomacke, helpe digestion, and voide lothing. Eate the powder with vineger or hony, to driue all wormes out of the body, or seethe it with Rue and Pepper in water, and drinke it, and so it openeth the liuer and milt. For all kinde of skabs, skalles, gangrenes, pushes, whelkes, pockes, and other deformities of ye face, skin, and for spreading sores of ye head, wash with water of ye decoction of Lupines. Rub ye lower part of any tree wt meale of Lupines, there will no pismires come thereon. Byles Bladder griefes Botche Consumption Dead childe Deliuerance digestion Face deformed Fistula Flowers stopt Freckles Gangrenes Gnats Hands skabbed Head Fistula Haire to fall Kankers Kings euill Leannesse Liuer stopt LInaria: wilde flaxe, or tode flaxe, for the olde and colde stopping of the liuer and milt, and the olde Iaundies without Feuers, vse the decoction of it. It helpeth all the stopping of the bladder, when the vrine passeth by drops, and the kidneis, and prouoketh vrine well. Seethe the flowers and rootes in water, and drinke iiii. ounces morne and euen to skowre the reines bladder. Vrine fluxe, stampe it and apply it, from the nauell downeward, to the nether ende of the belly. MAces be in vertue almost like to Nutmegs, and doe stop the laske, the bloody fluxe, and flowers. It helpeth the trembling of the heart, and is much better for all colde griefes then Nutmegs. The oyle of Mace layd on the stomacke cureth the infirmitie thereof, and the wambling, and disposition to vomite. Vsed in meates, they are good for the stomacke, and a restoratiue, being vsed in brothes, cullisses, or milke, and are very good to be drunke against spetting of blood, bloody fluxes, excessiue laske, and the chollick. Seethe it in wine, and drinke it for the coldnesse of the stomacke to helpe digestion. Mixe the fine powder of it with oyle of Roses and wax, and apply it to the stomacke for the feeblenesse thereof. Boyle them in the iuice of Fennel, and in the end put thereto a litle wine, and strein it, and drink it for the weaknesse and coldnes of the stomacke and liuer, the chollicke and all griefes of the spirituall members, and for the ache of the heart as the best medicine, and vse their powder in meates and drinks. Mouth griefes, seethe them in white wine and drinke it, or eate Maces often, and drinke a little wine to it to voyd the stink of the mouth. Make powder of a Pomegranate, large Mace, long Pepper, and Sugar, and drink it with possit ale, or Malmsey, or other broth sodden together for the black iaundies: prooued. Reume, bind powder of Cubebs Maces in a cloth, and hold them in thy mouth. (See Cloues Megrem of flegme, cause sneesing with Maces and oyle of Violets. Liuer weake Megrem Mouth stink Restoratiue Reume Sicknesse generall Spetting blood Stomacke colde The root is sharp and bitter, and therefore purgeth the liuer and the milt, prouoketh much grosse, and sometimes bloody vrines, and scowreth meanely, and helpeth the yelowe Iaundies, the Sciatica and loose members. Seethe it with Masticke in water, and drinke it to preserue It clenseth the liuer, milt, kidneys and matrix very well, expelleth grosse vrine, the termes, seconds and birth being put into the conuenient place. It expelleth the stone, and is good to be drunke against bruses and pestilence. The root sodden clenseth the liuer, gall, milt, vrine, matrix, bruses and paines of the ioynts, especially the sciatica. With vineger it taketh away the white spots or white morphue. Seethe it in wine and drinke it for the weaknesse of the stomacke and liuer. It keepeth all the parts of the body from putrifaction, cureth the morphue. For the iliak, take it with hony and hote water. To prouoke the flowers, steep it in wine xxiiii. houres, and drink the wine. Armes sore, seethe Madder and Roch Allom in conduit water from a pottell to a pint, and wash therewith to haue helpe though it be in the marowe. For the marmall, anoynt it with oyle Oliue, and by and by lay to a Planten leafe: and euery morning wash the sore with Madder water. For pricks, boyle powder of the rootes with oyle Oliue and apply it or anoint. red water for sores olde or newe, take running water a pottell, ashes of olde Ash wood, tan oose that lether neuer came in a pottell, Madder and Allom of eche one pound in fine powder, steepe them together ten dayes, then put thereto ten ounces of greene copres, and one ounce of Ginger, and seethe it to a quart, then strein it and wash with the water, and vse the rest plasterwise. Seethe it in whey with Paunces, called Herba trinitatis, and giue it to swine for many diseases, as botches, byles, and sorenesse in their throats. Matrixe comming out, wash it with the iuice or decoction of Madder. Flowers to cause, seethe it in White wine and drink it with Triphera magna. Head megrem, mixe powder of Madder with Rye flower and aquavitae and apply it. Armes sore Bellyache Byles Bruses Colouring red Deliuerance Flowers stopt Seethe it in wine, and drinke it for shortnesse and straitnesse of breath, the hard and vneasie cough, and to cause easy spetting. It stoppeth the flux and spetting of blood, prouoketh vrine, prouoketh termes, breaketh the stone, expelleth the seconds, vnstoppeth the liuer and milt, helpeth the griefes of the milt, and the yelowe iaundies, all fluxions and moystnesse of the stomacke, and bitings and stingings of venemous beastes. Bitings of mad dogges and venemous beastes, stampe it greene and apply it. It restoreth haire, dispatcheth the strume or swellings in childrens throats. Head scurfe and scales, steepe it in lee, or seethe it, and wash therewith. Headache, weare a garland of it, or a quilted cap of it about the head. The leaues of Adianthum or Wall Rue mixt wt a litle Salt peter, the vrin of a yong child, taketh away the shriueled wrincklings yt appeare on womens bellies after their deliuerance being washed therwith. Giuen in meat to quailes it maketh them to fight well. The broth wherwith i. li. of ye green herb hath bene sodden purgeth yelow choler flegm from the brest stomack. Tricomanes, Polytricon or English Maidenhaire hath the same vertues that Capillus veneris hath being sodden wt wine or Hydromell, and drunke dayly, it helpeth the obstructions of the liuer, the iaundies, griefes of the lungs, difficulties of breath, it voydeth melancholy by vrine, it softneth the hardnesse and swelling of the milt, expelleth poyson, that hath bene drunke, and the flowers and seconds, and breaketh the stone. It is to be gathered when it flowreth, and dryed in the shadowe, and may be kept a yeere. Headache grieuous, seethe it in lee, and wash the head therewith. Stomacke cold and lacke of digestion, vse powder of it in meate or wine. Black and blew spots, mixe powder of the leaues with hony, and anoynt therewith. Marierom comforteth the brain, openeth obstructions, and cureth the apoplexia. The oyle of it heateth the members both inward and outward, the ioynts, sinewes and matrix being applied warme. It helpeth all griefes, comforteth the braine, and all members of the body. Marierom heateth all the inner members, softeneth the milt, and swageth the swelling thereof. For the dropsie in the beginning, griping in the body, and to prouoke vrine, seethe the herbe and drinke it. Stomacke paine, apply the herbe and flowers in a bag. Head to clense, put the powder of it into the nose. Matrix to clense, sit ouer the vapour of it sodden in water. Flowers to cause, put in the herbe as a pessary. For the ache, swellings and loosenesse of ioynts or members, apply the herbe with wax to strengthen them, and to helpe other griefes of them. Reume to stop, and to cause sneesing, blow in powder of it with vineger. The iuice drawen into the nose, to comfort the braine, cause sneesing, to reuiue them that haue the lethargy and the falling euill. Speech lost, strike the water of it on the tongue. To comfort the braine and memory, drinke the water three or foure ounces morne and euen dayly, vse the herbe as other pot herbes for all meates. Stampe Marierom with barly flowre, and apply it to the ache, inflammation and swelling of the eyes. Apply the iuice to congealed blood to desperse it, and to the swelling of the milt. The oyle of it softneth hard sinewes, and the hardnesse of the matrix. Stampe the leaues with vineger and salt, and apply to the byting of a scorpion. plaster of Marierom, oyle, and wax, dissolueth colde swellings, and is good for members out of ioynt or wrenched. Smelling lost, and to purge and comfort the braine, put the powder or iuice into the nose. Marierom is good for all colde griefes, and for fretting and consuming vlcers. The oyle put into the eares with wooll is good against deafnesse. Headache of murre, bruse it and put it into the nose. Head sleepy or drowsie, prouoke sneesing with powder of Marierom gentle. Stomacke griefes and windy, stampe the leaues and flowers and apply them. Drinke the powder of it with wine to heat and comfort the stomacke and helpe digestion. Members out of ioynt, apply powder of it with wax. For the white and colde fluxe of the matrix, distill it in a limbek in the end of May, and drinke three ounces of it. Bruses and blacke spots, anoynt with the pouder of it and hony. Dropsie Drowsinesse Eares deafe Eyes griefes Falling euill Flowers stopt to stop Sicknesse generall Sleepinesse Smelling lost Sores Speech lost Stomack ach Side paine, stamp the root, and drinke it with wine. Tongue palsie, stamp the keyes and seethe them in possit ale, and streine it and drinke it with sugar morne and euen dayly. Liuer paine, stamp one ounce and a halfe of the root, and drink it with sweete wine. The flowers steeped in vineger and salt, may be kept two yeeres. Drinke the flowers with wine to comfort the stomacke, procure appetite, to consume humors of the stomacke, and to heate the stomacke. Seethe the rynd of the roote in Wine, and drinke it to digest euill humours, and to helpe the griefes of the liuer. Mixe powder of the rynd of the roote with the iuice of Fennell, a little wine, and a little oyle, boyle them together to a thicknesse, and put a little wax to it, and anoynt the colde stomacke therewith to helpe it greatly. Palsie, take the iuice of the herbe and roote in a glister. Seethe the flowers of Marigold and Spikenarde in wine and drinke it, and also apply it to swage the swelling of the breastes by stopping of the termes. Drinke the decoction of the flowers to stop pissing of blood in short time. The distilled water healeth all griefes of the eyes both hote and colde, cleareth the sight, and auoydeth all griefes of the eyes and head. Bruse a Marigold leafe, and put it into thy nose to clense the head and auoyde reume. The Flowers themselues, or with their plant boyled in wine and drunke, prouoke termes. The same with the herbe dryed and strawed on quicke coles, draweth downe the seconds and dead childe, the fume thereof being receiued vp into the naturall place. Take the conserue of the Flowers fasting, to cure the trembling of the heart, and to withstand the plague and euill ayre. Drink the flowers or iuice to draw downe the termes taken warme. Wash the mouth therewith for the toothach, it is a present remedy. Seethe the herbe in possit ale or white wine drinke it to prouoke sweat in the pestilence. Emerods, seethe Marigolds and Mulleine in wine, and foment therewith. Warts, wash them in the iuice of Marigolds, or wash thy hands, and then rub them with the iuice of Marigolds and salt. Wits lost or mad, take the iuice of Marigolde and Wormwood of eche one spoonfull. The leaues or iuice boyled with milke to an vnguent, healeth all vlcers, wounds, with as much white wine, at euen hote, and at morne colde: the warme iuice with a litle vineger, helpeth aches, bruses, swellings, apostumes, cankers, carbuncles, fellons, and rednes, inflammations, brests sores, or cankers. Flowers stopt, drinke the iuice, or make fritters of them with egs and meale and vse them. Feet or toes corns, stampe Marigolds and apply them morne and euen. Palsie, drinke the iuice of a handfull of Marigolds with a good draught of Ale, and a spoonefull of Mustarde. For chafing of the liuer and griefes of the milte, stamp Marigolds with Saffron, and drinke them with White wine first and last. Warts, apply powder of Sauen with the iuice of Marigolds. to bring downe the seconds, or drinke the decoction of them, or vse them in a pessary. Agnails, pare them to the quicke, and stampe Marigolds and apply them. Feuer quarten, drinke possit ale made with Marigolds and Fennel foure times before the fits if neede be. Head and stomacke to clense from flegme, xoll a Marigolde leafe betweene thy fingers, and put it into thy nose, and to be in stead of a gargarisme. Cramp in children, seethe Marigolds in water, and bath them therein, and anoynt with oyle of Lillies or of Priuet. Seconds, drink powder of the flowers and put thereof about a wax candle, and light it, and receiue vp the fume thereof. Cankers in wounds, apply the iuice of the greater Marigolds. Flesh mole, stamp Bentbrow with yong Marigolds that neuer flowred, and strein it, and anoynt with the iuice with a crowes fether. wash thy mouth with the iuice of the flowers and leaues. Cramp Dead child Death to preuent Eares wormes Eyes griefes Emerods MArsh mallowe sodden in wine or Mede, or bruised and applyed, is good for wounds, hard kernels, swellings and wennes, for burnings swellings behind the eares, impostumes, burning impostumes of the Paps, bruising of the fundament, windy swellings, and for stifnesse of the senowes: for it driueth away, maketh ripe, bursteth couereth with a skin. Seeth it in wine or Mede, put to it swines grease or Goose grease, or Turpentine, that it may bee clammie, and put thereof into the Mother for the inflammation and stopping, as a pessarye: the broath that the herbe is sodden in, is good for the same, it draweth out also burdens of the Mother and the seconds. Seeth the roote in wine and drinke it for the difficulty of making water, the rawnesse that co~meth by the stone, the bloody flixe, the sciatica, the trembling of any member, the bursting. Teethach, seeth ye herb in vineger and hold it in thy mouth. Stampe the seeds anoint freckles and foule spots therewith in the sunne. Mixe the seedes with oyle and anoint thee, and no venemous beast shall bite thee. It is good against the bloody fluxe, vomiting blood, and the common flixe. Drinke the same seedes sodden with water and vineger or in wine, and drinke it against all stinging of Bees, wasps such like. Apply the leaues with a little oyle to burnings, bitings stingings, &c. Take the roots of Marsh mallowes or Holyokes, or common Mallowes twelue ounces, Linseeds sixe ounces, fats or greases of hennes, geese, capons or neates feete, a wine quart, waxe sixe ounces, turpentine one ounce, rosin three ounces: bruise well the roots seeds, steepe them houres in a pottell of water skalding hote, or rather in halfe water halfe white wine, then seeth it till the broth be all slimy, then streine it seeth a pinte of the slimy broth with the fats, till the warry substance be sodden away, then melt the waxe, rosin turpentine, seeth them a litle altogether, and scum it and keepe it, for all hard lumps, swellings and bruises in any place, whether it come of inward or outward cause, it is good also for horse feete that bee swelled or bruised. Seeth the roote of Marsh mallow in wine, drinke it to helpe all the griefs of the lungs or breast, of the whole body, the gnawings of the guts, the bloody flixe other griefs comming of choler, and whatsoeuer is before written of the Mallowes, this hath the Slice the roote thinne seeth it in milke or water, to heale all hardnesse, vlcers vncomes. The leaues or the oyle of them helpeth and healeth all stingings of waspes and Bees. The roote sodden in water, and mixt with swines greace, goose greace or Turpentine, and put in as a Pessary, helpeth all inflammations and pyles of the Matrixe. The powder of the seedes mixt with Deaw gathered in May, taketh away the foule spots of the face. The root or seede sodden in vineger and holden in the mouth, helpeth the tooth ach. The root boyled in wine and drunke, is good for the paine of the grauell and stone, the bloody flixe, the sciatica, the trembling shaking of any member, and cramps and burstings: and boiled in milke, it healeth the Cough. The rootes boyled in wine or honied water and stamped small, doe heale newe wounds, dissolue and consume all cold tumors and swellings, as wennes and hard kernels, impost, behinde the eares, burning impost, of the Paps, olde and windie impostumes swellings, rifts chaps of the fundament, trembling of the senowes and senowye parts: the leaues are good for all the aforesaid, but not so good as the root. The leaues applied with oyle, heale burnings, bitings of men or dogs, and stinging of Bees and waspes. The seede greene or dried, punned and drunke, healeth the bloody fluxe, all issues of blood and the laske, and with vineger they take away the foule spots of the face doth blacke and white being anointed in the hote sunne or in a bath or stewe. Ptisicke and infection of the Lungs, seeth the leaues and seedes in milke and drinke it euery morning. Mouth and throate sores, seeth the leaues with wine and honie, and put thereto Roch Alom, and wash therewith cold. White flawes and Apost. of the fingers, stampe the leaues with barrowes greace and crums of bread and apply it. For vnquietnesse of Feuers, to cause sleepe auoid drought, Distill the herbe and roote in a Lymbecke in the beginning of May, rub the feete with the water. Plurisie, seeth Mallowes in oyle, and stampe them and apply them. MEdlers: stone to breake, vse the powder of ye stones of them. Medlers stop the belly, especially being greene and hard, for after they haue bene kept a while, they become soft tender, and stoppe not so much, but then they are more conuenient to be eaten, but they nourish little or nothing at all. The stones made into powder and drunke, breake the stone and driue foorth grauell: if one eate too much of such binding fruite, they will stop both the liuer the milt. Gedlers are to be vsed for medicine, and not for meates. They are good after meales for them that be Laxatiue, but being eaten much, they breede melancholy. The kernels are good against ye stone, one spooneful of their powder being drunke wt white wine, wherin Parsly roots haue bene sodden. MEdowort: Drinke the decoction or powder of it to stop the laske and all issues of blood. Boile the flowers in white wine and drinke it to cure the feuer quarten. Seeth the root in wine and Hony drinke it to loose the belly draw downe choller. But sodden in red wine it stoppeth the bloody fluxe: Stampe the herbe with Mede apply it to swellings, to drawe forth pricks, splents. Vse not the seede, for it causeth headach: Seeth it in fresh butter and streine it, and anoint therewith any burning or skalding. MElilot boyled by it selfe with sweete Malmesie, or with the yolke of a rosted Egge or the meale of Fenigrek or Linseed, or with fine flower or meale, or with Cyeory, to swage all kinde of hote swellings, especially of the eyes, matrixe, fundament and stones. Apply it with Galles or chalke, or with good wine to heale skurfe and mattering sores. Stampe it raw or sodden with wine, and apply it to the paine of the stomacke, and to dissolue the impostumes and swellings thereof. Headach, apply it to the forehead with oyle of Roses and vineger. The common Melilot is good for all the aforesaid, it is most vsed to swage paine, as the flowers of Camomile is. The same boyled in wine and drunke, prouoketh vrine, breaketh the stone, swageth the payne of the kidneys, bladder and belly, and ripeth flegme, causing it to be easily spit foorth. Eares paine, drop in the iuice with Malmesie: drinke it with wine to soften the hardnesse of the stomacke and Liuer. All sortes of Melilot sodden in wine and drunke with some Honie, doe mollifie all inward impostumes. The same sodden with Malmesie and drunke, helpeth the tumors of the matrixe. All the kindes of it are good to mitigate all outward aches, especially the inflammations of the eyes, being stamped and applied, and are good to prouoke sweate. The distilled water is good for hote griefes of the eyes: Veine cut, stampe Melilot Costmary, and apply it but once. Stitch, anoint with oile of Melilot, then stampe Melilot and apply it but once on a piece of Leather, and change it but once a weeke. Stones griefe Stitch Stone Swellings Veine cut Vrine stopt Mellons. Pill off the vppermost skinne of the seedes of Mellons, and make the rest into powder, and with Beane meale kneade cakes with Rose water, and drie them in the sunne, and therewith wash the face and skinne orderly to cleanse it from all spots, sunne burning, and red pimples and foulenesse, and to make it cleere and faire. The same seedes eaten or drunke, cause vrin, and purge the Lungs and Kidneys. The roote doth heale such vlcers as doe stand full of matter, being applyed with Hony. Many eate the Mellons with vineger, Peniroyall and Onions mixed together. Distill Mellous when they are ripe, drinke three or foure ounces of the water in the mornings a moneth together, to helpe the stone, to prouoke vrine, to purge the kidneys. Eyes running, lay the vttermost pill to the forehead temples. Drinke the water with suger, to coole all inward vnnaturall heates, to cease thirst and swellings in the body wheresoeuer it be, being also applied with linnen clothes. The fruit of the garden Pepon or Pompion is best to be eaten fasting, and not to eate any other meates after them till they be halfe digested, and so they are good against vnnaturall heates and wicked Agewes. The seedes purge the skinne being washed with the decoction of them. They must not be eaten rawe, but be boyled with good flesh or sweete milke, and so it is better then the Cucumber, and is good for a hote stomacke. The flesh or substance of it being finely stamped, doth swage and heale the inflammation of the eyes being applyed. The seedes may bee vsed as the seedes of Melons, to cleanse the skinne. Drinke one ounce of the roote with Honied water to cause vomite: Mellons and Pompions be both of one nature. Meu. MEu, Meon, or Spignel, boyle or soke the roots in water, and drinke it to open mightely the stoppings of the kidneys and bladder, to prouoke vrine, to helpe the strangury, and consume all windinesse of the stomacke. Take it with Honie against the gripings of the Belly, the griefes of the Mother, Goute in the feete, ache in the ioynts, Reumes, and Catharres in the breast. Apply it to the lower part of childrens backes to prouoke vrine. Aches Backe ach Belly ach Bladder stopt Catharre Feete Gout Flowers stopt Gouts Ioynts ach Kidneys stopt Reume Strangury Vrine stopt Anoint the holy fire with the iuice of Mints, brimstone vineger, to cease the paine forthwith. Guts and kidneys payne, seeth Mints in wine and drinke it. Seeth Mints in wine oyle, and apply it to impostumes to dissolue them, and to helpe the Paps that are hard with curded milke. Mouth, gums and teeth rotten and stinke, seeth garden Mints in vineger and wash therewith, and after rub them with powder of Mints. When any medicine is giuen against poyson, it ought to be giuen with the iuice of Mints, or els with wine of the decoction thereof: which wine or Mints with Hony doth helpe against stopping of the liuer, milt and passage of the water, and the iuice with Hony slayeth wormes in the belly in the eares being dropped in. Mints put into milke, doeth not suffer it to curd, although bee put to it, and in like sort generation. Drinke the iuice with vineger against spitting of blood, to stop vomiting, to kill small wormes in the body. All Mints greene or dry, are good for the stomacke, and also the distilled water, to helpe digestion, to auoid the hicket, lothing choller, especially vsed in sawses: it prouoketh lust, and comforteth all the members, and the smell of it comforteth the braine and memory. Headach, apply the iuice or water with a cloth, and to swolne breasts for their curded milke, and drop it into the eares for their ache. Biting of a mad dog, stampe Mint with salt apply it. Mixe powder of water Mints with leuen and apply it to the stomacke to withstand belching vomiting. All Mints are good to bath in to prouoke sweate. It is singular good in sawses, and for a woman that hath had hard labour, being drunke with wine. Eat powder of Mints after meate to helpe digestion, and healeth all the griefes of the milt. The iuice withstandeth venom, and slaieth wormes: let no wounded body vse any Mint, because it hindreth the healing of the wound Lethargy and forgetfulnesse, stampered Mints with Rue, oyle and vineger, and apply it to the nostrels. Frensie, seethe Mints in vineger and apply them vnto the head, and put the iuice of Iuye into the Nose. Apply Mints to thy head to voyde all paine that commeth of colde cause. Stampe water Mints, and applie them to the middest of thy browe and nape of thy necke against madnesse, and to prouoke sleepe. Garden Mints in meats and drinkes is very good for the stomacke, it warmeth and openeth it, and drieth vp all superfluous humours therein, voydeth the paine and helpeth digestion. Drinke two or three branches with the iuice of a sowre Pomgranate against the Hicket, vomiting, and chollericke passion, which hath a laske withall. Seethe Mints in water, and drinke it three dayes to cure the gryping and gnawing of the bellie, and the chollicke, and to prouoke the termes. Stampe Mints with parched Barley meale and apply it to tumors swellings to consume them, and to the headach to cure it. Mixe the iuice with Honied water, and droppe it into the eares to cure their paine, and gargarise therewith to auoyde the roughnesse of the tongue and throate. Water Mints are much of like nature to garden Mints, and are very good for the grauell and stone in the kidneys, and the strangurie or pissing by drops being boyled in wine drunke. Seeth three branches in wine and drinke it fasting to help replection. The iuice mixt with good Treacle and eaten in the mornings, killeth wormes in children. Mints are wholsome to be sodden in windie meates, as peason, &c. and sodden in possit ale with Fennell seede, it increaseth vitall seede. For swooning weaknesse of the heart by feuers or other sickenesse, stampe them with vineger and a little wine, and rub the lips, tongue, teeth and nose, and temples therewith, dip a toste therein and chewe it, sucke thereof and swallow it. Liuer, milt, kidneys bladder stopt, seeth wilde Mints in wine and drinke it with suger. Gomor passion or fluxe of nature, vse powder of Mints dried in an Ouen. Abhorring meat, eate new sodden egges with sauce of Mints and vineger. Belly bound, drinke the iuice of Mints with warme water. Headach of reume, stampe greene Mints with Ladanum and vineger and apply it. Morphue, mixe powder of Lupines and Mints with vineger anoynt. Put the iuice of Rue and mints together into the Nose, to amend the brayne and void all stinke of the mouth or nose. Reines running, seethe Cassia Lignea, Mints, and housleeke in vineger and plaster it to the reines. Paps with curded milke, seethe the rootes of Holyoke, and grinde them with yolkes of egs, saffron and Mints, and apply it. Shingles or holy fires, mixe Rue and Mints with oyle and vineger, and anoynt therewith to helpe it the same day. Pissing against will, vse the iuice of Mints with Treacle. Spitting of matter or quyttor from the Lungs, vse powder of Mints with other medicines. Forgetfulnesse or Lethargie, seeth red Mints Rue in strong vineger, and draw vp the vapour thereof into thy Nose. Headach and dasing, of cold cause, apply Mints. Mouth stink, wash wt the decoction of Aniseeds, Cloues Mints, or wash with Mint water, or rub it with the powder. Appetite, eate Sage, Parsley, Mints Pepper with vineger, with fish or flesh, or vse Cardamon with the iuice of Mints. Heart griefes generall, steepe Sage Mints in white wine, and seeth it and drinke the wine, apply the herbes to cause appetite. Stomacke weake and to cause good digestion, boyle powder of Mints with twise so much suger till it be thicke, and keepe it in a wide mouthed glasse, and vse it. Head impost. put the iuice into thy eare three or foure nights. Wormes, frye wormewood and Mints ana like much with salt Butter, and put vineger to it and a little of the Gaule of a beast, and apply it to the belly. Emerods, sit ouer the smoke of dried Mints laid vpo~ coles of Ash wood. Agew cake, frye red Mints and red Nettles and wormwood of ech an handfull, with fresh butter apply them as hote as may be suffered. Mouth stinke, wash wt the iuice, water or decoction of Mints with some white vineger, or put the iuice of Rue and blacke Mints into the Nose, of ech like: prooued. Iaundies, drinke the broath of Mints sodden with an olde cocke with Cinamome and Maces. Vomite to stop, Apply wheat Branne with the iuice of Mints and the white of an egge, or apply the iuice with Frankincense and a little vineger boyled together to the pit of the stomacke. Chollicke, drinke the iuice of Mints with eight cornes of Pepper and a little Hony. Wormes, drinke the iuice with Goates milke. Mad, stampe water Mints and apply them to the mids of the browe, and nape of the necke, first tickling the brow to bring sleep, but if he be farre gone, cleane a Tench, and apply the one halfe warme before, and the other behinde. Consumption, vse powder of Mints in thy broaths, and the water of them in thy drinks. Vomit to stop, stampe them with burnt bread and vineger, and heate it on a hote tyle or bricke, and apply it to the stomacke. Loynes paine, apply the seedes of wilde Mints with wheate flowre. Loynes and Belly paine, drinke two drammes of the powder of water Mints with iii. ounces of water of Radish. Pappes hard with concongealed milke, seethe Mints with oyle and wine, and apply it. For watrie skabs in childrens hands, mixe the iuice with vineger and Brimstone and anoynt therewith with a feather. Ache and swelling in the stomacke or belly, seeth with Rue in sweete milke, and drinke it. Vomiting much, seethe it with Cummin in wine, and drinke it or eate it. Hycket, apply powder of Dill seede with the iuice of Mints to the stomacke. The iuice of Mint Roman or white Mint, killeth wormes in the belly, in the Nostrels. Browne or garden Mints, vse the decoction of them for the stopping of the Liuer milt, kidneys and bladder. Tetters, anoynt with the iuice of Mints, vineger brimstone and be whole. Side paine, stampe Mints and seeth them in olde wine or ale, drinke it with xx. graines of Pepper in the night. Hoarsenesse, stampe the crops of Mints, Sage, Fiueleafe Ginger, and Lycoras, and seeth them in stale ale streine it and drinke it hote morne euen, as often as neede is. Dropsie, take nine crops of Mints, nine crops of blinde Nettles, and nine crops of Sage, stampe them and drinke them with stale ale morne and euen, or eate water Cresses with Mints and Parsley dayly. Stomacke griefes, stampe Mints, Sage, Cammomile, and good store of Wormewood and sower bread, and boyle them in vineger and apply it warme to the stomacke. and swellings in the head, stampe Mint Royall and apply it. Ache and stinke in the teeth, seeth it in white wine and vineger, and wash the mouth therewith and rub them with the powder of it. Stitch, seethe two or three handfuls of red Mints, and a handfull of Sage crops in running water to the one halfe, and apply it as hote as may bee suffered in a linnen bag, and warme it againe as often as neede is. Botch to auoyde and vanish away, drinke the iuice of Mint rootes one spoonefull, with some Treacle. Breast flegme, drinke the crops of red Mints, red Nettles and Wormewood, with wine or stale ale first and last. Mad dog Memory Milke to drie vp Milt griefes stopt Sleepe to cause Spitting blood matter Sores Stitch Stomak bad Tetter Throat rough Tongue rough Venom Voyce ill Vomit blood matter Vomiting much The roote drunke with wine prouoketh the termes, voideth the seconds and dead birth, and purgeth women after their deliuerance: it prouoketh vrine, is good against all venemous bitings. The same boyled in the broth of flesh, doth cleanse the breast from flegme and all corruption, and is very good for such as be leane vnlusty, or falling into a consumption. It is good to be drunke with wine in the plague time, for they that haue drunke it three or foure times shall not be infected with the plague. Some steepe the sliced roote in white wine all night, drinke it in the morning with suger, and so it giueth three or foure stooles or seeges. The iuice with powder of burnt Allom killeth the kanker in the mouth or throate. Dead childe Flegme Flowers stopt Kanker Leannesse Mouth kanker Plague Ptisicke Purgation Seconds Throate kanker Vrin stopt Milfoyle. MIlfoile or Yarrowe: The decoction thereof doeth cure the bloody flixe and all other laskes, and the excessiue fluxe of the termes, being also applied, or the suffumigation of the decoction thereof receiued vp into the naturall place. Stampe it and apply it to wounds to stop the blood, to keep it from inflammation and swelling, and to cure them, and to stop bleeding at the Nose. Seethe it in wine by it selfe, or with wound herbes, to heale wounds and bitings, and to dissolue bruised blood. It killeth wormes, and expelleth poyson out of the body, and helpeth the ach of the belly. Vse it in salues and plasters to cleanse, drie and heale sores. Stampe the greene herbe and apply it to heale vp wounds as if they were sowed vp. Stampe it and apply it to stoppe the termes, it is a secrete experience amongst women. Drinke it with vineger against the stone, stopping of the Vrine, and to dissolue bruised blood. Bloody flixe, drinke the iuice of it and Planten with wine or ale.
