Fluxes, stampe it and drinke it euery foure and twentie houres. The iuice with oyle rubbed, causeth curled haire, with hony it causeth haire to grow. Megrem, drinke the iuice of Yarrow three dayes in May, with Marygolds, Balsamin and Auens, of ech like much. Restoratiue, mixe the iuice with wheat flowre and yolks of egs, and bake cakes thereof eate them Belly grinding, drinke the iuice of it and Planten ana with warme water. Wormes in the flesh, stampe it Parietarie with a little salt, and apply them twise or thrise. Fundament fig, stampe it and Polypody of the oke drinke them with ale. Wounds bleeding, mixe powder of it of Bole armoniak with the white of an egge, apply it. Emerodes, drinke the iuice of Yarrowe, Mouseare and Betony often, of ech like much. Reines griefe, drinke the iuice of it Centory with vineger, and anoynt the backe with Agrippa. Teeth ach, sup the iuice often, but swallow it not downe. Bloody fluxe, stampe it with as much Planten, and drink it with red wine three or foure dayes. Emerodes bleeding, drinke the iuice of it and cast on powder of burnt Garlike, they will die. Eyes dropping and teares, stampe it with a litle incense, and steepe it in white wine seuen dayes, then streine it and put in a drop or two at night into the eyes. Backe paine, put the iuice into a glasse close luted, and set it into an Ouen to boile, there will be an oyle: wherewith, anoynt the backe. Emerods bleeding, stampe the rootes and drinke them with vineger, or stampe the herbe apply it often hote. Vomiting, boyle it in wine till the third part be wasted, drinke it: some put Louage and Rue to it. Deliuerance to cause, gather it on S. Iohn Baptists day at sunne setting, let a woman hold it in her hand to her right shoulder blade, and take it away as soone as the childe is borne. Stampe it with swines grease, to heale wounds and cuts. The same is good for the breast and side, and for them that cannot pisse. Drinke the iuice with vineger to helpe a wound marueilously that hath taken cold. To helpe many griefs of the body, drinke the powder or iuice of it with wine or good ale. It helpeth against heart burning. Bitings of mad dogs, stampe it with wheate and apply it. Veines or senowes cut, stampe it and apply it, and keepe it too three dayes. Fundament fig Heart burning Headach megrem Haire to curle to growe ad dog Nose bleeding Restoratiue Senowes cut Sickenesse generall Side paine Sores Stomacke weake Stone Teeth ache MIrabolanes citrine, or Yelowe, purge choller, and are good for hote complections being steeped in vergice of Grapes, or in Rose water, or the iuice of Fennell, they skowre The fine powder of them stop the watring and ouermuch moysture of the eyes. They may be taken in grosse powder from two drams to fiue drams, and in infusion from fiue drams to twentie drams. They make not a man weake, but rather strengthen the stomacke and all the inner partes. They keepe a man long yong, and cause a good colour, and sweet breath. They comfort the liuer, are good for ye trembling of the heart. They are good for the Emerods, and quench the heate of choller. Myrabolanes Chebuly preserued in syrope eaten, preserue youth excellently well. Mirabolan citrine well conserued, cause one to pisse well, one of them taken euery morning. Eyes heate running Heart trembling Liuer griefes Melancholy Mirth to cause Purgation MYrtle beries are very good for them that spit vomit, or pisse blood, for they stop all issues of blood, the termes, the laske and the sores and vlcers of the bladder: the dried iuice of Myrtles serueth well for all the aforesaide, and also for the weake and moist stomacke and venemous bitings. The decoction of the berries maketh the haire blacke, and keepeth it from falling, it cureth all the euill sores of the head, and cleanseth the same from skurfe and skales being often washed therewith. Wash outward vlcers sores with wine wherein the seedes haue bene boyled. It is good to be laid to the inflammation of the eyes that matter and run, with a little fine flowre. Sit ouer the decoction of the seeds and leaues to stoppe the flowers, and wash therewith members that be out of ioynt and burstings, to strengthen them. Apply the greene leaues to moyst sores, and to falling downe of humors in any part. The same with oyle of Roses or such like is good against consuming and rotten sores and vlcers, wilde fire, spreading tetters, and such like hot scabs and pushes. The dry leaues applyed with conuenient oyntments or salues, doe heale the exulceration of the nailes, and take away the sweat of all the body. Wash filthy sores of the priuities with wine of the decoction of it. The syrop of Mirtles is good for the cough and exulceration of the lungs, is thus made: take the iuice of Mirtles wel streined vi. li. boyle it with iii. li. of pure sugar, with a gentle fire, to the thicknes of hony or a syrop then vse it. Heate the seed in wine strein it, and drinke it to comfort the weake braine. The powder of the leaues is good to be cast vpon agnailes, and white flawes, the stinking sweat of the flanks armpits, and the sweating of the cardiak passion. The raw or burned leaues with a treat made of wax, healeth burning agnailes, and white flawes. The broth of Mirtles or Mirt seeds with butter, stoppeth the sweating too much. The leaues comfort the heart, and take away the trembling therof. The iuice is good for the burning of the bladder kidneys. An emplaster of Mirtles is good for the pyles and the falling downe of the fundament. Let not the Apothecaries, Physitions, nor Surgeons vse the shrub growing in fennes, called galtes in stead of ye right Mirtle, but procure those leaues yt come out of Italy. Bitings venemous Bladder heat Bloody fluxe Bones broken Braine weake Bruse Bursten Defensiue Drunkennesse Eyes griefes trembling Head sores Haire falling to be black Humours falling Ioints out Lungs griefes Morphue white Kidneys heat Nailes vlcers Pyles Pissing blood Priuities sores Pushes Teethach, hold it vnder thy tongue, and eate Sage euery day twise or thrise. Eares apost. and running, seethe it in oyle Oliue and put it in warme. Swallowe as much as a beane for the olde cough, shortnesse of breath, and paine of the sides. The fume thereof clenseth and openeth the matrixe and draweth downe the termes and birth. To cause deliuerance, drinke as much as a good nut with good wine. Pissing bed, and for the griefes of the stomacke, seethe it in good wine and drinke it. Fundament fallen, cast powder of Mirrhe, Aloes, Galls Frankincense of ech like much. Head scall, shaue it wash it and cast on pouder of Mirrhe, Aloes, and Frankincense. Canker when it is killed, heale vp the sore with pouder of Mirrhe. Matrix fallen, drinke powder of a Harts horn, Bay leaues and Mirrhe of ech like much with wine or ale. Noli me tangere in the nose or face, mixe Ginger with the iuice of Rue and anoynt. Yard pushes, strawe on powder of Mirrhe, and stamp the leaues of greent Mints and apply them. Wormes to kill, take Mirrhe and Aloes cicatrin. in powder. powder incarnatiue to bee throwen into wounds, take Mirrhe iii. drams, Aloes iiii. drams, Olibanum two drams, but if you suspect bleeding, vse Bolarmon. wt oyle of roses. Fistula or canker, the milky iuice of Tithymall with fresh swines grease, melt them, and put thereto powder of Mirrhe, and put in tents to the bottome to kill them quite. Wormes, drinke powder of Aloes, brimstone and Mirrhe, or for children, anoynt the stomacke with aqua vitae, and cast on powder of Mirrhe. To fasten the gums and loose teeth, mixe a little Mirrhe with wine and oyle, and wash therewith. Mirrhe preserueth from putrifaction, both the intrals and all outward sores, wounds vlcers. Falling euil, to preserue thee from it, smell to Mirrhe dayly, and also drinke thereof sixe grayns with Betony water, and so it helpeth the griefes of the lungs, killeth wormes, and is good against the yelow water, but for wormes apply it also to the belly. It is good for the vlcers of the eyes, and gleweth together broken pieces of the bones of the head. It taketh away spots of the eyes, and is good in medicines for the olde cough and shortnesse of breath. Eares running, put in the gall of a goat, womans milke, hony and Mirrhe tempered together. The fume thereof taken at the mouth purgeth the head. Breasts and ribs paine, wash with water that Mirrhe and gum Arabik haue bene sodden in. Spetting blood and matter, take two drams of Leeksseeds and Mirrhe. Flowers stopt, drinke powder of Mirrhe, and Southrenwood with wine. Face noli me tangere Falling euill Fistula Flesh to grow Noli me tangere Pissing bed Putrifaction Ribs griefe Side griefe Parch it in a frying panne, and apply it in a bag to the torment of the belly, or to any other ache or paine, and any superfluous moysture, and to comfort the braine. For want of corne bread may be made of it, but it bindeth the belly and prouoketh vrine and nourisheth litle. Rost it, and stamp it, and make broth therewith with milke to stop the fluxe. Flowers to stop, apply a hot bag of it to the hips. Aches generall Belly ache Braine to comfort Flowers to stop Fluxes Vrine stopt Misselto. The leaues with the fruit and tarre and wax, doe consume and soften hard swellings botches about the secret partes and other rebellious impostumes and cold swellings. The same leaues and fruit with Frankincense, doe cure all old vlcers and sores and great corrupt and euill impostumes. And with Arsnick, they cure felons and naughtie sores which rise in the toes and fingers ends. The seede stampt with wine lees, doeth waste and cure the hardnes of the milt being applied to the side. The wood of that which groweth in okes, is good against the falling sicknesse the apoplexia being hanged about the neck. Lay Misselto to ye head to draw forth euil humors. Drink it for the falling euil. Missel birdlime, hath power to soften ripen apostumes with rosin and wax. Misselto of the oke, hasill, or pearetree gathered, so that it touch not the ground, made into pouder and drunk with wine, is good against the falling sicknesse, and so is beads made thereof and hanged about the neck, or put in a siluer tablet and hanged about the neck. The iuice of any kinde of Misselto put into the eares doeth clense them, soften them, and take away their paine. Misselto stampt and applied, driueth away knots, kernels and swellings. Mixt with chalke dregs of wine, it taketh away the roughnesse of the nayles. Drinke the iuice with rauensegs to helpe the or gather it in March, and To cause conception, drink it with wine before or after the termes. The powder of the seede and root mixt with oyle and anoynted killeth lice nits and scurfe. MOckgelouer, or Dwarfe gentian, chop it small, &c. (See Dwarfe gentian. The green leaues stamped with parched barly mease, is marueilous good against S. Anthonies fire, corrupt running vlcers, and all hote inflammations, and so is the iuice with oile of Roses, ceruse and litarge. The same by it selfe is good against headach, the heat of the stomacke, and all hote distemperance of the eares, eyes, liuer, milt, and bladder, being stampt and applied. The same with salt, dissolueth the apost. swellings behind the eares called Parotides being applied. The iuice mixt with the white of an egge and applied to the forehead, is good against all inflammations, rednes, reumes, fluxions, and all other hote diseases of the eyes. Flowers to stop, apply it with cotten as a supposicer. Morell is good against all diseases and accidents which neede cooling or restreining, tetters, hote scurfe and scabs. The iuice drunk, doeth helpe the yelow iaundies, the burning of choller, but if one be euill at ease after it, let him drink Oximell simplex, put his finger into his mouth to vomit. Felon, drink the iuice of Morell and Planten, and apply the herbs. Lust to voyd, anoynt the priuities often with the iuice of Morell. Sleepe to cause, drink the iuice of greene Beries well clarified. Hands itch and worms, anoint with iuice of the lesse Morell Beries. Impost. in the stomacke, liuer or bowels, drink the iuice of Morell with a ptisand of barley to ripen it and destroy it. Gomer passion, anoynt thy yard and clothes with Camphire and the iuice of Morell. Lust to voyde, anoynt the yard with the iuice of great Morel, Housleek vineger. Sores ranckling in the hand, apply the iuice of Morell with a possit curd. For any thing fallen into the eare, put in the iuice. Emerods and swelling of the fundament, heat Morell on a tilestone and apply it. Fundament falling, stamp Morell with as much Houndstong, and seethe it in ale, and drink it, stamp Garlik, and fill the orifice with it, it wil draw it in heale it. Wounds aking, burning, ranckling, the iuice of Morell Planten, Smallach, with hony, barly meale, or wheat flower, whites of egs, and apply it cold. Pety Morell, the leaues, and branches, fruit, are best greene, they are good for stopping of the milt liuer, for the yelow iaundies, the iuice drunk wt a litle Rubarb. Impost. in any part, seethe the iuice with barly water drink it. Yard chafed, boyle the iuice with Linseed barowes grease, and apply it hot. It helpeth also the sorenesse of the yard womens brests. Ach or gouts in the armes or bones, Morel with oyle, let it stand ix. daies, then strein it anoynt therewith by the fire. Nightshade for biting of a mad dog, seethe it with milke strein it drink it with sugar: prooued. Burne Nightshade, blow the powder into the mouth for the stink thereof. Haire not to fall, seethe the roots with Mustardseed in wine wash therewith. Armes ache Belly ache Bitings venemous Bladder hote Bones ache Brests sore Choller Eares griefes Mouth stink Neck swollen Ranckling Reins running S. Anthonies fire Sleepe to cause Scabs Scurfe Sores Stomack hote Swellings Tetters Vlcers hote Wounds Yarde chafed Seethe the herb and root in wine and drink it against all griefes that Scabious serueth for, and also against the plague, and to dissolue brused blood. Seethe the roote in wine and drinke it against the paine of the mother, and against all poyson. Stamp the greene herb with the root and apply it to ripen and heale carbuncles, botches, and plague sores. Mixe the distilly water, or the iuice with Vitriall, to dry vp and heale all pushes, whelks, moyst scabs, &c. Eat the root by it selfe, or drinke the wine of the decoction of it, for the paine of the mother, and to saue a man from the plague or pestilent ayre. Drinke the powder to kill wormes. Stamp the herbe and apply it to brusings and bitings. Throat squincy or apostume, seethe it in milke or water and gargarise therewith as hot as may be suffered. Feuers in children, hang the root and herb about their necks, and let the nurse drinke powder of cristall, or steepe it in wine and drinke it. Plague sore Poyson Pushes Side stitch Squincy Scabs Stitch Throat swollen Wormes Mosse. It is good to be put into all salues, oyntments and oyles that be astringent. Mosse of the Cedar is best, then that of the Poplar, and then that of the Oke. Mosse of the earth sodden in wine and drunke breaketh and expelleth the stone. Stampe it and seethe it in wine and apply it to any ache or gout. The same put into a vessell of wine and stopt in a few dayes restoreth the wine againe being dead, (see in all seuerall trees.) Matrix white flux, foment with the decoction of Mosse and trees. Ache of knees or ioynts, fry Mosse of trees with butter and apply it. Gout Ioynts ache Knees ache Flowers to stop Matrix flux Nose bleeding Stone Wine dead Whites Motherwort. MOtherwort: bruse it and apply it to wounds to keepe them from impostumation inflammation, to stop the blood, and to cure them. It is of wonderfull force against the griefes of the heart, it helpeth crampes and palsies, it killeth wormes in the body, it cleanseth the breast from flegme, it openeth colde obstructions, it prouoketh vrine and termes, the iuice or decoction being drunke. sponefull of the powder of it drunke, helpeth ye hard labours of women, or seeth it with red nettles in wine and drinke it. Matrix suffoc. drinke the iuice, or drink the iuice of it with Feuerfue, with grosse pepper in olde ale, and be whole. Crampes Deliuerance Falling euill Flowers stopt Heart griefes Matrix suffoc. MOuseare: seethe the roote and leaues, and drinke ye broth to coole all wounds inward outward, and also hernies, ruptures, and burstings. The iuice of the greater Mouseare put into the eares, cleanseth them from all filth and ache. The same vsed in meates, cleareth the sight, and cureth the rednesse of the eyes. Gather the roote in May, and vse it against all ruptures, wounds, and the whites and reds in women, and to heale a broken head. If it be giuen any way to horses, they cannot be hurt in shooeing. Fundament figge, stampe it with Yarrowe, Planten, and Morell, of eache like much, drinke it with water. Stampe it and streine it with stale ale, and giue it a wounded man, if he keepe it, he shall liue, or els not. Fistula to heale, gather it kneeling saying the Lords prayer, and drinke the iuice For all euils in the stomacke, stampe it with Egrimonie, Barowes grease vineger, and frye them together, apply it to the backe as hote as may be suffered. Skabs dry, seethe it and hearbe Benit, of eache like much in running water, wash therewith. drinke the iuice of Mouseare with wine or ale. Emerods, drinke the iuice of Mouseare, Betony, Yarowe often. Iaundies, seethe it in wine or water, and drinke it. For the stone stopping of the vrine, stampe Mouseare and Hilwort, of eache halfe a handfull, with ix. quicke Bees, and streine all together with a litle white wine or stale ale, and drinke it, for it is excellent. For the wind chollike, stampe it with as much Prosper, and seethe them in a double vessell with white wine, and streine it and drinke it with sugar. Chollike Eares griefes Eyes griefes Emerods Fig in fundament Fistula Flowers to stop Fundament fig Horse griefe Iaundies Skabs Squincy Stomake griefes Stone Vrine stopt Voyce ill Whites Windinesse Woundes generall MVgwort: stomacke paine, stamp it wt oile of sweete Almo~ds and apply it. Ioints ache and shaking, anoint with the iuice, and oyle of Roses. It helpeth also the drawing and shrinking of the sinowes. Put it into Beere vessels to keepe it from sowring. Cary it about thee to keepe thee from wearinesse and venemous bitings. Seethe it in oile, till the third part of the oyle be wasted, anoint any ache or goute therewith to put it away quickely. Seeth it in water apply it to a womans nauel and thighs whe~ she is in labour, or apply it raw, that she may haue speedy deliuerance of the childe and seconds, but if it tary long, the matrix will follow. stampe it with Egrimony, Betony, olde greace, and vineger or vergis, and apply it iii. or iiii. times. Sit ouer the fume of it, to bring downe the flowers, dead birth; and seconds. the matrix, breaketh ye stone, prouoketh termes vrine yt is stopt. Apply it to ye nether part of ye belly to prouoke ye termes, or put it into ye matrix, or ye iuice thereof with myrrhe, or drinke iii. drams of the tops leaues for the same purpose, and to cleanse ye matrixe. Stampe it spurge wt oile of sweete Almons, apply it to the stomacke for ye paine therof, to bring health. It is good in womens baths, it comforteth, clenseth, warmeth the matrix, breaketh the stone. Stampe it with swines grease, apply it to the ache of ye feete comming by wearines. Drinke ounces of the iuice with white wine for the griefe of the bladder the strangury. Drinke the powder thereof wt honied wine or water to auoide the ache of ye intrales or bowels. Mixe the iuice with swines grease vineger, apply it to ye ache of the hips iii. dayes together. The smoke of it maketh children ioyfull, and driueth away the incursions of ye euill. For ache and swelling of the sinowes, stamp it wt oile, apply it. For great ach of ye feete, eate ye roots thereof with hony, it is scarse to be credited howe great vertue it hath. Anoint with the iuice oyle of Roses against the feuer. The powder thereof and of Horehound strawed on the Emerods, healeth them. Drinke it with wine for the yellowe Iaundies, to comfort the stomacke, and to cause a good colour. Bake wheate flowre with ye iuice of it, and eate it for ye bloody fluxe. To expel grauell stone, drinke euery day halfe a cupfull of the iuice. Flowers stopt, seeth it in wine, drinke it, or stampe it and apply it to the nauell thighes. Mixe ye iuice of that which hath but one stalke wt oile of Roses, anoint ye backebone pulses therewith to heale the feuer. Deliuerance, apply a plaster of Mugwort, to the left thigh, so vp to the nauell rawe, and also seeth thereof in white wine drinke it. Leapry, boyle ye iuice wt swines grease, and put thereto some brimstone and anoint. Mother suffocate, sliue great store of it downewards, boyle it to pap in running water, and wash therewith from the nauell to the shares and graines as hote as may be suffered, and as often as neede is, but not aboue the nauell, and at thrise doing it will be well. Cloues, Motherwort, Bursa pastoris &c. Flowers stopt, seeth it in oile, and apply it to the matrix after letting blood, or seethe it in any wine, and drinke it, or stampe it, and apply it greene in the night, or apply it to the nauell. For the strangurie in a colde cause, and paine in the bladder, drinke two drammes of the iuice. For womens griefes after deliuerance, boyle the yolkes of Egs in wine if she hatte no feuer, or else in water, if she haue a feuer, and stampe it with the iuice of Mugwort, and Cumminseede, and applie it: proued. Memory to be good, lay it in wine, and distill it, and drinke it fasting. Breast and ribs griefes generall, bruise and apply it and be whole in three dayes. Belly ache, stampe it apply it: or drinke the powder thereof for that griefe, and many others with wine and hony. see in Egrimonie. Mother suffoc. slip great store of the leaues downewards, and seethe them tender in running water and wash therewith from ye nauell downewardes, but not vpwardes when you goe to bed three nights and be whole. Gout paine, seethe a handfull in sweete oile oliue, till the third part be wasted, and anoint therewith. Chollike, seethe it with Sage and Smallach, of eache like much in good wine, till the third part be wasted, then streine it and drinke or v. ounces at once, as often as neede is. Feete paine, mixe the leaues and flowers with swines grease, and apply it. Feete chafed and skalded with trauell, stampe it frye it with Barowes grease, and apply it. Feuers hote, anoint the pulses and plants with the iuice. Flowers stopt, stampe it with as much Rue with oyle de Bay, put it in as a pessary in a linnen bag: proued. Goute, apply the leaues with blacke sope and wheate flower. Stone, seethe it with as much Parietary in a pottell of white wine to the one halfe, and apply it to the nauell as hote as may be suffered. Stampe it wt tallowe apply it to the ache sorenesse of the feete. Keepe it in the house, no wicked spirite shall come there. Stampe it wt running water, vse it for ye ache of the belly and many other griefs. To cause deliuerance of a dead child, stampe it apply it colde to ye wombe. MVlbery: the greene vnripe fruite dryed, doe stop the belly, the vomiting, being drunke with red wine. The ripe berries taken fasting, doe loosen the belly, but after meate they are soone corrupted in the stomacke, and cause windinesse. Of the iuice of ripe Mulberies is made a confection in maner of a syrupe, very good for vlcers hote swellings of ye tongue, mouth, and almonds of the throte. Burnings, apply the leaues with oyle. Seeth the barke of the roote in water, and drinke it to open the liuer and milt, to loosen the belly, and expell wormes both long and flat. hold the decoction of ye leaues and rootes in thy mouth. Skotch the roote about ye latter ende of haruest, and there will come forth a gum or iuice exceeding good for the and to driue away all swellings lumps, and It is to be had vnder ye roote on ye morow after it is skotcht. The iuice looseneth the belly, taken ii. ounces a halfe it is good for the bitings of ye field spider. The leaues are a soueraigne medicine for the squincie strangling. The barke is a treacle against ye poyson of Henbane. When ye tree beginneth to bud, ye chiefe cold of winter is past. Put ripe Mulberies into wine, if they swim, ye wine is pure, if they sinke, it is mixt with water. Drinke the powder of Mulberies to stop spitting of blood and the laske. seethe ye rinde of the roote in the iuice of a cluster of grapes to the one halfe, and wash therewith, and they will neuer ake, or seethe the scrapings of the roote in wine, and hold it in thy mouth. Apost. to breake, drinke very ripe Mulberies, and also apply them. Liuer stopt Lumps Milt stopt Mouth griefe Poyson Purgation Skalding Spitting blood Squincie Swellings MVllin: seeth it in wine, skom it drinke it, also wash the Emerods therewith to heale them. Bruse, wash ye sore, and anoint wt the iuice, apply the bruised leaues Emerods, stamp ye small leaues, fry them with sheepes suet, apply them in a linnen bag twise a day, keepe it warme. Apply powder of Mullin with the iuice of Horehound to breake their swelling. Horse cough, and broken winded, giue him powder of it to drinke in his water: Gentian will doe the like. Warts, stampe the flowers betweene two stones, and apply them, or apply the distilled water of them. Eyes red and dropping, wash with the water of Mullin. Matrix windie, apply the iuice of Mullin and Rapes with Barlye meale. Burnings, bathe it with the water distilled in a Limbecke, or with barbars lee, or anoint it presently with hony. Skab and itch, distill the flowers leaues in a Limbecke, and vse the water with cloutes. Wounds to close vp, stampe the flowers, and apply them. Emerods, sit ouer the fume of the rootes, or stampe Mullin, and seethe it in good red wine and apply it: or mixe the iuice with as much Barowes grease by litle and litle, and anoint therewith warme: or apply Mallowes sodden in running water hote. Bleeding in any place, stampe it and apply it to the branches of the teates. Belly loose, drinke one knot of the roote of it. Emerods, seethe it in wine, and apply it, or apply the rust or skalles of iron, with the iuice of it, or apply the iuice mixt with Antimonium and silke. Tenesmus, seethe it and stampe it, and apply it to the fundament, or sit ouer the fume of it. Feuer tertian, put the iuice of it into the nostrels before the fit. Bitings venemous stingings, put in the iuice, and apply the rest. Fundament falling, frye it with sheepes tallowe, and mixe it with oile Oliue, and apply it hote. Goute colde, seethe it in wine and apply it. Wounds of sword, or staffe, wash it with white wine warme, put in the iuice, and apply the substance, and binde it fast to a whole day. Emerods, boyle two leaues with fresh butter in a sawser till they be soft, apply them hote as may be suffered. Flowers stopt, binde it to the soles of the feete, flowers to stop, binde it to the arme pits. Fundament fig, an anodine infallible, stampe Mullin with as much salt, and apply it either to man or beast: proued. Canker in the mouth or gums, seeth the rootes in strong vineger, and wash therewith ii. or iii. times a day, and anoint it with alome hony incorporated together. Piles, seeth ye leaues soft in water and mixe them with May butter, and anoint therewith. Leapry and falling of ye haire, seethe it wt Scabious in water, bathe therewith. Seeth the roote in red wine drinke it to stop and heale ye dangerous fluxe, the For ye cold cough all ruptures, boile it in water drinke it. Dry Figs wrapt in Mullin leaues, may be long kept from corruption. The leaues are good to wipe and cleanse the Emerods withall. Seeth the leaues in wine and wash the mouth therewith for the griefes thereof. Stampe the leaues iuice, and apply it to any bruise or stroke The leaues and flowers allayeth all ache both inward and outward. The roote sodden in red wine, or in a feuer with water drunke, helpeth the white fluxe, and is good against al ruptures, fractures, bruises, griefes of the lungs, ye cough, al inward impostumes, all aches, inflammations. Eies inflamed, likewise the fundament priuy partes, and for all botches and goutes, seeth the leaues and flowers in water, and apply them. Vse the distilled water into the eyes to stop their running. Apply the same to all rednesse and pimples of the face, the shingles, S. Antonies fire, burnings, scabs, leapry. Stampe the herbe in a leaden morter with clarified hony, and put thereto wine and vineger, and vse it to heale vlcers stinging of waspes, adders, snakes. Burnings skaldings apply the iuice of the leaues with oile of Linseede. Kings euill, seeth the flowers in vineger, gargarise therewith, applie it. The roote, seede, or leafe sodden in wine and drunke, is good for all the griefes of the lungs, breastes, sides, and reines, and also casteth out of the flesh any thing therein fixed, as nayle, thorne, or pricke. good medicine for horses, kine, or swine, stampe Mullin, and put thereto Fenegreeke Madder with warme Ale, and giue it them with a horne or tunnell to cleanse and heale their lungs, and so to saue many that otherwayes would die. The leaues of that with the golden flowers sodden in water, are good for the swellings and inflammations of the eyes, and for sores and rottennesse with hony or wine, but with vineger they heale wounds. The blacke Mullin with his pleasant yellowe flowers, boyled in water or wine, is good against the diseases of the breast, lungs, spitting of rotten and corrupt matter. The leaues of the same boyled with Rue, doeth appease the paine of the side. And the same boyled in water are good for the cold swellings, and the vlcers, and inflammations of the eyes. And punned with hony and wine, they cure mortified vlcers, The golden flowers steeped in lee, coloureth the haire yellowe, being often washed with it. The seedes of Mullin is good to be drunke against burstings and falling out of ioynts, to cease the swelling and ache. running Face deformed Feuer quarten tertian Figs to keepe Fistula Flowers stopt Fluxes Haire falling to be yellowe Horse cough sicke Impostume Inflammation Ioynts out Itche Kanker Kings euill Leapry canker Pimples Prickes Reines griefes Saint Antonies fire Side griefes Chewe it, holde it vnder thy tongue for the palsey thereof. palsie in any place, seethe a bag of the seedes in wine, and apply it especially in the beginning of the sicknesse. Head to purge, prouoke sneesing with the powder of it. The seedes doe merueilously purge, breake the stone, comfort the stomacke. Stampe them wt Elecampana, and apply them to apost. to ripen, breake, and drawe them without paine. Gargle the seedes with water hony, to helpe the blistering of the mouth and the squincy. Mixe the seedes with Pellitory Ginger, of each like much with rosted hony, and wash the mouth therewith, holding it therein a good while to purge the braine, to voide and the falling of the roofe of the mouth, and vlcers of the throte. Mixe meale of the seedes with hony, and make litle balles of it, and swallowe downe thereof euery morning to haue a cleare voyce to sing in short time. Chew ye seedes to drawen flegme and purge the head. Hony with Mustard and vineger together, is an excellent gargarisme to purge the head, teeth, and throte. Mustard is good against al the griefes of the lungs, stomacke, flegme, and rawnesse of the guts, conducent foode to the body, prouoketh vrine, helpeth the palsie, wasteth the quarten, drieth vp moyst reumes applied plasterwise to the head. Hony and Mustard helpeth ye cough, and is good for the falling sicknes: but the common vse of it is ill for the eyes, it is good against all cold passions of the belly. Sneesing with Mustardseede may be holpen by holding bread to the nose. Grind Mustard with vineger, and rub the plants of the feete therewith to helpe the Lethargie. whole Egs in vineger till their shels be tender, and put thereto iiii. ounces of stamped Mustardseede, grinde them together, and anoint therewith spots of the face to cleanse and heale them. Boyle Mustard with vineger and pepper, and hold a spoonefull in thy mouth, and walke vp and downe, and when it is colde, spit it out and take another to purge reume. The seede with vineger is good against all venemous bitings. The seedes ground with vineger is a holsome sause for hard and grosse meates either fish or flesh: for it helpeth digestion, warmeth ye stomacke, and prouoketh appetite. It is good in meates for them that be short winded, and stopt in the breast: for it ripeth and causeth to cast out rawe flegme from the stomacke and breast. The seedes chewed cleanseth the braine helpeth the toothache, and so it doeth mixt with mede and gargled. Gargarise with hony, Mustard, vineger against ye swelling of the vuula and almonds about the throte roote of the tongue, but if they be olde and hard, then take the iuice pressed out of the seede, mixe it with mede, and so it slaketh and consumeth such swellings hardnesse. Drinke the seedes with honied water against the shakings and fits of agues, and to prouoke vrine and the termes. Sneese with the seedes against the falling euill, and strangling of the mother. Senuie draweth from the bottome of griefes aches, and is good for the milt. With vineger it is good against all venemous bitings. Stampe it with figs, and apply it to the humming and noyse of the head and eares, and for deafenesse. The iuice of Senuie dried in the sunne, and after dissolued in hony, cleareth the sight, and taketh away the roughnesse of the eyebrowes. Apply a plaster to the head of them that haue the Lethargie and drowsie euill, to the sciatica, hardnesse of the milt, the dropsie of the belly, all colde griefes and diseases, especially when they are waxen olde to bring into them the heate againe, and to drawe forth the colde humors. Senuie with hony and new grease, or with a cerote of waxe, cureth the naughtie skurffe and skabs of the head, which cause the haire to fall off. It skowreth the face from all freckles and spots, and taketh away blewe markes that come of brusing. Laid to with vineger, it cureth leapries, wilde skabs, running skurfe, and bitings of serpents. The perfume thereof driueth away all venom and venemous beastes. Drinke Senuie wt wine to purge the braine, warme the stomacke, helpe digestion, prouoke lust, expell vrine, increase naturall seede, voide the continuall paine of the belly. Seeth it in wine, and drinke it against poyson and venemous bitings. Grinde it wt vineger, anoint therewith red pushes, tetters, creeping sores. Seeth ye meale thereof wt water hony, and vse it against al hard swellings old knots of ye iawes windpipe. Mixe the meale thereof with hony or fat, anoint thy head and beard therewith against ye falling of the haire, and to clense ye face and auoide blew marks of stripes bruses. With a fig vineger, it blistreth and draweth out old aches, dissolueth hardnes. good, and to voide the Lethargie, rub well the plants of the hands and feete with Mustard and vineger. For the sciatica swelling of liuer and milt, stampe the seedes with a third part of bread, dry figs, hony, and vineger: it is a noble plaster. For ye Goute of what cause soeuer it be, grinde the seedes with strong vineger, and apply it to the place till it be hote as may be well suffered, then take it of and anoint the place against the fire with grease of a male hog for a man, and of a female hog for a woman, and chafe it well in, and doe so three or foure times if neede be, it neuer fayleth. stampe the seedes and streine them with water, and mixe it with hony, and gargarise therewith. Childrens heads skalde, grinde the seedes with hony, and grinde therewith often to heale their skabs. Leapry, burne Haselnut shelles, and mixe the ashes with powder of the seedes, and Goose grease, and anoint. Lethargie, mixe powder of the seedes with the iuice of Smallache and vineger, and apply it. to clense it out, mixe powder of pepper with as much Mustard, and roll as much as a pease with thy tongue about thy mouth fasting. Cough, chewe the seedes in thy mouth, but doe not swallowe it downe. Oile of Senuy seede, grinde iiii. pound of the seede, with iiii. pound of oyle, and let it stand tenne dayes, then streine it and keepe it for palsies, goutes, stitches, and swellings. Litargie, anoint well thy head and forehead with Mustardseede and vineger, and binde it thereto all night. Agnailes, stampe the seedes with swines grease, and apply it. Litargy, anoint well thy head and forehead with the seedes and vineger, and binde it to all night. If a man stand in doubt of the palsie, let him eate ii. or iii. seedes with ii. cornes of pepper. Reume, shaue the head, and apply the seedes, or put the seedes in dry Figs, and eate them at night against reume, and stopping of the lungs. Spitting blood, fill Figges with the seedes, and seethe them in Claret wine, and eate the Figges, and drinke the wine at night to open the liuer, and haue breath at will. Dropsie, drinke the seedes or wine of the decoction thereof. Goute, mixe the seedes with a litle bread, drie Figs, hony and vineger, apply it. Feuers cold, as quotidians, and quartens, eate the seedes before the fit. Scrophules to cleanse, stampe the seedes with olde grease apply it. Forgetfull, rub ye soles of the feete with the seedes ground with vineger. Chollike, grinde the seedes with figs vineger, apply it cold. Plague, (see Haire not to fall, seethe the seedes with the rootes of Nightshade, and wash therewith. Matrix windie and swolne, seethe the seedes in water, and foment the place therewith. Tongue heauy by much moysture, mixe the seedes with hony, and hold as much as a beane in thy mouth, and also sucke thereof for the olde cough, and spit out the rest. Stampe the seedes, and boyle them with water, and drinke thereof fasting to helpe ye cough, (See Pepper, Alehoofe, Colewort. Palsie weakenesse of the stomacke of colde cause, and for the megreme, anoint with ye oyle. Head to purge, eate the seedes, and put some into the nose. Feuers generall, mixe Mustard with as much Treacle as a beane, and drinke it thrise before the fit. Stomacke ill, drinke Mustard and red vineger of eache a sauser full, with as much Treacle as a beane. Tongue palsie, chewe the seedes, and hold them vnder thy tongue. Seethe the seedes in wine with figs, and holde thereof in thy mouth till it be almost colde v. or vi. times a day for the old pose and cough, and to cleanse ye braine lungs. Seeth the seedes in water with Fenel rootes, and streine it, and put hony to it, and drinke it for the stopping of the milt. Milt hard, seeth the leaues in wine, and apply it. To ripen and breake an apostume, stampe the hearbe with hogs grease, and apply it. Strangurie, seeth the seedes in oyle and wine, and apply it. Sciatica, and other old sores, mixe the seedes with vineger, figs, white bread and hony, and apply it. Eate the seedes to sharpen the memorie and wits, to clense the belly, to breake the stone, to purge the vrine and menstrues, and to comfort ye stomacke. Surfet or fulnes, and want of digestion, eate a spoonefull of the dry seedes, drinke ii. or iii. spoonefull of water presently after it, and in the morning thou shalt be well. Tetter, grinde the seedes with hony, and apply it once or twise. Oyle of Senuie, grinde ye seedes with like waight of sallet oyle, and let it stand dayes, then streine it vse it for palsies, stitche, goutes, and swellings. Head megrem skalde skales skurfe reume (see pose olde Haire falling NAuewe sodden in two waters tender, hath indifferent nourishment betweene good and ill, but not well boyled, it is hard to digest, and causeth windinesse, and stopping of the veines and pores, so that it were good to boyle them in two waters, and the third time in fat broth of Beefe or Mutton, it nourisheth lesse then Rape or Turnip. The seedes are good against poyson, and therefore put into Treacles and preseruatiues. And being drunke, it is good against poyson and venome. NEnupher, or water Lillie, The roote or seede of the white boyled in wine and drunke, stoppeth the laske and bloody fluxe, and Tenasmus. Boyle it in white wine to cure the griefes of the milt and bladder. The seede and roote in decoctions drunke, is good against venus and fleshly lustes, or the same vsed in meates or powder, doeth the like, and drieth vp the seede of generation, and so doeth the roote bruised and applied to the genitours. The Conserue of the flowers is also good for all the aforesaide, and for hote burning Feuers, for the and to procure sweete sleepe, and auoide all Venerious dreames. The roote stampt and applied, is good for the paine and inflammation of the bladder, and stomacke. The same roote stampt with water, taketh away all spots of the skinne, being often rubbed therewith, and applied to wounds, it stauncheth blood, and being mixt with tarre, it cureth the naughty skurfe of ye head. The roote of yellow water Lillie boyled in thicke red wine and drunke, stoppeth the flowers, especially the whites, and so doeth the seede. The water of the flowers of the white, or the Conserue thereof, is good for all burning feuers in the plague time, and for the ethike and plurisie, the drye cough and thirst, the inflammation of the liuer and milt, and for the dayly white fluxe. The roote of the white sodden in red wine, is excellent good to stop the flowers, and so is the seede thereof. The water of the white helpeth the hote griefes of the head, the inflammation of the liuer milt, and all hote pushes. It helpeth the ache of the backe and kidneis, and so doeth the oyle thereof, which oyle helpeth also carbuncles, felons, vncomes, and hote apostumes, and vlcers, in any part of the body. The water healeth all hote griefes of the face, the morphewe skurfe, and all other griefes that come of hote cause. To drie vp the Emerods, or any sore, cast on powder of the leaues of Nenuphar or Canes. Bowels griefes, and watery ruptures, distill the flowers in Balneo mariae, and drinke ii. ounces of the water morne and euen Eyes ache, seeth the flowers in water and drop it in warme. Flowers to stop, vse powder of the roote or seede of yellowe water Lillies, it is the best medicin. Yard standing, or satiriasis, stampe water Lillie, and apply it. Stampe the flowers with wine, and drinke it to stop vomiting. Bloody fluxe Bursten Consumption Cough dry Carbuncle Dreames ill Eyes ache Emerods Face deformed Fellon Feuers hote Milt griefe hote stopt Morphewe Plague Plurisie Pushes hote Seede to bate Stomacke hote Tenasmus Thirst Vncomes Vomiting Vlcers Whites Yardstanding Nettle. NEttle: The seede of Romane Nettles mixt with Hony and licked often, cleanseth the breast from all tough slimie flegme rotten humors, is good for shortnesse of breath, the vehement cough of children, the inflammation of the Lungs, the olde purisie or Longsought. The same drunke with sweete wine, causeth lust, and helpeth the windinesse of the stomacke. And one scruple drunke with Mede after supper, causeth an easie vomite. The leaues boyled with Mussles and drunke, doe soften the belly and prouoke Vrine. The decoction of the leaues of all kinde of Nettles drunke with Myrrhe prouoketh the termes, and so doeth Nettle seedes drunke with sweete Wine. The iuice of the leaues gargled, helpeth much against the falling and inflammation of the Vuula. Biting of a mad dog, stampe the leaues with salt and apply them, and so it helpeth malignant Vlcers, Kankers and such like stinking sores, and all hard swellings, apostumes, botches behinde the eares. Milt hard, mixe the leaues with oyle and waxe, and apply it. Nose bleeding, stampe it and apply it to the Nose and forehead: but put into the Nose, it causeth it to bleede. Flowers to cause, stampe it with Myrre, and put it in as a Pessarie. Vse the buds of red Nettles in brothes at the spring of the yeere to cleanse the breast, breake winde, and expell vrine. Seeth the leaues in wine and drinke it to soften the belly, to expell winde and helpe the torments thereof, to purge the loynes, to prouoke vrine and lust: or seeth the seedes in newe wine, or mixe the seedes with Hony and licke it in: it helpeth also all inward wounds. Seeth the roote of the great keene Nettle in wine with Hony, and vse it against the olde and cold cough, wheasing, hoarsenesse, and to cleanse the Lungs, chest and breast, and helpe the Plurisie and other griefes of the breast, and of the Vuula comming of Viscus Humors. Gargarise therewith for the griefes of the mouth, but the seedes with Hony is best. Stampe the leaues with salt and apply it to the bitings of mad dogs, and to wounds, rotten sores, Gangrenes, euill vlcers, creeping sores and tetters, apostumes, hardnesse, cold swellings of the ioynts, milt, behinde the eares. Let him that is nettled, anoynt the place with oyle of Roses or of Oliues. The greene leaues applyed, setteth the Matrixe in the place, if it be fallen. The seedes drunke with Malmesie prouoketh lust, and openeth the Matrixe. The powder of the seeds with wine or broath, increaseth naturall seede. The seedes of red Nettles gathered betweene Saint Mary dayes, may serue poore men in stead of Pepper, and is as good as Pepper. The iuice with clarified Hony cleanseth the Lungs, stomacke and sides, and drunke with Ptisan, it cleanseth the belly and Matrixe. The leaues sodden wt fish or flesh, cleanseth the reines, backe bladder, and prouoketh vrin. And they are good against obstructions of the Liuer in colde causes, and kill wormes. The syrope thereof is most excellent to be drunke of women in their painefull trauell, and causeth speedy deliuerance. Stampe it and eate it with Hony for the shortnesse of breath and Plurisie, and to cleanse the breast, and so doth the decoction thereof with Barley. And the iuice gargled, cureth the apostume of the Vuula. Eaten with Onyons and yolkes of egs, it moueth Venus, looseneth the Belly, prouoketh vrine, and helpeth the ache of the kidneys. And drunke with Hempe seede, it helpeth the ache of the milt and side. Anoynt the arteries with the iuice to mitigate the feuerous heate of the Heart. Chewe the roote and hold it in thy mouth to stoppe any bleeding. Drinke one spoonefull of the powder of the red Nettle with a draught of red wine euery day to breake the stone, though it be neuer so great. Seeth red Nettles and Mallowes in water, and drinke thereof, and also sit ouer the fume of it. Cast a sicke mans water on a red Nettle, if it die by the next morning, hee shall die, if not, hee shall liue: or steepe it in his vrin foure and twentie houres for the same purpose. seedes with the white of an Egge, Frankincence, and Wheate flower, and apply it. Make Lee of the ashes of the rootes of Nettles, Colewurts and Brionye, and wash the payne of the head therewith. Drinke a spoonefull or more of the powder of the seedes with good wine, to asswage the payne and windinesse of the Matrixe. Licke in a scruple of the sayde powder, with syrope of Violets, to spit out Viscus matter and tough humors. Stampe the toppes of red Nettles, and seethe them in white wine in an earthen vessell to the one halfe, and drinke a good draught morne and euen ten dayes, and apply the herbe to the Fundament against the going out thereof, to heale it perfectly. Palsey, anoynt the place with sallet oyle, and cast on powder of Pepper, and lay too Nettles, and when the warmenesse is come into the member, take them away, and anoynt with the oyle for the Palsey. Whelkes or ploukes, anoynt with the rootes of Nettles and Dockes. Feare and fansie, carrie Nettles and Fiue leafe in thy hand. Spitting matter, licke in powder of the seede with syrope of Violets, or other Pectorall medicines, by a little at once. Children syriasis comming of inflammation of the brayne, Stampe Nettles with Populeon, and apply it to the temples and wrists at euery halfe houres ende, till it bee whole. Anoynt the forehead with the iuice of Greeke Nettles, to stop bleeding at the Nose, or chewe Nettle rootes till they may be swallowed downe. Gout, stampe keene Nettles and Sage of eche an handfull with Barrowes grease, and apply it. Sciatica, bruise the seedes and apply them, or if the payne bee not very vehement, apply Nettles vnstamped: but if it be vehement, stampe them and apply them, or stampe red Nettles two hands full with wheate branne and Deares sewet, and apply it as hote as may be suffered. For the Vuula, vse the iuice of Nettles and vineger. Head ach of blood, put powder of the seedes of red Nettles into thy Nose. Sweat to cause, seeth Nettles in oyle of Nuts, and anoynt therewith at nights. shaue it and stampe Nettle head with vineger, and anoynt when thou sweatest in thy bed two dayes, and it will grow no more. Headach, make Lee with white wine and Colewurts, and Nettles burned, and wash therewith. Cough, seethe the seedes in oyle and anoynt thy hands and feete. Stomacke flegme, seethe good store of Nettles in running water and butter till they be tender, and eate them. Womens breasts to bee soft, drinke Nettles and salt with ale. Fundament falling out, seethe red Nettle crops with white wine to the one halfe, and drinke thereof first and last, and apply the herbe hote as may bee suffered, and bee whole. Consumption, seethe a pinte of the iuice of yong Nettles, and skum it till it waxe red, then put thereto a quart of Malmesie and brewe them together a good space, then put in yolkes of egs well beaten, and Suger, and brewe them well together, and take thereof a reasonable draught morne and euen blood warme. Flesh to growe faire and well, stampe red Nettles with two or three cornes of salt and some May butter, apply it. Stone to breake and auoyde, chop the rootes of red Nettles, Parsley and Parietarie, in all two pound, steepe them in a quart of white wine foure and twentie houres, then distill them and drinke the water. Haire eaten with wormes, seethe Sage and Nettles in wine, and wash thy head therewith, and cast on powder of Nep. Blood to stop, stampe red Nettles and red Colewurts, and apply them. The tops of Nettles gathered when they begin to seede giuen to Hennes with a little Branne and Hempe seede, cause them to lay Egges all winter. Fish to catch, anoynt thy hand with the iuice of Greeke Nettles, and hold it in the water, and the fishes will come to it. Backe ach and bloody Vrine, take Polypody, water Cresses, and red Nettle croppes, of eche one handfull, seethe them in Ale and streine it and drinke it morne and euen with Sugar. Nose bleeding, drinke the iuice of red Nettles, with some Chaulke if neede bee, or make powder of Nettle seede, Bursa pastoris, and Camphere, and make little baules thereof with the iuice of Bursa Pastoris; and put them in, or drinke the iuice of red Nettles. Brused and voyding blood; drinke the iuice of the yong buds of red Nettles either by it selfe or with vineger, or with colde water, and there is none so corrupt blood but it will purifie it, nor no laske so great but it will stop it. Face false flegme, grynd powder of Ginger and brimstone, with hony and red Nettles and anoynt therewith. Agew cake, take Wormwood, red Nettles, red Mints ana one handfull, fry them with fresh butter, and apply it as hote as may be suffered, and vse other helps withall. Stone, seethe mother Time, and red Nettle crops of eche one handfull in a quart of white wine to the one halfe, then streine it, and put in halfe a spoonefull of sea Holly in powder, and drink thereof dayly. Womens griefes, let her drinke the iuice of red Nettles with ale, and cast her on her belly, and cast her haire into her mouth, and cause her to vomit. Wounds bleeding, stamp red Nettle crops with hony, and apply it, or bruse a good handfull of Nettles, and bind them hard to, to stop it presently. Blood to stop, chew the root well, and hold it in thy mouth, but swallow it not and thou shalt loose no blood, or blow in the powder of a Nettle into thy nose. Fundament chaps and emerods, lay brimstone on hot coales, and thereon blind Nettles, and sit ouer the fume thereof thrise. Matrix suffoc. stamp Nettles and put them into the matrix, and drinke Parsnep seede with wine. Brests swollen, seethe Nettels in vineger and apply them in all increase of the same, and for all swellings and hardnesse with oyle of Roses. Gout ache, seethe Nettles that grow in a hote ground and dry, in lee of vine ashes, and wash it therewith and apply the Nettles. Feuer tertian apply the like Nettles stampt with salt to the pulses of the armes before the fit. Stone to breake, drinke one spoonefull of powder of the root with white wine somewhat warme dayly, Fundament fallen, stamp the tops of red Nettles in a stone vessel vt supra. Brest to open to driue out grauell from the backe; drinke powder of the seeds. Fer quarten, stampe Nettles with copwebs and salt in a wooden dish, and apply it to the left arme, to take away the heate of the feuer. Gout, seethe Nettles in oyle and wine, and apply them hote two or three times. For voyding of blood at the fundament, and to stop all fluxes, drinke the iuice of the yong springs in the mornings by it selfe, or with some strong vineger and colde water. Hands scabd by the French pocks, seethe a handfull of leaues with Cinnamom, and Cloues, of eche two drams, and bath the hands with the fume thereof sodden in water. Emerods, cresty swellings of the fundament, and rednes of the face, apply the iuice or water of blind Nettles. Apost. to ripen, stampe greene Nettle seed and salt and apply it. Haire not to grow, anoynt the place with the warme blood of a Hare, and vpon that anoint with wild Nettle seed and oile Oliue. Dead flesh in sores, put in powder of Nettles to clense and cure it. Cough of cold cause, stampe the seeds and wixe them with hony, and vse it as an electuary, it dissolueth all cold humours. Brest to clense, seeth Nettles in barly water and drink it. It clenseth the stomack also, voydeth vomiting, helpeth the chollick, expelleth winde and colde out of the lungs, swelling of the belly, and the cause therof. The Nettle also is good for the griefes of the ioynts. Nose bleeding, burne red Nettles and their roots, and blowe in the powder. The iuice of red Nettles stoppeth all fluxes of blood at the Nose, bloody fluxe, of what cause soeuer they be, Emerods and all such like, &c. Ach, anoynt with the iuice of red Nettles. Conception to knowe, giue her the iuice of red Nettles, if she cast it vp, she is corrupted by man, if she keepe it, she is a maid. Face mesels, mixe bores greace with the iuice of Cresses and of Nettles of ech like much, and put quickesiluer to it and anoynt morne euen. Nostrels stinke, burne greene Nettles and mixe their powder with as much burnt Pepper, and blow it in to bedward. Palsie, if the skinne bee thicke by lacke of flesh, rub it well with crops of red Nettles, that the oyntment may the better goe in, which is this, Roste three or foure red Onyons tender, stampe them with foure times so much of the gaul of an Oxe or Bull all of one colour, and anoynt well the place till it bee drunke in, and wrappe thee well in a cleane sheete, and doe so nine nights, it will make the flesh growe, though it bee much away: and it serueth for all aches. Face salsflegme, anoynt with Barrowes grease, Mercury and red Nettles. Palsie, distill red Nettles with Iuniper and red wine, and drinke three spoones full morne and euen daily. Blood to stop of veine or senowe, stampe red Nettles and Colewurt leaues with Hogs doung and apply it. Deliuerance to cause, seethe red Nettles and Motherwurt in wine and drinke it. Lust to voyde, drinke red Nettle seedes and the flowers of Poplar or Willowe. Iaundies, seethe the rootes of red Nettles, red Dockes and Celondine in white wine, and put Hony to it, and drinke thereof morne and euen Drinke the iuice of Nettles with wine, to dissolue bruised blood. Flowers to stop, bruise Nettle roots, and apply them one night. Breast flegme, drinke the crops of red Nettles, red Mints and Wormewood with red wine or stale ale first and last. If a woman pisse on greene Nettles, and they die, she is no mayd. Cast a sicke mans Vrine on a red Nettle while it is warme, at night, if it be dead in the morning, he shall die, or els not. NIgella or Gyth: Drinke the seedes in wine to helpe shortnesse of breath, to dissolue all windinesse in the body, to prouoke vrine and termes, to increase milke. Drinke it with wine or water, or apply it to the Nauell to kill wormes, or anoynt with the oyle of the seede. Drinke one dram with water against all poysons and venemous bitings The fume thereof tosted or burned, driueth away all venemous beastes, and killeth flyes, bees and waspes. Head ach, apply it to the forehead with oyle of Arios, and put it often into the Nose against the Web and bloodshoting in the eyes in their beginning. Put the powder of it into a thinne bag and smell to it often to cure all Murres or Catarres and Poses, to drye the brayne, and to restore the smelling being lost. Boyle it with vineger and hold it in the mouth to swage the tooth ach. Chew it dry to cure the vlcers of the mouth. For Lentiles, Freckles and other spots in the face, to cleanse the skurfe and itch, and to soften olde, colde and hard swellings, stampe it with vineger and apply it. Steepe it in olde wine or stale vrine, to cause Cornes and Agnailes to fall off, being first scarrified round about. Apply the seedes with Rose vineger to the forehead against the Frensie. It serueth also for the same things that Coliander is good for. Droppe the iuice into the eyes, to heale the Epiphora, or dropping. Stampe it with an Oxe gaul and apply it to the belly to kill wormes. Wilde cockle that groweth in corne, is of the same kinde, and the iuice may be pressed forth as Opium, kept for medicin to cause sleepe. Ptisick, put powder thereof in a linnen cloth and smell to it often. Braine feeble, mixe powder of the seedes with oyle of Camomile or other oyle, and drop thereof into thy Nose in the mornings. Put the flower thereof into the Matrixe, to draw out all contents therein, as flowers, birth, seconds, &c. To drie vp milke in ye breasts, seethe the seedes in wine and drinke it. Face pimples and spots, grinde the seedes with flower and Hony, and anoynt to bedward, and in the morning wash with Parsley water. For fretting, roughnesse and skalie spots, bruise the seedes and boyle them to pap in vineger, and then mixe it with oyle of Nuts, and anoynt therewith to bedward: the meale of Orobus will doe the same, mixe the iuice of the roots of Peonye. Cockle drunke with Radish and a little salt, healeth the Kanker and other perilous wounds, comforteth the stomacke and Liuer, killeth wormes in the stomacke, prouoketh vrine, is good for the eyes. The suffumigation of it maketh women fruitfull without perill, and swageth the great paine of the Liuer. plaster of the meale therof with the iuice of wormwood laid to the nauil, killeth wormes. The seed steeped all night in wine, and the wine drunke in the morning, healeth the strangury, dissurie, Iliak passion: Nigella with flower and Hony anoynted, taketh away spots and pimples, being after washed with Parsley water. Consumptio~ Cornes Danger Deliuerance Dissurie Eyes web dropping sore Face deform. Matrixe to cleanse Milke to cause to drie vp Mouth sores Murre Poyson Pose Ptisicke Reume Seconds Skin deform. Skurfe Sleepe to cause Smelling lost Sneesing to cause Sores Stomacke weake Strangury Swellings Teeth ache Venom. NVtmegs doth heate and strengthen the stomacke that is cold and weake, especially the mouth of the stomacke: it maketh asweete breath, withstandeth vomiting, taketh away the Hicket howsoeuer it be taken. It is good against the paine and windinesse of the belly, and stoppings of the Liuer and milt, and being parched or dried at the fire, it stoppeth the laske, especially being taken with red wine. It is good for the mother, kidnies bladder: it helpeth the griefs that stop the vrine in them that pisse by drops, especially when the disease commeth of colde cause: it is good for other secret griefes, both in men and women. It breaketh and expelleth grauell, especially being first steeped or soked in oyle of sweete Almonds. It is vsed in cordials and wholesome receipts against coldnesse of the Liuer, cardiaks, stopping of the milt, the dropsie, vomiting, headach, swellings, bloody fluxes: it comforteth the muskles and veines of colde and olde people, it maketh the breath sweete, and putteth away trembling of the heart. The powder thereof mixt with oyle of Mints, and the forehead and temples anoynted therewith, is good against the coldnesse of the head or dulnesse of memorie. It is wholesome in Plasters for the stomacke, quilted in leather and silke. It is good in stewed brothes for them that are long sicke. But it is not good for sanguine men to vse Nutmegs much, because it will adust the blood, and maketh the face seeme as a visor of Corall. The best Nutmegs are red, fat, and heauie: the worst are blacke, light, and drie. It taketh away fumes of the stomacke, stoppeth the belly, digesteth meate, expelleth winde, comforteth the stomacke and liuer, and is good for freckles in the face, and ringwormes: it minisheth the greatnesse of the milt, it softeneth impostumes of the Liuer, and is good for the colde diseases of the Matrixe. Bruise fresh Nutmegs and heate them in a panne and presse them, and there will come out a salt oylish thing like waxe, called of some, oyle of Nutmegs: which is precious for al cold griefs of the ioynts and senowes, and of diuers other parts, and is good for colde husbands that would haue children. Nutmegs comfort the braine, sight, liuer, milt, and mouth of the stomacke. And taken last at night in a cawdell of Almonds or of Hempseede procureth sleepe. It is the best spice for students of all other, taken in drinke. Nutmegs condyted, as they may be had at the Apothecaries, are excellent. If any man be wounded and bleede inward, take the heauiest Nutmegs that can bee gotten, wash them, wipe them, and pare them, and let him eate them, and he shall deliuer the blood outward, and also by his ordure, make him as cleane as euer he was, so that the wound be kept well, and the same vsed till he hath recouered the state of health. Stomacke feeble and colde, eate halfe a Nutmeg in the morning. Boyle them in wine and drink it for coldnesse of the stomacke, and to helpe digestion: or boyle Nutmegs and Masticke in wine, and drinke it for the griefs of the stomake bowels, and to breake winde and to restore strength after sickenesse. Smell to a Nutmeg, to comfort the braine spirituall members. Stomacke cold, seeth Nutmegs, Maces, Fennel seede and Dill seede in wine and drinke it. Mouth stinke, vse powder of Nutmegs and Cloues, and forbeare meates of euill digestion, and rawe fruites. The oyle pressed out of it, is good for ye Emerods, especially mixt with oyle of Peaches. The same is good for the ache of the knees and the Sciatica being anointed therwith, and it killeth wormes. Ach Emerods Knees ach Lust to cause Sciatica Wormes Nuxmethel. NVxmethel: Foure graines with wine maketh a man drunken, two drams killeth a man presently, both it and the Nux vomica are fitter to catch fish, then to be taken into the body of a man: and whether fish or birds be taken therewith, let their stomacks be taken out presently. Birds and fish to take Drunkennesse to cause Nux vomica. NVx vomica either alone or with salt, causeth a strong vomite. It may be taken with twise so much seedes of Dill or Fennell, and so drunke with water warme, it causeth vomit of choller flegme, and of some worketh downewards. Pieces thereof eaten by crowes or rauens, they cannot flie away but that you may take them. Oke. OKe of Ierusalem or of Paradise boyled in wine and drunke, is good against the stopping of the breast, shortnesse of the breath, and difficultie thereof, and cutteth tough humors in the lungs and breast, and prouoketh vrine and termes. and such like, and it yeeldeth a good sauour and taste. Lay it into presses and wardrobes to defend clothes from mothes, and to giue them a sweete smell. Drinke it in wine to cleanse the Lungs, and to helpe the cough, sorenesse of the chest, and shortnesse of breath. Cough cold Flowers stopt Lungs griefes Mothes Vrine stopt Oliue. OLiue: The leaues applied, are good against serpige or wilde fire, and creeping sores, consuming Pocks, and such like hote humors and chollericke swellings. The same applied with Hony doe cleanse vlcers and swage all other tumors and swellings. They are good against all vlcers, inflammations and impostumes of the mouth and gummes of children, especially being washt with the decoction thereof. The iuice of them stoppeth the termes and all other fluxes of blood, taken inwardly or applyed outwardly. It is good also for rednesse, inflammations and vlcers of the eyes, to be put into collyries and medicines for the same, and to clense the eares from corruption. The greene and vnripe Oliues do strengthen the stomacke and cause appetite, especially being condited in brine, yet they bee hard of digestion, and nourish very little. The ripe Oliues ouerturne the stomacke, and cause wambling therein, they breede headach, and hurt the eyes. The oyle of vnripe Oliues called Omphacinum, doth stay and driue away the beginnings of tumors and inflammations, and doth coole the heate of burning vlcers exulcerations: it is good also against the rotten sores and filthy moysture of the gummes, it fasteneth loose teeth being applyed vpon the gummes with cotton or fine wooll. The oyle of ripe Oliues doth mollifie, swage paine, and dissolue tumors: it is good against the stifnesse of members and cramps, especially when it is mixt with good herbes or flowers, for it doeth easily draw out vnto it the qualities of them, with which it is sunned or other waies prepared or sodden. The leaues of the wilde Oliue tree broken and applied, doe stay chollerike apostumes and inflammations, creeping running sores, apostumes of the corners of the eyes, carbuncles and whiteflawes. And applyed with Hony, they take away crusts about sores and wounds. They skowre all filthy wounds, and driue away all inflammations, and sores called Pauos, and ioyne together the skinne that is pluckt off from the head. They are good for sores of the mouth, especially of yong children, being chewed in the mouth: the broth hath the same vertues. The iuice applied, stoppeth the termes, and is good for the disease of the eye, called Vua, and for wheales, sores, and falling downe of humors, and is therefore put into collyries and eye medicines: it is very good for the gnawing or biting of the eye lids. If you will haue the iuice serue you all the yeere through, stampe them and put wine or water to them, and drie the moisture in the sunne, and make it into litle cakes. But the iuice that is made of the wine, is stronger to bee laid vp, then that which is made with water: it helpeth the eares both if they be sore, and the skinne off, or any matter run out. The leaues applied with Barley meale, are good for the flixe. The leaues are burned with the flowers, that the ashes may serue in stead of spodium: and thus they be drest, Put them into an vnbaked pot that was neuer in the fire before, and stop the mouth of it perfectly with clay, and let the pot stand so long, till all other pots be baked ynough, then quench them while they are yet hote with wine, and kneade them together, and burne them together after the same maner once againe, then wash them and make them into little cakes: it is well knowen that this medicine is as good as spodium in the diseases of the eyes. The leaues of the set Oliue haue the same vertues, but gentler. The sweat or water that commeth forth of the tree when it is laid in the fire, healeth foule skuruie skabs being applyed. The seede of the Oliue tree applyed, helpeth skurfe and fretting, and wasting sores. That which is within the kernels, with fat and meale, driueth away skabbed or foule rough nayles. The Oliues that haue bene condited in salt, broken and applyed to burnings, will suffer no bladder to arise: they skowre foule woundes. The bryne of Oliues fasteneth loose teeth and gummes being washed therewith. The yellowe and fresh Oliue is better for the stomacke, but it The blacke, that is ripe, is disposed to corruption, and is euill for the stomacke, eyes, and head. If it be dried, it stoppeth fretting or wasting sores, and scattereth carbunckles: it is good to wash the gummes that haue filthy moysture, with the oyle of wilde Oliues, it fasteneth loose teeth being applyed with wooll or fine cloth, till they be white, and it will helpe them. No man can describe all the vertues of the oyle Oliue. Oliues eaten before meate, loosen the belly, and strengthen the stomacke, cleanse the liuer, &c. Being eaten with vineger, they loosen the bellie. Oyle Oliue taken with as much Renish wine or white wine, or powred in by Glister, helpeth much the Chollicke, Iliake, and paine of the stone. It may bee eaten with white bread in sops in stead of Butter, and so it looseneth the belly more then Butter. Drinke foure spoones full with as much Sacke or white wine warme, to prouoke an easie vomite, and to cleanse the stomake. Breath short or difficultie, dippe a sponge in hote oyle and apply it. Chollike, seeth rawe yarne in ashes and oyle and apply it to the Nauell and Reines. Burning, boyle Hony and oyle togther, and anoynt therewith: or boyle the inner barke of Eldren with oyle or newe greace with some Masticke and Frankincence, and waxe, and anoynt. Eares deafe, boyle Cummin in oyle Oliue and streine it, and drop it in. Earmes wormes, boyle quicke Lime in it and streine it, and put it in. Eyes web, put in a very small drop of oyle by it selfe. Face deformed, mixe soote with oyle and salte, and anoynt. Face red pushes, mixe ashes of burned Mice with oyle, and anoynt. Frensie, seeth Raphanus in oile, and anoynt the head therewith. Head skald, shaue it and anoynt it with oyle Oliue. Cods swollen, anoynt with the oyle and whites of Egs: it helpeth all swellings and heate, being beaten together. Haire to growe, mixe powder of Bees dried in a siue with oyle Oliue, and anoynt. To ripen a sore, roste it in an onyon and apply it. Yard vlcers and pushes, Foment with wine of the decoction of the leaues. Ranker in the Yard or els where, stampe the leaues with Hony apply them. Vomit to cause, drinke warme water with a little oyle, or dip a fether in (See Fig. Burning or skalding, beate the oyle wt water till it waxe white, and anoint. Seeth halfe a handfull of white salt in a pinte of oile dip therein, ii. or iii. handfuls of blackewell, binde it hote to the nauell bottome of the belly for the Chollike. Marmoll, anoint wt the oyle, apply a Platten leafe wash the sore euery morning wt madder water. Eyes dul, put in a very smal drop of the oyle. Goute, all aches, stampe iii. pound of Harts horne hearbe, with iii. pound of oyle, let it stand ix. dayes, then put to it a pint of water, and boyle it till the water be consumed and that it be greene, then streine it and vse it. Small pockes, drinke one spoonefull of oyle with iii. spoonefull of Malmesey, and as much Treacle as a beane blood warme. salue to destroy dead flesh, seethe a quart of oyle with a pound of red lead, till it be almost stiffe, then put halfe a pound of red lead more, and boyle it till it be a salue. Thirst to quench, drinke a litle warme water and oyle, and cast it vp againe often. Blood to restore, drinke halfe a pinte of Muscadell with one peniworth of oyle in the morning, and walke one houre after it. Burnings, beate the oyle with water, and anoint, and lay on a Wort leafe. Head skalde, put Brimstone and May butter to it, and vse it. Eares paine and dull, roste the oyle in a great Onion on the embers, and as it drinketh in, fill it with more: then pill it and streine it, and put thereof into the whole eare, and lye on the sore eare, and do so ix. nights if neede be. For the griefes of the stomacke, and many other partes, take two spoonefull of the oyle with as much aqua vitae, mornings together Thirst great, swallowe downe oyle with the yolke of an Egge. Chafing or galling, grinde oyle of Roses with the yolke of an Egge in a leadden morter with a leadden pestell, till it be thicke, and anoint therewith. Mixe one ounce of powder of Litarge with seuen ounces of oyle and a little white wine, and stirre it well in a porenger, till it come to a liquid oyntment, and anoint the burning Canker therewith. Bloody fluxe, drinke seuen Oliue leaues, and seuen cornes of Pepper with colde water. To cause deliuerance whether the childe be quicke or dead, drinke the milke of another woman mixt with oyle Oliue. Ache and swelling, mixe three partes of oyle with a fourth part of Salt, and anoint therewith euery other day. Hoarsenesse of vnkinde humors, eate a litle oyle with a reare Egge and Pepper, when you goe to bed. Emerods, plane a newe Oken boorde, heate it and anoint it with Sallet oyle, heate it againe, and sit thereon, and make a pannell of cloth with a hole against the fundament, sit on it a great while often be whole. Chincough, and other like, with paine in the breast, roste Sallet oyle in a great Apple in the embers, and presse it flat, and apply it to the breast as often as neede is. Burning and skalding, beate it with the white of an Eg, or with creame, till it be thicke, and anoint. Eares dull, boyle it with Frankincense, and skumme it cleane, and anoint the forehead and temples therewith from eare to eare. Wormes to kill, drinke a little of the oyle. Short winded, anoint the tongue and eares, and about the eares with the oyle and prouoke vomite. Eares griefes, let one that is fasting blowe in the oyle into his eare out of his mouth, and turne downe the head that the ordure may runne out. Biting of a mad dog, rub it with a newe cloth dipt in the oyle till it bleede. Eares dull, quarter a red Onion downeright, and boyle it in the oyle while one may say three Pater nosters, and streine out the iuice, and vse it: or seethe the dryed gall of an Oxe with the oyle and hony, of eache like much, with powder of litarge, and apply it. Goute, take oyle Oliue one pinte, May butter, Swines grease and hony, of eache like much, frye them with a gentle fyre and put thereto incense two ounces, and anoint therewith against the fyre any ache, swelling, or boneshawe, or seethe the leaues of Iuie, and Lorell with oyle Oliue, and anoint with the oyle, or temper Brimstone with oyle Oliue, and as much Vermilion, and anoint to cease it quickely, or stampe Henbane seede with oyle Oliue, and let it stand houres, then frye it and streine it and apply it, it helpeth by and bye. Make oyle of Roses with the greenest oyle Oliue. Waxe to increase, boyle oyle Oliue foure pound with the iuice of Dyers yellowe till it be yellowe, then put in waxe, and let them incorporate, and cast it into a vessell, and vse it. To take an escare of a bone out of the shinne, or elsewhere, heate oyle Oliue till it boyle, and powre it in hote, then stop it in with a linnen cloth, and apply a pladget of linnen cloth, dipt in the oyle, and aboue that a plaster of Basilicum, and so it will rise from the bone, and doe so at euery dressing. Eares deafe, dip a linnen cloute in oyle Oliue, and drop it into the eare, and put in the cloute after it, and lye vp therewith all night. ONions eaten often rawe, cause a rough throte, winde in the stomacke, and And mixt with hony, they take away the griefe of the stomacke, yet the eating of them doth harme the members, by drying vp the moysture of the body. Temper them with vineger, apply them to ye piles to open them. The eating of them doth soften the belly and cause thirst. The iuice with hony mendeth the sight, the paine and web, dropt into the eye. Rost them vnder the embers, and eate them morne and euen to cleanse the breast, voide swelling, purge the stomacke. Bruise an Onion with salt hony, apply it to warts to make them fall off by the rootes. Bruise them with vineger, and wash the skabbed skin therewith to make it whole and faire. Onions eaten rawe, cause lothesomnes to the stomacke, but they take away the stinke of the mouth. The iuice drawne vp into ye nose, purgeth the head. The iuice with ye iuice of Rue and hony, helpeth the biting of a mad dog being anointed on. The often eating of Onions harmeth the chollerike, but not the flegmatike. The iuice with Capons grease anointed on, helpeth rawe heeles and Seethe Onions, and cast away the first water, then seethe them in salt broth with other good spices, and so they are good for the stomacke, and cause better nourishment. Stampe an Onion with hony, and lay it to any wounde to heale it. Eares paine and noyse, drop in the iuice with womans milke. Sleepinesse and lethargie, drinke the iuice with the iuice of Rue hony. Apply the iuice with reasins figs to apostumes to breake draw them. The eating of Onions causeth fearefull dreames, especially in them that haue beene lately sicke. eaten of labouring people in the mornings, doeth greatly maintaine their health, and withstand the infection of the aire, especially with salt and bread, for so they lesse harme the head, but to others they are hurtfull, and cause madnesse, daseling of the eyes, and the Lethargie. Women slice Onions, and steepe them al night in spring water, and giue their children the water to kill and expell wormes. The continuall vse, especially of the seedes thereof, ingendreth naturall seede and lust. The iuice with hony cleareth the eyes, and dropt into the eare, helpeth the noyse and ache, and put into the nose, it purgeth the braine, and being anointed, it restoreth haire. The iuice with vineger anointed hote, taketh away the spots of the face, especially vnder the eyes. An Onion stampt with a fig, softneth and breaketh apostumes and vlcers, especially in the fundament. An Onion put in as a suppositorie, purgeth the Emerods, and draweth downe the flowers. great Onion rosted in the embers with some Treacle, and then pilled and applied, softneth and openeth all pestilent and venemous vlcers, and all other gatherings of euill humors hardnesse. Fry Onions with an Oxe gall sheepes tallowe, and apply it to any bruse to haue present helpe. Roste a spoonefull of Treacle in a great red Onion, and streine it with aqua vitae vineger, of eache one spoonefull, and drinke it against the plague as the best remedy and most present. Stampe iiii. or v. great rosted Onions with viii. ounces of aqua vitae, and iii. spoonefull of oyle, and boyle it till it be thicke, then streine it and anoint therewith morne and euen by the fire a quarter of an houre together, chafing it well in to helpe the sciatica. Rost oyle Oliue in an Onion, on the ember, and alwayes as it drinketh into the Onion, put in more, then take of the vttermost pill and streine it and put thereof into the whole eare ix. nightes when thou goest to bed, and lie on the sore eare, to voide the paine and deafenesse. Against water in the eare, apply the iuice of Onions with Goose grease. Put Onions and Leekes into Moldholes to make them come out. Onions eaten in meate open the belly gently, and cause vrine abundantly. Being laid to the fundament with oyle or vineger, they open ye Emerods, and so doth the iuice or ye whole Onion mixt wt rosted apples applied Onions sodden and applied with reasins and figs, doe ripen and breake wens, and such like cold swellings. Their iuice dropt into the eyes, cleareth the sight, at the beginning remoueth the spots, cloudes, hawes of the eye. The same is good for the noise, filthines, deafenes of the eares, put in as a Pessary, it bringeth downe ye flowers seconds. With Rue and salt it is good against the bitings of dogs.
